subject: Why is the Administration Cancelling Religion? 🚩
body:
DEI cuts unintentionally hurt religious freedom
 
 
DEI cuts unintentionally hurt religious freedom
 
Faith leaders pray over President Donald Trump after he signed an executive order establishing the White House Faith Office, Friday, Feb. 7, 2025. (White House photo) 
Why is the Administration Cancelling Religion?
Dear Larry Baker, 
The Trump administration is 
removing
 Diversity, Equality, and Inclusion (DEI) programs from government agencies. Critics of DEI rightly 
argue
 that these initiatives can sometimes prioritize surface-level diversity over merit, leading to hiring and promotions based more on identity than qualifications.
Meanwhile, President Donald Trump established a White House Faith Office tasked with safeguarding religious communities. Its 
responsibilities include
 
identifying instances where the executive branch fails to uphold constitutional and federal protections for religious liberty.
Know someone impacted? Please click and share my full article.
 
Throwing the Religious Baby Out With the DEI Bathwater
 
One unintended consequence of eliminating DEI programs has been the negative impact on religious liberty. As federal agencies discontinued their DEI initiatives, many faith-based programs for government employees, which were supported by DEI, were also shut down.
Programs I have personally engaged with, such as outreach trips by the U.S. Naval Academy Gospel Choir and employee resource groups (ERGs) within agencies like the 
U.S. Department of State
, have been canceled. These initiatives were made possible through DEI, and without it, they no longer exist. 
This is a failure to uphold protections for religious liberty - and America's corporations are taking note. 
 
Fortune 500 companies are noticing the Administration’s cancellation of DEI and its impact on religious initiatives. As a result, some corporations are feeling pressure to eliminate religious programs along with DEI efforts. 
How Faith-Based Employee Groups and Faith-Friendly Workplaces Support Religious Freedom
 
In today’s diverse workforce, religious freedom is essential for creating an inclusive and respectful work environment. Faith-based employee resource groups (ERGs) and faith-friendly workplace initiatives play a crucial role in supporting religious expression, fostering mutual understanding, and ensuring that employees of all faiths—and those without religious beliefs—feel valued and respected.
These initiatives not only strengthen workplace culture but also promote a sense of belonging for all employees. For many American workers, faith-based ERGs provide their primary source of religious fellowship. For example, a recent national 
study
 of Jewish workers found that 
for 24% of Jewish employees, their company’s ERG is their main connection to Jewish life
 (see chart). This highlights the significant role these groups play in fostering identity, community and freedom of religious expression in the workplace. 
 
The Price of Religious Freedom Denied is $Trillions
 
America’s success is significantly driven by the active contributions of religious communities. In fact, religion generates nearly 
$1.2 trillion
 in socio-economic value for the U.S. economy each year—equivalent to the world’s 15th largest national economy, surpassing roughly 180 other countries.  
To uphold this vital economic and social asset, the Administration’s America First agenda should reconsider policies that weaken this unique strength of the nation.
 
The socio-economic impact of religion in the U.S.
Please click and share my full article.
 
Check out related resources and new articles below.
Brian Grim
President
Religious Freedom & Business Foundation 
In the News
 
 
In some of the United States' largest companies, religious affinity groups—formed by employees of various faiths—serve as spaces for dialogue and advocacy. U.S. employers are required to accommodate employees' religious practices. By Alexis Buisson. 
Read more
. 
Research
 
 
Many workplace leaders avoid addressing religion explicitly for fear of conflict. But Ecklund, Daniels, and Scheitle argue that ignoring religion’s presence at work can cause more harm than good. This is the case because many employees 
want
 to express or practice their faith at work as part of bringing their authentic selves to work, and they feel excluded or stifled if discouraged from doing so. 
Read more
.  
The Power of Jewish ERGs: Findings From Clal’s Research Report, Jewish at Work 2024
 
 
Demand for Jewish ERGs is Growing: The movement for Jewish ERGs is gaining momentum, with 46% of new members joining since October 7, 2023. For 24% of participants, their company’s ERG is their primary connection to Jewish life—a powerful testament to the role these groups play in fostering identity and belonging. 
Read more
. 
Stay in touch:

subject: Luck won’t get you results—strategy will
body:
HR advice for better planning, communication, and data.
 
 
 
The Eightfold 
Take
 
 
 
MARCH NEWSLETTER
 
 
 
 
Success by design.
You can’t leave workforce planning to chance. The way work gets done is changing, and success requires a forward-looking strategy, real-time workforce insights, and the right technology. Just look at how market conditions and AI—especially agentic AI—have advanced since the start of the year. And it’s only March.
How are you planning for that? It’s not something that can be left to chance. Organizations that incorporate talent intelligence into their planning can develop internal talent, address emerging skill demands, and navigate economic and transformational uncertainty with greater confidence.
Take a look at how organizations, like 
Amdocs
 and the 
Department of Defense
, have incorporated talent intelligence into plans to develop internal talent, address emerging skill demands, and navigate economic and transformational uncertainty with greater confidence.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
VP of Talent-centered Transformation 
Eightfold AI
 
 
 
 
What two stubborn cats taught me about workplace alignment.
 
 
A couple years ago, we moved across the country with our cats, Phat Steve and Skunk Monkey. We had the idea of getting a shared leash and walking them when we stopped for gas.
It went so poorly. Phat Steve and Skunk Monkey took off in opposite directions, then both dropped to the ground. It was equal parts hilarious and annoying.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
We can look at misalignment in the workplace the same way. It’s what happens when teams, leaders, and strategies aren’t working together. Progress stops and frustration begins.
Strong alignment doesn’t just 
happen
 by luck—it takes intention, communication, and follow-through.
So, how do you start?
Get clear on your organization’s goals and expected outcomes.
Break down silos with cross-functional check-ins.
Keep feedback flowing.
To learn more about aligning HR and TA with business strategy, check out 
my recent webinar
 
from the Australasian Talent Conference (ATC).
(And no—Phat Steve and Skunk Monkey never did learn to work together while on the leash.)
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
from Rebecca Warren
Director of Talent-centered Transformation, Eightfold AI
 
 
 
Static systems aren’t a lucky strategy. AI is.
 
 
Lately, HR and talent leaders keep asking me the same question: 
How do I handle the rise of agentic AI workers
?
The reality is that work in the future won’t look remotely similar to work today. 
The latest report from The Josh Bersin Company, 
The Rise of the Superworker
, highlights how employees working alongside AI agents are reshaping the workforce, and why agility in systems and strategy is critical.
The organizations that will succeed are strategically stepping away from static systems and fixed processes and creating new ways of working with AI.
Read our top takeaways
 about how AI is shaping the next era of work.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
from Jenny Cotie Kangas
Director of Talent-centered Transformation, 
Eightfold AI
 
 
 
The right questions make HR data 
more powerful.
 
 
In your quest to be data-driven, you also need to be data-literate. This means being intentional about how you’re acquiring data and using it to support your organization.
HR leaders should ask of their data:
How can I tell a story with this information?
What opportunity does this data give me to influence or coach my colleagues?
Who is the right audience, or where is the biggest audience for this data?
What can the data NOT do?
Knowing the ground rules up front plays a major role in building trust and elevates the conversation from transactional to strategic.
Listen to this 
conversation
 on data and people analytics from The Josh Bersin Company to get a sense of how you can use your data to get ahead.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
from Teresa Wykes
Senior Director of Talent-centered Transformation, Eightfold AI
 
 
 
In other talent news...
 
 
2025 AI business predictions
: Your success with AI will be as much about vision as adoption. That means your choices around AI just might be the most critical of your career. Read PwC’s AI business predictions for insights into what you should look for in AI — and some results you can expect.
Trustworthy AI in practice
: The Deloitte AI Institute released a report outlining the importance of building trustworthy AI platforms. Learn more about how purposeful attention and effective governance make this possible.
Cultivate returns—reserve your spot
: Our premier talent event returns this May with a move to beautiful Southern California. We’re building an agenda full of provocative sessions, actionable advice, and a lot of fun. Join us!

talent leaders

subject: Pay Equity Weekly | Remediating Pay Inequities
body:
Why failing to address known pay inequities heightens your legal exposure.
 
Pay Equity Weekly
March 6, 2025
 
BLOG
Remediating Pay Inequities Is a Matter of Compliance 
 
Recent DEI executive orders should embolden — not dissuade — your pay equity remediation efforts. 
READ NOW
 
Key Resources
 
EU Pay Transparency Member State Transposition Monitor
 
More EU Member States are releasing draft legislation for proposed transposition of the EU Pay Transparency Directive. Track the latest developments with our monitor.
ACCESS NOW
 
Upcoming Deadlines
 
New Jersey Equal Pay Reporting Due March 31 
 
Contractors providing qualifying services with the state of New Jersey must submit Equal Pay Reports by March 31. Learn the details of how to comply in our guide.
ACCESS NOW
 
Webinar
 
March 19: Pay Equity vs. Pay Gap Reporting: Reconciling Your  Compensation and Payroll Data

subject: Don’t forget to register for the Leading Through Uncertainty Webinar March 19th
How KPMG, Lloyds, Legal & General build high-performing teams through neuroinclusion.
body:
Discover strategies to drive success and create an inclusive workplace for all.
 
Neurodiversity at Work: Success Strategies from Leading Brands
 
Live Panel Discussion | March 27, 2025 | 11 AM ET | 3 PM GMT 
Register now 
Neurodiversity isn’t just a conversation - it’s a competitive advantage. Yet many organizations still struggle to create environments where neurodivergent employees can truly thrive. 
On March 27, join industry leaders from 
KPMG
, 
Legal & General
, and 
Lloyds 
as they share proven strategies for building more inclusive workplaces that drive innovation, engagement, and business success. 
Why attend
 
Get real-world insights from top brands leading the way in neuroinclusion
 
Learn practical steps to attract, retain, and empower neurodivergent talent 
Understand how neurodiverse teams fuel creativity, problem-solving, and retention
 
This interactive panel discussion is your opportunity to 
ask questions, gain insights, and take away actionable strategies
 
to implement in your own workplace.
 
Don't miss out 
Meet the experts 
 
Christina Taylor, KPMG 
Inclusion & Equity Manager
 
Christina is a dedicated advocate for inclusion and diversity, particularly for individuals with disabilities, leveraging her professional experience and personal insights to drive positive change. 
 
Mark Lomas, Lloyds 
Head of Culture, Human Resources
 
Mark is a seasoned Diversity & Culture expert with a proven track record in driving impactful change, particularly in the financial services sector. 
 
Jacquline Alcindor, LGIM 
Equity, Inclusion & Diversity Lead
 
With a strong background in banking and an MBA from Westminster University, Jacquline brings strategic thinking and a results-oriented approach to her DEI work. 
Let's build workplaces where every brain can thrive. 
Secure your spot 
Kind regards, 
The Everway team 
formerly Texthelp

subject: 💡 Unlocking Brilliance: How to Build a Neurodiverse-Friendly Workplace
body:
Continue reading to learn how to support your neurodivergent talent. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hello Larry!
 
🔄
 
Remember This?
Earlier this week, I shared how many organizations unknowingly 
overlook neurodivergent employees
 (ADHD, autism, dyslexia, etc.).  
Traditional workplaces often 
expect one way of thinking and working
—leading to disengagement, burnout, and untapped potential. 
But it doesn’t have to be this way.  
Neurodivergent employees aren’t liabilities—they are untapped powerhouses of creativity, innovation, and problem-solving.
The key? 
Creating an environment that works for them, not against them.
 
 
Here’s how to start.
 
👇
 
 
🧠
 
1. Rethink “Productivity”
Not everyone thrives in the 
9-to-5, desk-bound
 work model. Some employees do their best thinking in 
short bursts
. Others need 
flexible schedules
 to align with their cognitive rhythms. 
✅
 
Strategy:
 Offer flexible work options—remote work, varied work hours, and project-based deadlines instead of rigid time blocks. 
 
💬
 
2. Communication Styles Matter
Neurodivergent employees may process verbal, written, or visual communication 
differently
. One person might struggle with 
long, detailed emails
, while another might find 
face-to-face conversations overwhelming
. 
✅
 
Strategy:
 Ask employees 
how they prefer to receive and share information.
 Use multiple formats—written summaries, bullet points, voice notes, or even quick check-ins—to support diverse communication needs. 
 
🏢
 
3. Create Sensory-Friendly Workspaces
Open offices, 
harsh lighting
, and constant noise can be 
overstimulating
 for neurodivergent employees. These distractions can 
tank productivity
 and make it hard to focus. 
✅
 
Strategy:
 Offer 
quiet workspaces, noise-canceling headphones, adjustable lighting, or remote work options
 to create ways for employees to do their best work. 
 
🛠️
 
4. Adjust Expectations Around Meetings
Traditional meetings can be draining for neurodivergent employees—especially those who need 
more processing time
 or struggle with 
verbal brainstorming on the spot
. 
✅
 
Strategy:
🔹
 
Provide agendas in advance
 so employees can prepare.
🔹
 Allow for 
written contributions
 for those who think better through text.
🔹
 Consider 
shorter, structured meetings
 to avoid unnecessary cognitive overload. 
 
🎯
 
5. Focus on Strengths, Not Deficits
Instead of expecting neurodivergent employees to 
fit into existing structures
, shape their roles around 
what they do best.
 
✅
 
Strategy:
 Identify and 
leverage their unique skills
—whether it’s pattern recognition, deep focus, problem-solving, or creativity—and align them with tasks that amplify those strengths. 
 
🎤
 
What’s Next? 
These changes 
don’t require a complete workplace overhaul
—just 
small, intentional shifts
 that can unlock 
game-changing potential
 in your team. 
 
 
🚀
 
Ready to Build a More Inclusive Workplace?
Schedule a complimentary call with me, and let’s craft a strategy for a more inclusive, engaged workforce.
📅
 
Book Your Strategy Session Now
 
 
 
Here’s to creating workplaces where all individuals can be their best!
Bye for now, 
Luiza
___________________________________
 
Luiza Dreasher, President and CEO (she/her/hers)
Mastering Cultural Differences 
I work with leaders who want to create a work environment where all employees feel valued and want to stay.
At 
Mastering Cultural Differences LLC,
 we are committed to helping organizations build inclusive, culturally competent workplaces where every individual feels valued and respected. Through highly customized programs, we equip teams with knowledge and skills to help them connect and collaborate more effectively across differences. If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or need assistance managing your personal information, feel free to contact us at:

luiza@masteringculturaldifferences.com

Are your meetings as productive as they could be?
We know meetings can sometimes feel like a time drain—but with the right approach, they can become a powerful tool for collaboration and progress. Here are five strategies to help you run better meetings starting today:
Define the purpose
Every meeting should have a clear goal. Without one, it’s easy to lose focus and waste time.
Share agendas ahead of time
An agenda helps everyone come prepared, fostering more meaningful discussions and quicker decisions.
Foster collaboration
Give everyone a chance to contribute. Meetings should spark ideas and align participants, not just be one-sided presentations.
Stay on schedule
Respect everyone’s time by sticking to the planned duration and agenda. Time-block discussions to keep things moving efficiently.
End with actionable next steps
Wrap up every meeting by clearly defining takeaways, owners, and deadlines to turn talk into action.
Efficient meetings can transform your workflows and help you accomplish more. Ready to implement these strategies and see the difference for yourself?
Start booking meetings

Hello Larry!
I’m excited to invite you to an insightful and practical FREE WEBINAR hosted by SCORE Los Angeles: 
From Conflict to Connection: How to Navigate Difficult Conversations in a Respectful and Effective Way
 
📅
 
Date
: Thursday, March 6, 2025 
⏰
 
Time
: 10:00 – 11:30 am, PST | 12:00 – 01:30 pm, CST | 01:00 – 02:30 pm, EST 
 
Navigating difficult conversations is a crucial skill for building trust and fostering inclusion—whether at work or in our personal lives.  
Yet, many of us struggle to respond effectively when confronted with offensive comments or challenging interactions. 
This webinar will empower you with the tools to confidently approach conflict, transform discomfort into meaningful dialogue, and create understanding and resolution. 
By the end of the webinar, you will: 
Identify how you tend to react in conflict situations. 
Learn to ask the right questions about what you observe and hear. 
Master the art of effective listening. 
Discover practical ways to respond when feeling offended. 
 
📌📌
📌
 Reserve your spot today
: 
Register Here
 
 
Don’t miss this opportunity to strengthen your ability to engage in transformative conversations that foster inclusivity and mutual respect. 
👉
 
👉
 
👉
 Feel free to share this with colleagues or friends who could benefit from this session. 
 
Looking forward to seeing you there! 
Bye for now, 
Luiza
___________________________________
 
Luiza Dreasher, President and CEO (she/her/hers)
Mastering Cultural Differences 
I work with leaders who want to create a work environment where all employees feel valued and want to stay.
At 
Mastering Cultural Differences LLC,
 we are committed to helping organizations build inclusive, culturally competent workplaces where every individual feels valued and respected. Through highly customized programs, we equip teams with knowledge and skills to help them connect and collaborate more effectively across differences. subject: Still looking for AI case studies—can you help by March 15th?
body:
Greetings Larry,
I’m making progress on my upcoming book with Georgetown University Press, 
From Resistance to Results: The Psychology of Generative AI Integration
. You can check out the book proposal
 
here
.
The publisher is particularly interested in real-world case studies of how organizations with over 20 people are integrating generative AI. 
I’m looking to interview leaders or other stakeholders who have firsthand insights to share.
If you know someone who might be interested, I’d love an introduction by March 15th! These case studies will be featured in the book and will also inform articles I write for 
Forbes
, 
Entrepreneur
, 
Fast Company
, 
The World Financial Review
, and 
Fortune
.
Even if you’re unsure, I’d love to hear from you. Just hit reply if anyone comes to mind!
Decisively yours,
Dr. Gleb

SUCCESS STORIES
How an AI company finds global flexibility with WeWork
Read more
 
Meet Robin AI
10 Devonshire Square, London | Member since 2020
With a team of both legal and tech experts, Robin AI is on a mission to make the process of reading and signing contracts faster, simpler, and more accessible. Today, their advanced AI assistant has helped thousands across the globe, including some top Fortune 500 companies.
Read more
 
THE CHALLENGE
Finding space for a growing international team
Starting with just six desks in a London office, Robin AI quickly expanded their team into Singapore, Australia, and New York—and needed office space that could keep up with their growth.
 
THE SOLUTION
Turnkey global offices with WeWork
With WeWork, Robin AI knew that they could arrive at a new office in a new country—no matter how many times they expanded—and still find the same flexible, move-in ready workspace and reliable onsite support.
“As a fast-moving tech company, we needed a workspace solution that could grow with us.”
Karolina Lukoszová, VP Legal Engineering
 
FINDING HOME
Settling into a full-floor HQ
In addition to their satellite offices, Robin AI set up a full-scale headquarters in London, with an entire dedicated floor for their team to work together, meet clients, and take their business to new heights.
Ready to scale your business in a WeWork space?
Let us find you a fully furnished office with all the amenities you need, so you can focus on what matters most.

subject: ADHD and neurodiverse brains - a fresh perspective 🧠
body:
📅 
Happenings
MAR. FREE WEBINAR - BOLSTER YOUR ERG STRATEGY
 -
 
Join us for a free open webinar, 
Mar. 17th at 12pm ET
. During this webinar we will chat through how to revamp your ERG strategy and share best practices. We’ll cover best practices and the current status of company ERGs, a case study for an ERG strategy refresh, and ideas to engage ALLIES in your organization’s ERGs. 
Register for free here
.
INTERNATIONAL ALLYSHIP DAY
 - Join us in NYC or virtually on August 8th for our 
2nd annual International Allyship Day event
, hosted by our partner AllianceBernstein. This year’s focus is on equipping inclusion and ERG leaders with actionable strategies to strengthen or launch allyship programs within their organizations. Participants will gain essential skills for effective allyship, pushback-proof strategies, and insights into the strategic business impact of allyship. They’ll also have the chance to connect with senior leaders in the inclusion space. We're consistently adding exciting new speakers and organizations like Coqual and Dr. Sandra Upton - 
will your organization be there?
 
Register individually or as a team here
.
​
 
​
📝 ADHD and neurodiverse brains TedTalk
If you have attended one of my workshops, you know I have been a long time fan of Kristen Pressner's work. She is the Global Head of People and Culture at Roche and founder of
 
Flip It to Test It
,
 a favorite tool for managing bias that is highlighted in most of my courses. She just released her newest 
TedTalk: Why is it that so many people just 'can't get it together'
? and I could not be more excited to support her as an ally.
I don't share this a lot publicly. My four-year old daughter, Dylan, has autism. We got her official diagnosis when she turned three, and it has been a huge journey to learning how to be an ally for someone I love more than anything. I have been focused on learning how to communicate with her, accepting and embracing how she interacts with the world and educating others on autism (there are a lot of misperceptions out there).
For this reason, Kristen's TedTalk hit home for me. The members of her family have recently been diagnosed with ADHD. She realized that, by not working under the assumption everyone’s brains worked the same way, she could be a better ally to her own family members. 
She realized that her family member’s brains seemed to be on a different operating system and she had to engage very differently; in doing so, the advantages of their brains became more evident. To engage differently, she began to ask questions like the following:
Instead of, “Why can’t they get it together?” she asked, “What else might be causing the perception that they 'can't get it together'?"
Instead of, “Why do they procrastinate?” she asked, “What might be happening inside their brain to make getting started so challenging?"
Instead of, “How can I fix them?” she asked, “What can I learn from them?” and "What can I adapt in my approach to bring out the best in them?"
Instead of seeing all the ways in which people with neurodivergence “don’t measure up” to a neurotypical standard, brain friends or allies “flip it” to see the advantages divergent brains can bring. 
I interviewed Kristin about this topic on my podcast as well.
​
I love Kristen's ideas to be better allies to folks with the neurodivergent community. 
April is Autism Acceptance Month
. If you or your team has yet plan an event or share content on how to be an ally to the autistic community, we have ideas. 
My team 
would love to chat with you!
​
Thanks allies,
Julie
​
💬 
Allyship Conversation Starters & Resources
It's Women's History Month and
 
International Women's Day
 
is quickly approaching! Need Resources?
​
​
How to Assess the New Legal Risks of Your DEI Policies
​
​
 
Care about inclusion for the little ones in your life? Check out the programs and resources from 
LITTLE ALLIES
, a nonprofit working to facilitate inclusive experiences for all children to feel seen, heard, and belong.
​
Next Pivot Point
 
works to promote allyship and inclusion across all dimensions of diversity in the workplace to make sure everyone feels seen, heard, and belonging at work.
​

subject: Encouraging authenticity at work
body:
Plus: preparing for a “6G” reality. 
March 5, 2025  ·  
View in browser
 
The Insightful Leader
BY 
KELLOGG INSIGHT
Leadership advice from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University
Good morning,
We all bring a version of ourselves to work. And we tend to fare—and feel—better when the version we bring is our most authentic self.
People from marginalized social groups might still fear the consequences of revealing too much about themselves. But certain conditions can make them feel more comfortable doing so, according to Kellogg’s 
Cynthia Wang
. That’s this week.
Plus, in a historical first, organizations have a workforce spanning six generations. What will it take to lead them?
Keeping it real—under the right circumstances
Fear of social rejection or other forms of backlash present a dilemma for many employees from marginalized groups: Should I risk bringing my true self to work—by wearing a natural hairstyle, for instance, or sharing my love of Black musicians? Or should I play it safe by downplaying this part of myself?
New research from Cynthia Wang, a clinical professor of management and organizations, proposes that Black employees’ hesitation to express their true selves is often rooted in uncertainty about how their coworkers will react.
Across a series of studies and interviews, Wang and her colleagues identified two factors that helped address this uncertainty and made Black employees feel more comfortable expressing their social identities at work. The first factor was working in an organization with a climate that fosters authenticity, allowing all employees to express their true selves. The second was perspective-taking—the practice of imagining the world from others’ viewpoints.
“These factors are critical pieces of the overall puzzle in understanding how to successfully manage diversity within the workplace,” she says. “They can foster organizational involvement and reduce turnover.”
Wang offers a caveat to the findings. Though taking the time to consider their coworkers’ perspective can be helpful to Black employees, the onus shouldn’t be just on them to spend the extra time and effort it takes to do so.
Read more in 
Kellogg Insight
.
 
Preparing for a “6G” reality
As teenagers from the emerging Generation Alpha prepare for summer jobs and high school internships, many workplaces now span six generations. The other five: the Silent Generation, Baby Boomers, Generation X, Generation Y (often called Millennials), and Generation Z.
Kellogg’s 
Nicholas Pearce
, a clinical professor of management and organizations, writes that this moment presents a unique opportunity for organizations to reposition themselves as the employer-of-choice for every generation.
Pearce writes that multigenerational teams often clash over matters like what constitutes “hard work” or “good leadership.” He advises organizations to view generations as cultures with differences that should be understood and appreciated.
“Viewing generations as cultures can help leaders foster inclusive environments of mutual respect, honor, and inclusion in which everyone can be their best and bring their best every day,” Pearce said. “[It] can help teammates of different generations productively engage with one another without an underlying sense of cultural—or generational—superiority.”
Another challenge he says leaders must confront is the congestion in the talent pipeline, with the more-seasoned workers holding on to top positions rather than retiring, and the younger workers waiting their turn for advancement that’s slow to come.
“One of the most pressing opportunities to decongest the talent pipeline is to create meaningful opportunities for senior talent to remain engaged in post-executive roles,” Pearce writes. “Such positions must include more than honorific titles, be positioned as a positive step forward instead of a step aside (or a step back), and carry real value in transferring knowledge, sharing experiences and expertise, and mentoring younger colleagues without the weight and time commitment of executive-level responsibility.”
Read more from Pearce in 
Harvard Business Review
.
“In absence of the clear vision of increasing productivity [with AI], people are legitimately scared that the organization may justify laying them off by saying AI can do this job.”
— 
Hatim Rahman
, in 
The Washington Post
, on a new survey showing that a majority of American workers feel pessimistic about AI on the job.
See you next week,
Laura Pavin, multimedia editor
Kellogg Insight
Follow us on 
LinkedIn
.
And listen to our 
podcasts
.
Kellogg School of Management
 | 
2211 Campus Drive
, 
Evanston, IL 60208
 
Unsubscribe larry@lcwmail.com
 
Update Profile
 | 
Constant Contact Data Notice
 
Sent by 
insight@kellogg.northwestern.edu

View in browser
 
 March 04, 2025
Leaving aside DEI, we find the current slash-and-burn approach to “government efficiency” to be short-sighted at best. Terminating large numbers of employees is only “efficient” on paper and for a very short time. Taken to an extreme, you could fire everyone in an organization and have immense profitability… for a short while. 
Want a better strategy for increasing profitability while embracing DEI?
 Come to our workshop tomorrow, March 5 (and if you miss it, drop us a line and we'll share the recording).
 
– Team Aleria
DEI Backlash: 
Pros
 and 
Cons
Stories focused on the anti-DEI backlash, and efforts to put a stop to the nonsense!
 
Quantifying DEI
Exploring the tangible aspects of DEI and current efforts to quantify it
 
DEI Resources
Useful tools and information to support your DEI efforts
 
The Complexity of DEI
Unintended consequences and ripple effects of DEI
 
Golden Nuggets,
 Silver Linings
Unexpected bits of good news... when we can find them.
If you need a little pick-me-up, 
enjoy this video
 about the “Bean Dreaming” coffee truck, which champions inclusion for children and adults with Autism. And kudos to Delta Airlines for offering 
new flights to Marrakech, Morocco
 and expanding service to Accra, Ghana, as part of its broader strategy to tap into the African continent's dynamic cities, rich traditions, and growing economies. Anyone interested in moving?
 
 
Aleria Team Updates
The latest from the Aleria Team
 
Ready to start your 
Journey to Inclusion
?
Embrace a new approach to DEI! Find out how focusing on inclusion leads to greater, sustainable diversity while driving superior performance for 
any
 organization, creating alignment instead of backlash. Our four-stage 
Journey to Inclusion
 is ideally suited for organizations with 500 or more employees, regardless of your current level of DEI readiness. 
Visit our website
 for additional information, 
send us an email
 to learn more, or use the button below to schedule a call with Aleria's Founder and Chief Scientist, Paolo Gaudiano, who can provide more details and answer any questions about how measuring inclusion can give your organization a competitive advantage.
Book a call with Paolo
 
 
Mark Your Calendars
DEI-related events, applications and opportunities. Submit relevant events to 
info@aleria.tech
Tomorrow, March 5, 2025 at 3pm US/ET
 join our founder and Chief Scientist, Paolo Gaudiano, for a free webinar on 
How to Link DEI to Corporate Finance
. In today's uncertain economic climate, leveraging DEI as a strategic advantage is more critical than ever. This webinar is designed for leaders who want to elevate DEI from a “nice-to-have” initiative to a crucial element of corporate strategy and a vital driver of measurable business success. 
Free registration
.
On Wednesday, March 5, 2025 at 1:00pm US/ET, join Bridge Arrow for an amazing panel featuring our friend Jennifer Brown and legal scholars, and other experts to get clarity, insights, and actionable recommendations beyond the cacophony of current headlines. 
Free registration
.
On March 6 2025, at 2:00pm US/ET, join WiCyS for an insightful webinar hosted by Christina McMahon, a cybersecurity leader at Vanguard, as she shares her personal journey of resilience and growth. In this engaging session, Christina will discuss strategies for overcoming failure, the importance of supportive leadership in fostering resilience, and her experiences with the empowering culture at Vanguard. 
Free registration
.
On March 12, 2025 1:00 PM US/ET join SHRM for a webinar answering frequently asked questions about the implications of the recent executive orders in the workplace. 
Register here for free
.
On Thursday, March 13, 2025 at 2pm US/ET, join Researchscape for a conversation with two dynamic DEIB leaders from Highwire PR. They will discuss the strength of their multigenerational partnership, the synergy that emerges from their collaboration, and how organizations can leverage diverse generational insights to drive positive change and foster an inclusive culture. 
Free registration
.

If you received this newsletter from a loving friend or colleague :-), use the button below to reach our newsletter subscription page.

subject: The Shortlist: How Marathon Health Supercharges Sourcing with AI
body:
See It in Action – March 13, 10 AM PT
View in browser
 
 
How Marathon Health Supercharges Sourcing with AI
Struggling to fill tough roles? Learn how Laura Lazewski, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner at Marathon Health, is transforming recruitment using AI-powered sourcing.
 
In this session on March 13th at 10am PT
, Laura will reveal how she found top candidates faster, engaged them more effectively, and built a strong employer brand for long-term success.
 
From filling highly specialized clinical roles to running data-driven recruiting campaigns, Laura has redefined what’s possible in talent acquisition. She’ll share real-world examples of how AI is eliminating manual sourcing work, uncovering hidden talent, and keeping candidate pipelines full.
 
Get an inside look at how Marathon Health is redefining recruitment success — and learn how your team can do the same.
Register today!
 
 
Hari Kolam talks AI’s
impact on hiring
 
Hari Kolam, co-founder and CEO of Findem, joined the 
Breakthrough Hiring Show
 last month to discuss the role of AI and data in reshaping recruitment. Read the key takeaways from the podcast, and learn how Findem is helping teams move beyond traditional resumes to create a more efficient sourcing process.
Hear Hari's takeaways
 
 
The one talent acquisition 
metric that matters most
 
Acceptance rate is truly a 
recruiting-focused measure
 that focuses on recruiters finding and engaging the right talent for the business. Consolidated tools and insights from the right tech stack can help increase visibility into acceptance rates, and even help you improve it. See how the right tools can make a difference.
Explore acceptance rate
 
Want more insights from talent acquisition experts?
Subscribe to The Shortlist
 and follow us on 
LinkedIn
 to stay in the loop.
Trending last month
 
Findem Accelerates into 2025
 
Findem strengthens its impact on talent acquisition with 3X revenue, a growing 10,000+ candidate attribute dataset, vertical expansion, and strategic partnerships.
 
See where we're going
 
Inside look: The CHRO revolution
 
Learn where CHROs go next — whether into CPO roles or HR consulting — and how their expertise shapes talent strategy and business success.
 
Explore the insights
 
Insights Report: Talent Operations
 
This report analyzes thousands 3D profiles, providing data and insights to understand this evolving function and how it will shape the future of talent acquisition.
 
Learn about talent ops
 
 
High costs, diminishing returns
 
Watch last month's webinar, 
Leveraging Technology for Better Recruiting Outcomes, 
to see how leaders and analysts are tackling the technology conundrum facing talent teams today.
 
Watch the replay

subject: A Reckless Erosion of Trust (Wise Decision Maker Guide 145)
body:
Wise Decision Maker Guide 
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
Greetings Larry,
President Trump has embarked on an unprecedented experiment in executive overreach that is destroying the balance of powers and long-standing institutional commitments that have defined American democracy. His second term marks a dramatic departure from established norms, as sweeping policy shifts challenge the very foundations of our political system. Abandoned commitments to federal employees, sudden international withdrawals, and drastic funding freezes all point to a deliberate effort to consolidate power. Such actions are not mere policy adjustments; they constitute a fundamental assault on the constitutional principles that have long guided the nation, while undermining democratic stability and trust in democratic institutions.
To learn more, check out this 
blog
.
Read Blog
 
Prefer video to text? See this 
video
 based on the blog:
If you prefer audio, listen to this 
podcast
 based on the blog:
Make Your Voice Heard
Vote in this 
LinkedIn poll
 to contribute to the conversation. I will use the responses to inform my articles in 
Harvard Business Review
, 
Fortune
, and 
Entrepreneur
.
Your Testimonials
You and others who gain value from Disaster Avoidance Experts 
services
 and thought leadership occasionally share testimonials about your experience, such as the one below. You can read more testimonials 
here
.
"Working with Dr. Gleb to prepare was a pleasure: he 
thoroughly customized his remarks well to address the needs of our SHRM chapter membership and gave immediately actionable suggestions to improve our hybrid work environments
. I strongly recommend him for anyone who is considering how to improve employee engagement and satisfaction by implementing a hybrid work schedule. Thank you Dr. Gleb!"
Kiki Orski
, Program Organizer at Long Island SHRM
Schedule a Free Consultation
 
What's Up With Me
When I think about our political system, I approach it from the perspective of my expertise: making good decisions. I know that individual humans are flawed and we regularly fall for cognitive biases. We make mistakes all the time in our thinking, and that's why institutions are so important. They provide the checks and balances, the external perspective, which research on debiasing suggests are so needed to correct for our biases. Yet such institutions only work if politicians across the political spectrum cooperate on supporting these institutions. Institutions benefit everyone, yet individual politicians can get ahead by defecting against them. Such defection, if unpunished, creates a race to the bottom, undermining a common understanding of truth and a shared commitment to civility. My hope is that we can find our way to truth and civility, defend our institutions, and rebuild trust.
Would love to get your feedback on what you found most useful about this edition of the “Wise Decision Maker Guide” - simply reply to this email.
Decisively Yours,
Dr. Gleb
Dr. Gleb Tsipursky
CEO of Disaster Avoidance Experts
PS: Are we connected on LinkedIn? If not, 
please add me
.
Did you miss out on reading any of my bestselling books?
Never Go With Your Gut: How Pioneering Leaders Make the Best Decisions and Avoid Business Disasters
 (Career Press, 2019)
The Blindspots Between Us: How to Overcome Unconscious Cognitive Bias and Build Better Relationships
 
(New Harbinger, 2020)
Returning to the Office and Leading Hybrid and Remote Teams: A Manual on Benchmarking to Best Practices for Competitive Advantage
 
(Intentional Insights, 2021)
Please
 
forward this email
 
to a colleague or friend who might find it helpful.

free

,

Let's be safe!
 
👍

as

subject: 🧠 Unlocking Potential: Are You Overlooking Neurodivergent Talent?
body:
Continue reading to learn how you can support your neurodivergent talent. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hello Larry!
 
🛑
 
Picture This:
You’re in a leadership meeting discussing why some employees struggle with collaboration, time management, or traditional performance expectations. One team member, brilliant in problem-solving, often misses deadlines. Another employee, incredibly detail-oriented, gets overwhelmed in brainstorming sessions. Despite their unique strengths, they seem to be “underperforming.” 
But what if the real issue isn’t 
their performance
—but how your workplace accommodates 
different ways of thinking
? 
 
🤔
 
The Experience:
Imagine being an employee with ADHD, expected to work in an open office full of distractions. Or an autistic professional asked to "just speak up more" in meetings when they process information differently. A dyslexic team member might have groundbreaking ideas but struggles with written communication. 
Instead of feeling 
supported
, these employees often believe they have to 
mask their differences
—which leads to stress, burnout, and disengagement. 
 
⚠️
 
The Problem:
Neurodivergent employees are leaving—or never applying—because workplaces aren’t built for them. In fact, many leaders still believe “one-size-fits-all” productivity models work. They don’t. 
Your company could be losing out on 
innovation, creative problem-solving, and unique perspectives
 by not embracing neurodiversity. 
When neurodivergent employees 
don’t feel valued, they disengage.
 And disengagement isn’t just an HR issue—it’s a 
business risk
. Low retention, high turnover costs, and a lack of truly diverse thinking hold companies back from real progress. 
 
💡
 
The Future You’re Waiting For:
Imagine a workplace where:
✅
 
Meetings accommodate different communication styles.
✅
 
Workspaces are designed to minimize distractions for focused thinking.
✅
 
Employees are valued for their strengths—not penalized for differences.
 
When neurodivergent employees feel 
empowered, not excluded
, they 
thrive
—bringing 
creativity, innovation, and fresh perspectives
 that drive business success. 
 
🎤
 
What’s Next:
In my next email, I’ll share 
specific, actionable strategies
 to make your workplace 
more inclusive for neurodivergent talent
—without major overhauls or unrealistic expectations. 
📩
 
Stay tuned for Part 2!
 It’s time to stop overlooking 
neurodivergent brilliance
 and start unlocking 
true potential
 in your organization. 
  
Bye for now, 
Luiza
___________________________________
 
Luiza Dreasher, President and CEO (she/her/hers)
Mastering Cultural Differences 
I work with leaders who want to create a work environment where all employees feel valued and want to stay.
At 
Mastering Cultural Differences LLC,
 we are committed to helping organizations build inclusive, culturally competent workplaces where every individual feels valued and respected. Through highly customized programs, we equip teams with knowledge and skills to help them connect and collaborate more effectively across differences. Any unauthorized review, use, disclosure, or distribution is prohibited. If you received this email in error, please notify the sender immediately and delete it from your system. We respect your privacy. Please note you also have the right to opt out of emails at any time via the link at the bottom of our emails. If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or need assistance managing your personal information, feel free to contact us at: 
www.masteringculturaldifferences.com
 or by sending an email to 
luiza@masteringculturaldifferences.com
.

subject: 5 Things: Chicagoland's Weekly Business Update
body:
Delivered by Southwest Airlines 
 
Click 
here
 
to view this email in your browser.
 
 
 
 
 
Weekly Business Update 
March 3, 2025
Delivered by
 
MEMBER NEWS
Register Today for J.P. Morgan Corporate Challenge Chicago! 
PRESENTED BY JPMORGANCHASE
 
An iconic event since 1982, the J.P. Morgan Corporate Challenge Chicago returns Thursday, May 8, at 6:50 p.m. at Grant Park. The 3.5-mile run/walk is phenomenally popular with the business community, both for the healthy competition and post-race party. Spots are available for all businesses in Chicagoland, with a minimum team size of four and no maximum. Registration for both Team Captains and Participants closes on Thursday, April 10 at 8:00 p.m.
REGISTER NOW
 
UPCOMING EVENT
Celebrate Women’s History Month with Female Tech Leaders on March 18
PRESENTED BY THE CHICAGOLAND CHAMBER OF COMMERCE
 
Join the Chicagoland Chamber of Commerce for “InnovateHER: Pioneering the Future of Technology and Connectivity” at Salesforce Tower on March 18. Hear from industry leaders Meghan Collins and Jen Price (Salesforce), Kellie Fitzgerald (Google), Judy Toland (Meta), and Sarah Glavin (Amazon) as they share insights and strategies for driving innovation in a rapidly evolving landscape. Register by Tuesday, March 11 to receive $10 off. 
REGISTER NOW
 
MEMBER NEWS
2025 CFO Outlook: How Finance Leaders Are Driving Growth in Uncertain Times 
PRESENTED BY BDO USA
 
The role of the CFO is evolving, and in 2025, finance leaders are doubling down on strategic investments to fuel growth, even amid economic uncertainty. According to BDO’s latest CFO Outlook Survey, executives are prioritizing AI adoption, sustainability integration, and pricing strategy adjustments to stay competitive. But with new opportunities come new risks—data security, operational challenges, and shifting consumer demands are top of mind. Want to know how CFOs in your industry are preparing for the year ahead? Get the key insights from 500 financial leaders and discover the trends shaping the future of business. 
LEARN MORE
 
MEMBER NEWS
Chicagoland Chamber Welcomes New Members in February 2025
PRESENTED BY THE CHICAGOLAND CHAMBER OF COMMERCE
 
The Chicagoland Chamber of Commerce is proud to welcome its newest members to a growing network of businesses and leaders committed to fostering a thriving economic environment in the region. In February, the Chamber welcomed: American Foundation for Suicide Prevention, Blue Star Security, Global Prairie, Junk Shot of South Chicago, Mowery & Schoenfeld, Museum of Ice Cream, SimpleITSM LLC, and Summit Staffing. As the Chamber continues to advocate for businesses of all sizes, we look forward to working closely with our new members to promote growth, innovation, and opportunity across the region.
LEARN MORE
 
MEMBER NEWS
Prime Pairings: Wine Dinner at Nisos Prime 
PRESENTED BY PARKER HOSPITALITY
 
Join Nisos Prime on March 12 for a very special wine dinner featuring a four-course menu by their Executive Chef, expertly paired with wines from Albert Bichot, presented by Jules Martin. Don’t miss an unforgettable evening, where exquisite wines and masterfully crafted dishes come together for an elevated dining experience. Limited seating is available—reserve your spot today!
LEARN MORE
 
Want to showcase your company news, information, products, or services?
 
Chamber members are able to take advantage of a myriad of benefits to help your business grow, including inclusion in this email newsletter. With a broad distribution, you can gain access to a new audience that you may not otherwise be able to reach.
REVIEW BENEFITS
 
 
FOLLOW THE CHAMBER
 
 
 
 
 
WWW.CHICAGOLANDCHAMBER.ORG
The Chicagoland Chamber of Commerce
The Wrigley Building | 410 N Michigan Ave | Suite 900
Chicago, IL 60611
 
Change Your Subscription Preferences
 at any time.
For information about our privacy practices, view our 
Privacy Policy
.

subject: Letter
Full Calendar - Upcoming Events
body:
From Day One is pleased to invite you to our upcoming events, each accredited by SHRM and HRCI, unless otherwise noted.
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
From Day One is pleased to invite you to our upcoming events
Our weekly 
webinars
 are each 60 minutes, complimentary to attend, and qualify for 1 credit from SHRM and HRCI.
Our monthly half-day 
virtual conferences 
include keynote, fireside chat, and panel discussions on our virtual main stage, as well as workshop sessions, chat, and one-on-one networking opportunities that facilitate interaction with our presenters and your fellow participants. They each qualify for 3 credits from SHRM and HRCI.
Our 
live events
 are coming to a city near you. Each one-day conference brings together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, talent acquisition, diversity, employee engagement, benefits, and CSR for an engaging, up-to-the-minute conversation about how employers can build stronger bonds of trust and connection with their workers and their communities. They each qualify for 4 credits from SHRM and HRCI.
Our 
half-day live events
 bring together leading thinkers and top executives in more focused sectors. They each qualify for 3 credits from SHRM and HRCI. 
WEBINAR
 
March 6: Student Debt in 2025: Essential Benefits for Recruiting and Retaining Top Talent
The student debt landscape has undergone rapid change in the past four years, with new repayment options, proposed forgiveness programs, and further shifts anticipated post-presidential election. In this evolving environment, employees expect more support from their employers in managing and reducing their student debt burdens. Join SoFi in this webinar to explore the latest in student loan benefits and how they’re becoming essential to attract and retain top talent in 2025. Learn about the most recent trends, strategies, and legislation—including updates on Section 127 and Secure 2.0—that are reshaping student debt benefits. Discover innovative approaches from leading companies, backed by the latest research, to create impactful student-loan repayment programs that make a measurable difference for employees and organizations alike.
Register now
LIVE EVENT
 
March 6: Silicon Valley, CA - The New Era of Investing in Humans
In the face of increasing pressure for productivity, how can companies grow while building a culture based on trust and values? Employers will need to take a greater stake in the future of their employees. In our conference of HR leaders and colleagues, we’ll explore breakthroughs in thinking about how to make work fulfilling, create a sense of community, help employees increase their skills and performance, and produce better managers. You’ll discover the most innovative approaches in such fields as talent acquisition, total rewards, benefits, learning and development, employee engagement, AI and HR technology, and inclusion and belonging.
Register now
WEBINAR
 
March 11: Optimizing Executive Leadership During Unprecedented Times
Confronted by waves of new and increasingly complex leadership demands, executives must have the ability to lead through unprecedented times. In this session, you'll hear the story of Altumint, a company dedicated to innovative public safety solutions, and the inspirational journey of its CEO, Holly Cooper. In her first year as CEO, she has been leading the organization through its next phase of exponential growth. How did the organization set her up for success? Learn about the transformational development experience that has helped fuel the company’s high performance. You'll discover the key needs and desires of executives in today’s coaching, a powerful framework to elevate executive functioning and value creation, and the business case for this work and its expected ROI.
Register now
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
March 12: Putting Employee Experience at the Center of HR Leadership
HR leaders who focus on improving worker experience can produce a host of good outcomes in terms of employee engagement, receptivity to change, employee retention, and overall productivity. What are the most effective techniques? How can leaders promote mutual trust, listen better, create community, build a consensus on values and social responsibility, and give workers better tools to do their jobs? Where can employers draw the line between active listening, as with surveys, or more passive techniques that may come across as a Big Brother approach? We’ll explore how research has established a strong connection between better employee experience and business growth.
Register now
WEBINAR
 
March 13: Optimizing Hiring: Using AI and Automation to Enhance the Candidate Experience
When put to use effectively, AI and automation can transform the hiring process, providing leaders with the tools to streamline processes, shorten time-to-hire, and create a more candidate-centric experience. What are some of the most innovative technologies and tools helping leaders streamline the hiring process? What strategies can leaders use to make interview scheduling more efficient? How can talent acquisition teams effectively balance the use of technology with the human connection essential to having a meaningful candidate experience? In this session, panelists will offer strategies for providing a positive candidate experience throughout the hiring journey, discussing feedback, best practices, and insights on the tools and technologies that can support these efforts.
Register now
WEBINAR
 
March 20: What Trump’s Immigration Agenda Means for Employers: Planning for 2025 and Beyond
The new Trump Administration 2.0 is moving aggressively on new immigration policies, including significant changes to the immigration process. Yet we have plenty of experience from his first term to help guide us toward adapting to the new era. In this webinar, we will go over what we see as the most likely immediate adjustments, as well as later developments, and the steps you can take now to ensure compliance and minimize disruptions to your immigration program moving forward. Some changes we expect to see include:
• Immigration programs becoming more complicated, challenging, and unpredictable
• Companies being targeted for political reasons
• Travel bans and international travel challenges
• Foreign employees becoming less likely to seek a change of employer
Please join us for an insightful and practical guide to how employers can adapt and anticipate the myriad changes to U.S. immigration policy to ensure access to a global talent pool.
Register now
LIVE EVENT
 
March 25: Seattle, WA - The New Era of Investing in Humans
In the face of increasing pressure for productivity, how can companies grow while building a culture based on trust and values? Employers will need to take a greater stake in the future of their employees. In our conference of HR leaders and colleagues, we’ll explore breakthroughs in thinking about how to make work fulfilling, create a sense of community, help employees increase their skills and performance, and produce better managers. You’ll discover the most innovative approaches in such fields as talent acquisition, total rewards, benefits, learning and development, employee engagement, AI and HR technology, and inclusion and belonging.
Register now
WEBINAR
 
March 27: Making Healthcare Work: Small Changes to Your Benefits Strategy that Deliver Big Impact
With rising healthcare costs and increasingly demanding employee expectations, HR and benefits professionals need solutions that deliver real results. Join Accolade's strategy leaders to explore data-backed benefits strategies derived from millions of member experiences. We'll share actionable tactics that address key challenges — from controlling costs to boosting benefits engagement — and show how AI can further streamline the user experience. You’ll walk away with proven approaches that can truly transform how you design your benefits plan. Don’t miss this opportunity — register today to access the recording!
Key Takeaways: 
- Learn how to reduce costs while improving healthcare quality 
- Discover tactics to increase benefits utilization and employee engagement. 
- Understand how AI and technology are changing the healthcare landscape for the better.
Register now
LIVE EVENT - HALF DAY
 
April 2: Boston, MA - Benefits In 2025 And Beyond: Innovative And Inclusive Approaches For Worker Well-Being And Cost Effectiveness
A wide range of benefits allows employers to tackle a broad spectrum of their goals, spanning from retaining and engaging employees to promoting inclusion and belonging within the workplace. What are the cutting-edge benefits available that cater to the needs of every worker? How can companies evaluate their workforce needs and cultivate awareness and participation in their offerings? What trends are emerging and what can be expected in the future of benefits?
Register now
WEBINAR
 
April 8: The New Era of Workplace Giving: Meeting Donors Where They Are
Traditional workplace-giving programs often miss the mark. Employees want giving to feel personal, effortless, and seamlessly integrated into their daily lives. But how do companies meet these expectations while maintaining program efficiency and impact? Using Submittable’s digital “Impact Wallet,” companies are transforming their workplace-giving programs by shifting from one-size-fits-all models to hyper-personalized giving experiences. This innovative approach empowers employees to give when, where, and how they want—whether through direct donations, corporate rewards, payroll contributions, and more. Employees can create real-time impact via the fastest donation method in CSR.
What you'll learn: 
- How to transform workplace giving from transactional to meaningful and engaging
- Why flexibility and personalization are key to increasing donor participation
- How the Impact Wallet meets donors in their flow of life—whether through direct giving, rewards, payroll contributions, or the fastest donation method in CSR
- Real-world examples of companies enhancing their CSR impact and employee engagement
- Actionable steps to future-proof your giving programs and make generosity second nature
Register now
WEBINAR
 
April 15: The Personalized Benefits Playbook: How Smart Companies Can Win with LSAs
When it comes to benefits, employees want flexibility and choice, and admin teams need solutions that work. Lifestyle Spending Accounts (LSAs) are changing the game, and leading companies are using them to enhance well-being and support what matters most to employees – all while streamlining administration.
Join Forma for an exclusive conversation about how and why to launch LSAs, with real-world examples and benchmark data to back it up. From tackling traditional benefits challenges to designing a personalized benefits program that employees will love, you’ll get an upfront look at how smart companies can win with LSAs.
You'll learn:
- How LSAs work and why they’re growing in popularity across the world
- Traditional benefits challenges LSAs can solve
- Questions to ask to determine if LSAs are a fit for your company
- How to get started with LSAs
Register now
LIVE EVENT
 
April 16: Dallas, TX - The New Era of Investing in Humans
In the face of increasing pressure for productivity, how can companies grow while building a culture based on trust and values? Employers will need to take a greater stake in the future of their employees. In our conference of HR leaders and colleagues, we’ll explore breakthroughs in thinking about how to make work fulfilling, create a sense of community, help employees increase their skills and performance, and produce better managers. You’ll discover the most innovative approaches in such fields as talent acquisition, total rewards, benefits, learning and development, employee engagement, AI and HR technology, and inclusion and belonging.
Register now
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
April 23: Better Benefits: Supporting the Health and Well-Being of Workers and Their Families
When benefits leaders set high expectations for the quality and efficiency of the services they’re choosing for their company’s employees, the outcome can be a healthy workforce and a considerable return on investment. What innovative ways can benefits leaders stay in tune with what employees want, as well as evaluate the impact of those benefits? What are the latest developments in programs that offer support for women’s and family health, caregiving, mental health, and financial well-being?
Register now
LIVE EVENT - HALF DAY
 
April 23: New York, NY - Making Talent Acquisition a Strategic Part of Workforce Planning and Growth
At a time when many industries face talent shortages, TA leaders can play a pivotal role attracting and retaining hourly workers, finding unconventional pools of talent, taking part in succession planning, and embracing skills-based hiring to help meet future workforce needs. How can TA leaders improve their effectiveness and influence by modernizing their process, from the beginning of the pipeline to onboarding and advancement? What are the tools and new technology, including AI, that can help them?
Register now
LIVE EVENT - HALF DAY
 
April 24: New York, NY - Benefits In 2025 And Beyond: Innovative And Inclusive Approaches For Worker Well-Being And Cost Effectiveness
A wide range of benefits allows employers to tackle a broad spectrum of their goals, spanning from retaining and engaging employees to promoting inclusion and belonging within the workplace. What are the cutting-edge benefits available that cater to the needs of every worker? How can companies evaluate their workforce needs and cultivate awareness and participation in their offerings? What trends are emerging and what can be expected in the future of benefits?
Register now
WEBINAR
 
April 24: Measuring the Impact of Your Leadership Development Programs
Leadership development (LD) remains a top priority among CEOs in the midst of unprecedented transformations that require new and elevated skillsets for leaders. Yet the returns on LD investments are not always clear. MDA Leadership finds that organizations often sell LD programs short when they think solely in terms of the impact on the small cohort attending a given program. In fact, a well-designed program can have significant, measurable impact on a far larger number of people and result in more major business benefits than previously known. Join three experts to learn a powerful new way to develop and measure your LD programs to yield a greater return on investment.
Register now
WEBINAR
 
April 29: Breaking Barriers to Growth: Identifying What Holds Us Back
Whether at work or in our personal lives, unseen obstacles can prevent growth, innovation, and success. From ingrained habits and resistance to change to structural challenges and workplace culture, identifying what holds us back is the first step toward meaningful progress. Understanding these barriers not only fosters self-awareness but also empowers us to take actionable steps toward positive change. This webinar will explore common barriers—both individual and organizational—and provide practical strategies for overcoming them.
Register now
WEBINAR
 
May 6: Breaking the GLP-1 Cost Cycle for a Healthier Workforce, Lower Costs, and Smarter Care
GLP-1 medications are transforming the treatment of obesity, a challenge affecting millions of U.S. workers. Yet the high cost is a significant concern for companies looking to balance access with affordability. In this session, leaders from Noom will break down the GLP-1 cost cycle and identify ways organizations can provide affordable access to GLP-1s and other anti-obesity medications regardless of their coverage policies. You'll learn how the obesity crisis is affecting employers, the impact of GLP-1 compounds, and how Noom can help you confidently manage GLP-1 costs and achieve long-term return on investment.
Register now
LIVE EVENT
 
May 13: Minneapolis, MN - The New Era of Investing in Humans

May 21: The Role of HR Leaders in Building a Culture of Recognition and Feedback
Workers do better when they hear from managers and peers about how they’re doing. Yet many workers feel unappreciated or mystified about how their work is perceived. What are the organizational obstacles to providing better feedback? What are the most effective techniques for providing recognition? How can leaders get a better sense of a worker’s motivations, both intrinsic and extrinsic? What are the latest innovations in providing feedback in timely and impactful ways? How can managers be trained to be more conscious–and more fair-minded–about assigning non-promotable work, vs. status-granting tasks?

VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
June 11: Charting the Future of Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging
Amid a backlash to the initiatives championed half a decade ago, employers are searching for direction on all the elements of DEI. For companies that have stayed the course on commitments made in 2020, has their rationale or articulation of their purpose changed, and how so? Has the business case for any aspect of DEI changed? How have some employers reframed their policy to focus more on inclusion and belonging, or expanded DEI roles to include supervision of talent management, corporate culture, and employee experience? What kind of anti-bias training programs are now deemed counter-productive, and which actually help? Are there alternative means for hiring and promoting the best candidates without considering demographics?
Register now
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
July 16: Navigating the New Landscape of Employee-Benefit Solutions
What was once a fairly standard set of offerings has blossomed into myriad point solutions, many of them beneficial to workers yet creating a daunting task for benefits leaders to evaluate and adopt them. With such an abundance of choice, what  new approaches are benefits leaders taking to designing comprehensive benefits packages? How are benefits experts measuring employee expectations, quality of outcomes, and return on investment? How are they informing employees about the growing complexity of what’s available to them? How can employers hold vendors accountable for delivering on their promises–and carry out changes when needed? Where are areas in which data and AI can help with complicated decision-making?
Register now
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
August 13: Leading the Charge on Skills-Based Learning and Development
In the movement towards focusing more on skills than on degrees and work experience, L&D professionals are tasked with transforming age-old systems of measuring worker aptitude. What are the elements of moving toward a new system–and how can AI and other technologies help? What are the best methods of creating a taxonomy of skills needed in an organization, now and in the future? How can L&D leaders systematically judge situations where upskilling will be effective, or reskilling is needed? What are the best new methods of training, including the use of simulations to imitate real-world applications? Can employers design programs that have a more durable impact, so that workers don’t slip back into their old ways of doing things? How can L&D experts gain more insights from the skills data they’re gathering?
Register now
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
September 10: Productivity Boosters: How HR Leaders Can Play a Significant Role in Worker Efficiency
When workers can get more done with less time or effort, everyone benefits. How can HR leaders collaborate with their management peers to evaluate workflows, staffing levels, digital tools, and other elements that affect worker efficiency? What are the leadership approaches that increase workforce productivity–and how can managers be developed to lead with authenticity, empathy and adaptivity? Why do productivity-boosting changes often encounter resistance–and how can those obstacles be overcome? What is the role of priority-setting in helping workers manage their time?

VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
October 15: Building and Managing a Global Workforce: Smart Strategies for Collaborating Across Borders
Most major corporations need to distribute their work across regions, markets, and labor pools. Yet it can be immensely challenging to overcome all the barriers of language, culture, legal systems, and the effect of time and distance. What solutions are talent-acquisition and talent-management experts using to close the gaps? What are the emerging technologies and leadership skills that can help managers be more effective in supervising both workflow and worker well-being? What are the keys to managing a contingent workforce on a globally coordinated basis?
Register now
LIVE EVENT
 
October 21: Boston, MA - The New Era of Investing in Humans
In the face of increasing pressure for productivity, how can companies grow while building a culture based on trust and values? Employers will need to take a greater stake in the future of their employees. In our conference of HR leaders and colleagues, we’ll explore breakthroughs in thinking about how to make work fulfilling, create a sense of community, help employees increase their skills and performance, and produce better managers. You’ll discover the most innovative approaches in such fields as talent acquisition, total rewards, benefits, learning and development, employee engagement, AI and HR technology, and inclusion and belonging.
Register now
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
November 12: The Empowering Effect of HR Tech: Deciding Where It Will Make a Difference
A technology boom has provided HR leaders with both opportunities and challenges. On the one hand, AI and other new tech can help match people to workforce needs, reduce bias in hiring, and produce an abundance of data to inform people-management decisions. On the other hand, HR experts need to venture beyond their comfort zones to embrace new tech platforms, collaborate energetically with colleagues with different expertise, choose among myriad new offerings, and recognize the limits and pitfalls of technology. What ideas and advice can be offered by HR leaders who’ve taken an innovative approach to embracing new technology? What are the new frontiers yet to be explored?
Register now
LIVE EVENT
 
November 18: Miami, FL - The New Era of Investing in Humans
In the face of increasing pressure for productivity, how can companies grow while building a culture based on trust and values? Employers will need to take a greater stake in the future of their employees. In our conference of HR leaders and colleagues, we’ll explore breakthroughs in thinking about how to make work fulfilling, create a sense of community, help employees increase their skills and performance, and produce better managers. You’ll discover the most innovative approaches in such fields as talent acquisition, total rewards, benefits, learning and development, employee engagement, AI and HR technology, and inclusion and belonging.
Register now
LIVE EVENT
 
December 3: Los Angeles, CA - The New Era of Investing in Humans
In the face of increasing pressure for productivity, how can companies grow while building a culture based on trust and values? Employers will need to take a greater stake in the future of their employees. In our conference of HR leaders and colleagues, we’ll explore breakthroughs in thinking about how to make work fulfilling, create a sense of community, help employees increase their skills and performance, and produce better managers. You’ll discover the most innovative approaches in such fields as talent acquisition, total rewards, benefits, learning and development, employee engagement, AI and HR technology, and inclusion and belonging.
Register now
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
December 10: What’s Around the Corner: Workers and Workplaces in 2026 and Beyond
Work changed radically in the first half of the decade, but more change is sure to come. What are the emerging contours? What further tasks will humans delegate to automation and what new skills will workers need to acquire? What will be the future of the full-time job, the career path, and the role of managers? HR leaders, researchers, thinkers and doers will offer their unconventional predictions about the future of work and workers.
Register now
