subject: Master Time Management in Mentoring + Celebrating 5 Years of Bridging Differences!
body:
Master Time Management in Mentoring + Celebrating 5 Years of Bridging Differences!
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
 
 
 
Effective 
time management
 is a cornerstone of any
 successful mentoring relationship
. By intentionally scheduling regular, focused time for mentoring conversations, you can build trust and ensure meaningful progress. Earlier this month, we spoke with Thought Leader 
Katie McDonald
, a self-care and productivity expert, about strategies for balancing responsibilities and creating lasting impact in mentoring relationships.
    
We're also celebrating 5 years since the release of 
Bridging Differences for Better Mentoring
.  The book feels as relevant now as it did 5 years ago.  We'd love to 
hear from you
 how Bridging Differences has influenced you.
Below, you’ll find multiple resources to help you refine your time management plan for your mentoring relationship. Have any tips or tricks that work for you? We’d love to hear them—feel free to share your ideas with us!
Mentor on,
The Center for Mentoring Excellence Team
 
Can you believe it’s been five years? 
The end of this month marks the 
5th anniversary 
of 
Bridging Differences for Better Mentoring
! For half a decade, this groundbreaking book has helped mentors and mentees navigate differences to build meaningful, productive relationships.
We’re excited to celebrate this milestone with you!
 Over the next several weeks, we’ll share insights, tips, and exclusive content inspired by the book to deepen your mentoring practice. To kick things off, listen in as coauthors Lisa Fain and Lois Zachary 
share their take
 on the challenges and opportunities of mentoring in an increasingly diverse workplace.
Here’s to the power of mentoring and building bridges across differences!
 
In a recent episode of the 
Do It! Marketing
 podcast
, our own Lisa Fain, shares her journey from law to leadership in mentoring. She dives into the true definition of mentoring, how it builds better leaders, and the impact of creating a strong mentoring culture. Lisa also discusses her certification program and the power of 
Touch Base Interviews (TBIs)
 in fostering meaningful connections. Don’t miss this insightful conversation! 🎧 
Listen here
.
 
In 
Episode 17
 of our Thought Leader Conversation Series, Lisa Fain speaks with 
Katie McDonald
, founder of 
b.nourished
, about the intersection of 
time management, self-care, and mentoring
. Katie shares her journey from burnout to balance, highlighting the shift from relentless productivity to intentional presence. Together, they explore mindset shifts and practical strategies—like small, consistent rituals—that help mentors cultivate resilience and model well-being.
 
Unlock the Power of Peer Mentoring
Peer mentoring offers a dynamic way to grow personally and professionally by fostering collaboration, trust, and real-time support. Unlike traditional mentorship, it’s a give-and-take relationship where both individuals learn from each other, share insights, and navigate challenges together. Discover why workplaces are embracing this approach and how it can benefit your career. 
Read more here
.
 
 
Our February Thought Leader, Katie McDonald, shared her 
top book recommendations for mastering time management and nurturing balance in mentoring relationships
. 
The Emotionally Exhausted Woman
 by Nancy Collier offers a compassionate perspective on overwhelm as an opportunity for self-awareness. 
The Compound Effec
t
 by Darren Hardy highlights the power of small, consistent actions that drive lasting change. Finally, 
Heart-Minded Living
 by Sarah Blondin encourages us to reconnect with ourselves and embrace being over constant doing. These resources provide valuable insights to support both mentors and mentees in managing time and energy effectively.
 
 
"
Mentoring is a brain to pick, an ear to listen, and a push in the right direction.
" 
This insightful quote by John C. Crosby captures the essence of effective mentoring—not just being present, but offering meaningful engagement through attentive listening, thoughtful guidance, and actionable support.
 
UPCOMING EVENTS
Visit our LinkTree
 for upcoming events
 
Thought Leader Conversation
Coaching in Mentoring
with Professor David Clutterbuck
Wednesday, March 26, 2025
9am PST | 12pm EST | 5pm GMT
Register Here
In our upcoming 
March Thought Leader Conversation
, CEO Lisa Fain sits down with 
David Clutterbuck
 to explore 
Coaching in Mentoring
. David is one of the foremost global authorities in coaching and mentoring, a pioneer who introduced supported mentoring to Europe in the early 1980s, David has authored over 80 books on coaching, mentoring, leadership, and management. As co-founder and Special Ambassador of the European Mentoring & Coaching Council, David brings unparalleled expertise to this conversation, sharing insights on how coaching principles can strengthen mentoring relationships and drive impactful results. Don’t miss this 
opportunity to learn
 from a true mentoring trailblazer!
 
 
CalSAE Elevate Conference
Peer Mentoring for Engagement and Retention: Strengthening Association Communities
with Lisa Fain
April 6-9, 2025 
Monterey Marriott 
350 Calle Principal, Monterey, CA 93940
Lisa will be speaking on April 7 at 3:45 PM PT 
at the 
CalSAE Elevate Conference
 in scenic Monterey, California. Her session, "
Peer Mentoring for Engagement and Retention: Strengthening Association Communities,
" will explore strategies to enhance engagement and build stronger association communities through peer mentoring.
Register by February 14 to save $100
 with early bird pricing! 
Learn more and register
.
 
 
Thought Leader Conversation
Goal Setting in Mentoring
with Jason VanDevere
Tuesday June 10, 2025
11am PST | 2pm EST 
Register Here
In our upcoming 
June Thought Leader Conversation
, CEO Lisa Fain sits down with 
Jason VanDevere
, founder of 
Goal Crazy
, is an entrepreneur, business owner, author, and personal development coach passionate about helping others turn aspirations into reality through intentional goal setting. As he prepares to release his new book, 
Do Your Dream: The Step-by-Step Process to Discover Your Perfect Business Idea and Launch It This Year
, Jason joins Lisa Fain to discuss how structured 
goal setting
 can enhance mentoring relationships
, drive personal and professional growth, and ensure lasting success. Don’t miss this opportunity to gain practical tools and insights to take your mentoring—and goal achievement—to the next level!
 
We'd love your feedback on our newsletters or suggestions on things you would like us to include. 
Click here
 to share your thoughts.

update your preferences
 or 
unsubscribe from this list
.

Gain insights from KPMG, Legal & General Investment Management, and Lloyds as they share initiatives helping them to boost innovation, team collaboration, productivity and success.

EU Directives explained… 
If you missed our recent webinar exploring the new EU legislation around the accessibility and corporate sustainability directives, don’t worry! We’ve summarised the most important parts over on our blog. 
Discover what the new sustainability and accessibility directives mean for you. Uncover 3 ways technology can help. 
Read the blog

The e-module will provide you with the skills and confidence to have open conversations about disability and neurodiversity.

.
 
 
User researchers share their approach to digital accessibility  
From recruitment to integrating accessibility into the user research process, these user researchers share all. 
Discover what they had to say & be inspired
.
 
Former U.S. Assistant Secretary of Education Joins Everway as VP of Policy 
 
Glenna Wright-Gallo will play a crucial role in shaping Everway’s policy agenda, advocating for innovative solutions that address the unique needs of diverse learners and workers. 
Read more
. 
Affinity Water & Everway: Championing neurodiversity in business together 
 
Our friends at Affinity Water have been using our software, Read&Write for Work, to break down barriers in the workplace. They've also just taken another step in their milestone as a neuroinclusive employer. They’ve recently joined us in becoming members of Neurodiversity in Business (NIB) - a non-profit forum dedicated to fostering neuroinclusivity in the workplace. 
Discover more, and explore other initiatives helping them to champion a culture of belonging for all
 
.
 
We want to hear from you 
We want to give you content that you find useful. So, we'd love to hear from you. What topics would you love to see featured in this newsletter? Or do you have a good neuroinclusion story to tell? Your input will help us to bring you valuable content in return.

subject: We’re sorry to have missed you!
body:
Watch the full discussion on demand today!
 
We missed you during our panel discussion, 
Leveraging Technology for Better Recruiting Outcomes
.
 But you can still catch up!
 
Shane Noe, Marilyn Pearson Hendricks, and Ben Eubanks tried to address a question many talent teams are asking: Is today’s talent tech stack an asset or a limitation? They shared real-world strategies to cut costs, boost efficiency, and ensure your recruiting tools work for you — not against you.
 
Watch now for key highlights, including:
Are more tools better? Insights from industry experts 
Real-world tech stack challenges and solutions
The critical role of IT in tech stack efficiency
Strategies to prevent tech overload before it starts
Watch the recording
 
We’ll be sharing even more insights in March during our next Findem Live with Marathon Health!
 
Hiring today requires speed, precision, and the right data to be successful. See how Marathon Health’s Laura Lazewski and her team used AI to:
✅ Boosted email open rates to 60%
✅ Cut sourcing time for top candidates down to 10 minutes
✅ Reduced sourcing-to-offer time to just one week

subject: Larry, learn from KPMG, Lloyds & Legal & General
body:
Discover how neurodiversity drives high-performing workplaces.
 
Neurodiversity at Work: Success Strategies from Leading Brands
 
Live Panel Discussion | March 27, 2025 | 10 AM ET | 3 PM GMT 
Register now 
Neurodiversity isn’t just a conversation - it’s a competitive advantage. Yet many organizations still struggle to create environments where neurodivergent employees can truly thrive. 
On March 27, join industry leaders from 
KPMG
, 
Legal & General
, and 
Lloyds 
as they share proven strategies for building more inclusive workplaces that drive innovation, engagement, and business success. 
Why attend
 
Get real-world insights from top brands leading the way in neuroinclusion
 
Learn practical steps to attract, retain, and empower neurodivergent talent 
Understand how neurodiverse teams fuel creativity, problem-solving, and retention
 
This interactive panel discussion is your opportunity to 
ask questions, gain insights, and take away actionable strategies
 
to implement in your own workplace.
Don't miss out 
Meet the experts 
 
Christina Taylor, KPMG 
Inclusion & Equity Manager
 
Christina is a dedicated advocate for inclusion and diversity, particularly for individuals with disabilities, leveraging her professional experience and personal insights to drive positive change. 
 
Mark Lomas, Lloyds 
Head of Culture, Human Resources
 
Mark is a seasoned Diversity & Culture expert with a proven track record in driving impactful change, particularly in the financial services sector. 
 
Jacquline Alcindor, LGIM 
Equity, Inclusion & Diversity Lead
 
With a strong background in banking and an MBA from Westminster University, Jacquline brings strategic thinking and a results-oriented approach to her DEI work. 
Let's build workplaces where every brain can thrive. 
Secure your spot 
Kind regards, 
The Everway team

subject: In Case You Missed It #55: Workers prefer flexibility as companies roll out return-to-office mandates and more
body:
ICYMI 
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
Greetings Larry,
To help you filter the signal from the noise, I curated the most valuable articles I came across recently in case you missed them.
“
Workers prefer flexibility as companies roll out return-to-office mandates
” (Scripps News)
Summary
A FlexJobs survey revealed that 57% of workers would "absolutely" seek a new job if their current role required full in-office attendance. While hybrid and remote work are overwhelmingly preferred, nearly a quarter of respondents experienced return-to-office mandates in the past year. An emerging trend, dubbed "hushed hybrid," allows employees to work remotely with their manager's quiet approval, despite official mandates. However, career experts advocate open communication about flexible work instead of relying on covert arrangements. Companies like Kforce are capitalizing on the demand for flexibility, embracing remote-first hybrid models as a competitive advantage for attracting and retaining talent. Experts warn that rigid return-to-office policies could alienate employees who prioritize flexibility, growth, and work-life balance.
Dr. Gleb’s Take
Forcing workers back to the office is a strategic misstep in today’s workplace. The data is clear: employees value flexibility and will leave if denied it. “Hushed hybrid” arrangements are a symptom of misaligned leadership that prioritizes outdated norms over results. Organizations like Kforce, which embrace flexibility, are reaping the rewards of higher retention and increased talent acquisition. Leaders need to adapt. The future of work is hybrid, and clinging to traditional office models is a losing strategy. Focus on output, empower your employees with autonomy, and stop micromanaging where and how work gets done. Those who fail to evolve will hemorrhage talent to competitors who understand the value of modern workplace flexibility.
“
Employees should not bear the sole responsibility for learning in remote work
” (Phys.org)
Summary
A study by the University of Eastern Finland highlights significant challenges in remote learning and professional development. Employees in remote work environments often juggle online training alongside other tasks, leading to superficial learning outcomes. Many organizations rely on lecture-heavy content, offering certificates of participation rather than fostering deep learning or practical application. The study also revealed that remote work weakens social bonds and trust, which are essential for innovation and learning. Structured, content-heavy meetings overshadow spontaneous, informal interactions—where new ideas often emerge. To address these issues, the study advocates for targeted training aligned with actual skill needs, diverse interactive methods, and opportunities for reflection and experimentation. It also calls for enabling informal encounters to sustain innovation and community trust.
Dr. Gleb’s Take
This study exposes a glaring failure in how organizations approach remote learning. Expecting employees to independently manage learning in a busy remote work environment is shortsighted and counterproductive. Without proper support and relevance, training becomes a box-ticking exercise that wastes time and resources. Leaders need to shift from a behaviorist model of information transfer to a constructivist approach that values engagement, discussion, and social interaction. This requires a deliberate investment in designing training that aligns with employees’ real needs and work contexts. Whenever I design training programs, remote or in-person, I focus on such engagement and social peer interaction, which is vital for adult learning. Moreover, the erosion of social bonds in remote work is a red flag. Innovation thrives on trust and spontaneous collaboration. Leaders must create spaces for informal interactions—even in remote settings—to maintain a strong sense of community. Ignoring these principles risks not only stifling innovation but also alienating the very talent organizations need to succeed in a competitive environment.
"
Need a Good Night's Sleep? Try Changing How You Think About It
" (BBC)
Summary
This article examines how mindset influences sleep quality and perception. It highlights that our beliefs about sleep can shape how rested we feel, often more than the actual hours of sleep logged. For example, individuals who believe they slept poorly may feel more tired, even when their sleep was adequate by objective measures. Overemphasis on sleep quality can create anxiety, perpetuating a cycle of insomnia. Research shows that strategies like cognitive reframing, focusing on enjoyable activities, and letting go of rigid sleep expectations can improve how refreshed people feel, regardless of actual sleep duration.
Dr. Gleb’s Take
The sleep industry thrives on fearmongering, creating rigid norms about “perfect sleep” that are not only unrealistic but harmful. Sleep is highly individual, influenced by mindset, circumstances, and environment. Overemphasizing metrics like total hours or rigid sleep hygiene can backfire, fueling anxiety and worsening outcomes. The truth is that you don’t need perfect sleep to function well. What matters more is your perception and how you approach your day. Stop obsessing over your smartwatch’s sleep data and start focusing on things you enjoy. Build resilience by embracing the idea that a less-than-perfect night doesn’t have to ruin your day. This mindset shift isn’t just empowering—it’s the key to breaking free from toxic sleep narratives.
What did you think of my take on these articles? Look forward to hearing from you, simply reply to this email with your thoughts.
Decisively yours,
Dr. Gleb
Dr. Gleb Tsipursky
CEO of Disaster Avoidance Experts
Let's Connect!
Disaster Avoidance Experts is a social enterprise dedicated to promoting science-based truth-seeking and wise decision-making. All profits are donated to 
Intentional Insights
, an educational 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, and its 
Pro-Truth Pledge
 project.

subject: BDO USA + Blue Beyond: A Future Built on Deep Trust & High Expectations
body:
Insights & Information to Help Organizations and
Their People Thrive
FEBRUARY 27, 2025
    
In just a few days, Blue Beyond officially 
joins BDO USA
, embarking on an exciting new chapter. As we move forward, our commitment to building 
Deep Trust and High Expectations®
 cultures remains at the heart of everything we do — where deep trust fuels collaboration, and high expectations drive performance. 
Deep trust is the foundation of strong teams and cultures. It creates an environment where people feel safe to share ideas, collaborate openly, and take risks without fear. It fosters connection, belonging, and the confidence to innovate. But trust alone isn’t enough.
High expectations ensure that trust translates into results. It means setting clear goals, challenging people to adopt a growth mindset and stretch their capabilities, and holding teams accountable to excellence. Without deep trust, high expectations can feel rigid or overwhelming. Without high expectations, trust can become complacency.
When leaders cultivate both, they unlock the full potential of their teams — creating workplaces where people feel supported and empowered to share ideas and take risks while also being challenged to grow and contribute at their highest potential.
This aligns powerfully with 
BDO’s core purpose
 — helping people thrive, every day. Together, we will continue equipping leaders with the strategies, tools, and insights to build high-performing teams and cultures, ensuring that both the business and the people flourish.
Thank you for being a part of our Blue Beyond journey 
— 
and we look forward to connecting with you as part of BDO USA! 
Sincerely,
Cheryl Fields Tyler
Founder and CEO
Email me
 
      
Watch the Webinar: Winning on the People Side of Business: Research, Insights, and Recommendations
To learn what it takes to thrive in 2025, watch this webinar recording where we delve into the 8 major findings from our latest research study.
 
Watch Now 
      
Featured: Why Deep Trust and High Expecations® Cultures are Key to Organizational Success
Working together in an elevating, virtuous cycle, 
Deep Trust and High Expectations®
 sustainably unleashes organizational potential, agility, and business results — and in a way that is deeply fulfilling for the people in the organization. 
Learn More 
      
Leading Insights: News & Notes
 
In this episode of 
Intentional Leaders Podcast
, host Cyndi Wentland engages in a compelling conversation with our founder and CEO about the intricacies of building a thriving workplace culture, emphasizing the need for both deep trust and high expectations. 
Watch Now

SmartBrief,

Deep Trust and High Expectations® 
cultures.

subject: 📢 Strategies to Bridge Hierarchy & Build Inclusive Global Teams 🌍
body:
Continue reading for strategies to bridge the hierarchy gap in your global team. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hello Larry!
Looping back... 
⏪
In my last email, I shared how cultural hierarchies can silence voices in global teams. When power dynamics dictate who speaks and who stays quiet, organizations miss out on diverse perspectives—and that means lost innovation, engagement, and growth. 
The good news is that hierarchy doesn’t have to be a barrier. With intentional strategies, you can create an environment where all employees—regardless of title or background—feel empowered to contribute. Here’s how: 
 
1️⃣ 
Cultivate a Speak-Up Culture 
In many cultures, openly sharing opinions—especially with senior leaders—may not come naturally. Leaders must intentionally create an environment where all voices are encouraged and valued. A simple prompt like, 
"I’d love to hear different perspectives on this,"
 can make a big difference. 
✅
 
Tip:
 Implement structured meeting formats where every participant knows in advance that they will have an equal opportunity to contribute. This approach prevents dominant voices from taking over and ensures a balanced, inclusive discussion where diverse insights can thrive. 
 
2️⃣ 
Train Leaders to Navigate Diverse Communication Styles 
Silence doesn’t always mean agreement—in some cultures, it signifies respect or hesitation. Without this understanding, leaders may misinterpret engagement levels and overlook valuable input. 
✅
 
Tip:
 Equip leaders with the skills to recognize and adapt to diverse communication styles. Culturally competent leaders “read the room,” foster inclusion, and create space for all voices to be heard. 
 
3️⃣ 
Implement Structured Meeting Formats 
Unstructured discussions often amplify the loudest voices, leaving others unheard. By using clear frameworks, you create a more inclusive space where every team member has the opportunity to contribute. 
✅
 
Tip:
 Try the 
“1-2-4-All” technique
 to encourage thoughtful participation at every level:
🔹
 
1 min
 – Reflect individually on the topic.
🔹
 
2 min
 – Discuss ideas with a partner.
🔹
 
4 min
 – Share insights in small groups.
🔹
 
All
 – Present key takeaways to the larger team. 
This method ensures balanced engagement, fosters diverse perspectives, and prevents discussions from being dominated by a few voices. 
 
4️⃣ 
Establish Meaningful Mentorship Programs 
Hierarchical structures can make it difficult for employees—especially those in junior roles—to voice their opinions or concerns. A well-designed mentorship program helps bridge this gap by fostering support, guidance, and confidence-building across all levels. 
✅
 
Tip:
 Create mentorship opportunities that connect culturally diverse team members, encouraging collaboration, shared learning, and mutual support to empower every voice in the organization. 
 
5️⃣ 
Embrace a “Collective Leadership” Approach 
Foster a culture where leadership is shared, and every team member feels empowered to contribute—regardless of title or seniority. 
✅
 
Tip:
 Rotate meeting facilitators to give different team members the opportunity to lead discussions, ensuring diverse perspectives shape decision-making and challenging traditional hierarchical norms. 
 
6️⃣ 
Create Alternative Avenues for Input 
Even in the most inclusive environments, some team members may still feel hesitant to voice their opinions in group settings—whether due to cultural norms, personality differences, or past experiences. Great leaders recognize this and provide multiple ways for employees to contribute. 
✅
 
Tip:
 Encourage one-on-one check-ins where employees can share feedback privately or offer written channels like email or anonymous suggestion forms to gather insights. When leaders actively seek input through different formats, they ensure every voice is valued. 
 
🚀
 
Ready to Build a Culturally Competent Workplace?
  
Let’s create a strategy tailored to your team’s unique challenges and goals.  
📅
 
Schedule a
 
complimentary strategy call with me today!
  
 
Here’s to breaking barriers and creating more efficient, culturally competent teams!
🌍✨
 
Bye for now,

subject: Standing our ground - US Black History Month; Leadership and Compliance; and more!
body:
In this action-packed edition, you'll find:
 
 
Dear colleagues,
In this action-packed edition, you'll find:
1.
This Too Shall Pass, 
reflections from our Chair and Founder, Stephen Frost, during these trying times.
2. 
It’s still Black History Month in the US, and it’s still important
, an article exploring how racism manifests in the workplace, and the effects.
3. Highlights from our recent webinar "
Beyond SRA Compliance -– Inclusive Leadership for a Thriving Culture
".
4. An invitation to our upcoming events: 
 
"From Policy to Progress: How EU Directives Can Drive Culture Change"
"
Using Data in EDI: Driving Evidence-Based Inclusion Strategies
"
International Women's Day
 fireside chat
5. An opportunity to join our 
audiobook competition
!
 
Click on the links below to dive deeper into each topic.
 
As always, we’re here for any questions or additional information you may need.
 
Warm regards,
Your 
Included
 Team 
  
This Too Shall Pass
Many colleagues are feeling pretty flat right now. For professionals who have dedicated their lives to combatting injustice and improving people’s well-being, many are understandably scared and weary in equal measure about the events now unfolding in the States. What’s being cooked up in Washington, DC is spilling out around the globe.
Make no mistake, this is bad. For many, it’s the worst possible scenario.
Yet, at this undeniably challenging time, we need to find sustenance for the journey ahead and there are two things which I believe can help us:
 
It’s important that we don’t give in or give up
We need to learn to separate the noise from the signal
  
Continue reading...
 
It’s still Black History Month in the US, and it’s still important
This past weekend, I went to my local grocery store like I do most weekends. As I was walking to my car in the parking lot, I heard someone shout, “Go back home! We don’t want you, and we don’t need you!”
If you’re a person of colour in living in the US, this is likely a familiar experience for you. If you’re Black and living in the US, this is probably something you were taught as a child to expect to hear at some point.
This is the reality of life in America. This is why it’s so important to recognise and celebrate Black History Month, even if the federal government has decided not to anymore. This is an opportunity for organisations, and leaders, to step up.
  
Read now
 
Inclusive Leadership: Driving Performance, Not Just Compliance
At 
Included
, we know that inclusive leadership isnt just a ‘nice to have’ - it’s a business imperative. It strengthens engagement, drives retention, and enables firms to perform at their best. But how do we move beyond compliance-driven inclusion and embed it as a core part of how organisations operate?
We explored this in our recent event with leading law firms, where we were joined by Vicki Godfrey, Head of People & Culture at Kingsley Napley. The discussion focused on how law firms are embedding inclusive leadership, the challenges they face, and the opportunities to use regulation as a catalyst for change.
  
Read our post-session insights
 
From Policy to Progress: How EU Directives Can Drive Culture Change
With the Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD) now in effect and the Gender Representation Directive set to go live next year, companies with an EU presence face an evolving regulatory landscape that extends far beyond pay equity and transparency.
At the same time, organisations in the UK are finalising their gender pay gap submissions, with encouragement to extend to disability and ethnicity pay gap reporting too. Whilst the US may push back on EDI, the rest of the world pushes forward,
Join us for another insightful webinar where, this time, we’ll explore how these EU directives are reshaping workplace expectations and what they mean for your organisation.
  
Sign-up here
 
Using Data in EDI: Driving Evidence-Based Inclusion Strategies
In today’s data-driven world, harnessing the right insights is key to building inclusive workplaces. But how can law firms effectively use data to inform and enhance their EDI strategies?
In this session, discover how to leverage data for meaningful change by:
•    Identifying key metrics that reflect inclusion and equity in your organisation
•    Using data to measure, monitor, and improve EDI initiatives
•    Embedding evidence-based strategies into everyday practices
•    Equipping leaders with insights to drive accountability and inclusive growth
  
Sign-up here
 
Breaking Barriers: Beyond the Hashtags, Beyond IWD
The conversation on equity and inclusion cannot be confined to a single day. As Women’s History Month comes to a close, join us for a powerful and thought-provoking session with keynote speaker 
Dimple Agarwal
, a leader and advocate for equity in the workplace.
In this session, Dimple will bring to life the realities of workplace culture and discrimination, the barriers to real inclusion, and the urgent need for systemic change. Drawing from her extensive experience, both in the corporate world and supporting individuals facing discrimination, she will challenge the myths of corporate progress and provide tangible actions to accelerate action and drive meaningful change. 
  
Sign-up here
 
The Key to Inclusion Audiobook
 
We are delighted to share that our book, 
The Key to Inclusion
, is soon to be available in audio format. This book, written in 2022, is a practical guide to Diversity, Equity and Belonging for You, Your Team and Your Organisation. Recognising the importance of diversity, belonging and equity is not enough and this book has the practical guidance needed to think differently and make true inclusion a reality.
To mark this exciting moment, we are offering you the chance of winning a free audio book code. Please visit the below link for further information. Good Luck!
 
Find out more
 
Find out more about 
Included
’s approach to diversity 
here
 and take a look at our 
Impact Report
. 
Please 
get in touch
 with us anytime to have a conversation about making your organisation more diverse and more inclusive.  We look forward to hearing from you. 
From all of us at 
Included
 
 
 
You are receiving this email because you subscribed to the 
Included 
email newsletter. 
Included 
is committed to ensuring the security and protection of all data we process. For more information on how we use your data, read 
our privacy policy
. 
Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can 
update your preferences
 or 
unsubscribe from this list

body:

 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

From Resistance to Results: The Psychology of Generative AI Integration
. You can read the book proposal
 
here
.
The publisher is interested in real-world case studies on how organizations with over 20 people are adopting generative AI.

subject: Baratunde Thurston Explores What it Means to be 'More Human' in the Age of AI
body:
Explore What it Means to be 'More Human' in the Age of AI with Bestselling Author Baratunde Thurston!
 
 
Explore What it Means to be 'More Human' in the Age of AI with Bestselling Author Baratunde Thurston!
 
 
In the age of AI how do we think critically, act responsibly, and lead purposefully? With a focus on the power of "citizenship as a verb," you are invited to explore how to  contribute meaningfully to your workplaces, communities, and society in the midst of a technological revolution.
 
From the ethical implications of artificial intelligence and the rising importance of environmental stewardship to the significance of racial equity and inclusive leadership, learn strategies to build a future where technology enhances humanity, diversity drives
progress, and citizenship becomes an active, collective pursuit.
 
We are excited to have Baratunde as one of our Keynote Speakers at the 
2025 Justice for All Summit: The Power of Inclusion
.
Reserve Your Seat
 
More about Baratunde:
Baratunde Thurston is an Emmy- nominated storyteller, producer, and thought leader weaving stories of interdependence across our relationships with nature, humans, and technology. As the host of PBS's 
America Outdoors with Baratunde Thurston
 and the creator of the acclaimed 
How To Citizen
 podcast, Baratunde has redefined citizenship as a practice of active participation, responsibility, and community building. His newest podcast, 
Life with Machines
, produced in partnership with Lenovo, explores the human side of the AI revolution by asking, "How can these machines help us become more human?
 
A New York Times best- selling author of How To Be Black and a TED speaker praised by MSNBC's Brian Williams as "one of the greatest of all time," Baratunde connects dots between culture, climate, politics, and technology in ways that empower and enlighten. A board member of BUILD.org and the Brooklyn Public Library, he continues to inspire through his work and commitment to a more connected, compassionate world. 
Register Now
 
More about The 2025 Justice for All Summit: The Power of Inclusion
 
What is the Justice for All Summit?
The third annual Justice for All Summit, being held April 21-24, 2025, is the premier virtual conference to connect, get inspired, and learn innovative strategies for cultural transformation through diversity, equity, inclusion, and justice practices.
Who attends?
This restorative space brings together between 500 - 750 HR practitioners, executives, team leaders, learning and development staff, corporate trainers, organizational development professionals, and diversity practitioners in community for learning, networking, and personal/professional development.
 
Who is The Winters Group?
Proudly Black women-owned and -led, The Winters Group has helped organizations strategically increase their capacity to be more culturally competent, create sustainable equitable policies, and foster inclusive workplaces since 1984.
Reserve Your Seat
 
 
 
 
 
The Winters Group, 8116 South Tryon Street, Ste. B3-260, Charlotte, North Carolina 28273, United States

Upcoming Webinar: March 19th
REGISTER TODAY
Every organization has faced unstable periods or change, but what makes an organization last is ensuring that decisions during these times are not made out of fear. Unpredictability in external factors and events can influence our organizations and lives in ways we could never imagine sometimes (i.e. covid, changes in government, policy shifts, natural disasters, etc.).
These tools will not only help build resilience amongst the leadership but every employee. Even if you believe that you as a leader and your organization are in a stable place, it never hurts to reevaluate how you are connecting with your team. 
There are three areas of influence that team leaders can work within to reduce overwhelm, confusion, and burnout within their teams and organizations and lead with clarity and confidence. Learn more from our latest 
LinkedIn Newsletter
 for a sneak peek of what will be discussed during the webinar.
There is still time to register for the upcoming webinar!
 During the webinar, Natalie Rodgers will dive deeper into tools you can implement to cut through uncertainty and lead your team with clarity.

Tools to Cut Through Uncertainty & Lead Your Team with Clarity

subject: How “artifacts” can define your legacy
body:
Plus: finding the right investors. 
February 26, 2025  ·  
View in browser
 
The Insightful Leader
BY 
KELLOGG INSIGHT
Leadership advice from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University
Good morning, 
This week, we look at how family-enterprise leaders can identify “artifacts,” or objects and stories that convey meaning, to transmit the firm’s values across generations.
We also have advice for startup founders on how to find funders who share their company’s vision.
From framed dollar bills to inspiring stories
One critical aspect of ensuring the success of any family enterprise is the transmission of core values from generation to generation. But according to Kellogg’s 
Matt Allen
, a clinical professor and executive director of the Ward Center for Family Enterprises, facilitating that continuity can be tough without a defined legacy of the company’s values, especially as those values are likely to evolve from generation to generation.
“Anytime you have a generational transition in a business, you’ve got different viewpoints on what each feels is important,” says Allen. “Developing a legacy that both grounds the company in the past and provides a clear direction for the future can be tricky.”
So Allen recommends that leaders use artifacts—verbal, physical, relational, and emotional messages—to help define and transmit the company’s legacy. These can be stories from the company’s history, locales like its first production facility or store location, or objects like a framed dollar bill from a company’s first transaction.
When deciding on what these artifacts could be for your family enterprise, look for emotional connection to the firm’s values, Allen advises. It also helps to be specific enough that it speaks to the family’s history but broad enough that it gives nonfamily employees a guide.
“We don’t want to use artifacts that are so specific that they hold you back, that they keep the next generation from moving forward, or become uninspiring,” Allen says.
Read more in 
Kellogg Insight
.
 
Find your angels
Leaders looking to scale startup businesses often have to raise money to realize that growth. Finding the right investors—who can offer more than just cash but can be genuine partners in the company’s vision—can be tricky. Kellogg entrepreneurship professor and serial investor 
Jeffrey Eschbach
 has some advice for making the most of your relationships with angels.
Start by laying the groundwork, from detailing your goals and updating your social media to preparing executive summaries and really crunching the numbers on what you will realistically need to succeed.
“You do have to do a little bit of calculating,” Eschbach says. “When a founder merely requests funding to extend their operating runway for another 12 months, I worry that they aren’t focused on clear results. I want to know what they plan to achieve—additional revenue targets, improved tech, new partnerships—by spending my investment dollars.”
Eschbach recommends leaning into your existing networks to find potential investors—or advice and introductions from other successful founders. Once you have identified potential investors, it’s critical to keep nurturing the relationships based as much on the angels’ expertise as on their ability to provide funding.
“There’s a saying in the funding world, ‘If you want money, ask for feedback. If you want feedback, ask for money,’” he says.
When building those relationships, it helps to have a clear picture of the funders’ investing history, their approach to mentorship, and their financial expectations for the investor relationship from timelines to returns.
“Even though you’ll work hard, angel investors need to mentally assume the money’s gone,” Eschbach says. “With startups, there may never even be an exit, and they have to be 100 percent comfortable with that.”
Read more in 
Kellogg Insight
.
“[Financial] advisors are going to become scarce. They’re going to be harder to find, which, in some sense, for the ones that are in the industry is good news because it makes them in more demand.”
— 
Robert Korajczyk
, in
 
Fortune
, on the impact of AI on the wealth management industry.
See you next week,
Fred Schmalz, business and art editor
Kellogg Insight
Follow us on 
LinkedIn
.
And listen to our 
podcasts
.
Kellogg School of Management
 | 
2211 Campus Drive
, 
Evanston, IL 60208

subject: GenZ is unwavering on inclusion - cutting back will cost you 💸💸
body:
📅 
Happenings
MAR. FREE WEBINAR - BOLSTER YOUR ERG STRATEGY
 -
 
Join us for a free open webinar, 
Mar. 17th at 12pm ET
. During this webinar we will chat through how to revamp your ERG strategy and share best practices. We’ll cover best practices and the current status of company ERGs, a case study for an ERG strategy refresh, and ideas to engage ALLIES in your organization’s ERGs. 
Register for free here
.
INTERNATIONAL ALLYSHIP DAY
 - Join us in NYC or virtually on August 8th for our 
2nd annual International Allyship Day event
, hosted by our partner AllianceBernstein. This year’s focus is on equipping inclusion and ERG leaders with actionable strategies to strengthen or launch allyship programs within their organizations. Participants will gain essential skills for effective allyship, pushback-proof strategies, and insights into the strategic business impact of allyship. They’ll also have the chance to connect with senior leaders in the inclusion space. We're consistently adding exciting new speakers and organizations like Coqual and Dr. Sandra Upton - 
will your organization be there?
 
Register individually or as a team here
.
​
 
​
📝 GenZ is unwavering on inclusion - cutting back will cost you 💸
This week I published a Forbes article about how Gen Z's commitment to inclusion is non-negotiable and how companies that backtrack on DEI initiatives risk losing top talent. 
Gen Z's unwavering stance on inclusion is reshaping the workplace, and companies must adapt or risk significant losses. EduBirdie recently did an analysis of Google Trends that revealed a staggering 822% surge in searches for “companies with DEI” following Trump’s executive orders rolling back anti-discrimination policy. This data signals a strong preference for inclusive workplaces among younger generations. This comes at a critical time, as potential shifts in federal policy threaten to dismantle hard-won DEI gains. While DEI initiatives are not without flaws, abandoning them entirely is not the solution. 
Instead, companies must pivot and strengthen what works, recognizing that discrimination lawsuits far outweigh the risks of defending inclusion. Gen Z, the most diverse generation in U.S. history, is watching closely. 
​
Join the ongoing conversation about this article and read more here.
​
Thanks allies,
Julie
​
💬 
Allyship Conversation Starters & Resources
​
Employers shouldn’t abandon diversity efforts, SHRM says
​
​
​
Foot traffic fell at Target after it backtracked on DEI
 👀
Care about inclusion for the little ones in your life? Check out the programs and resources from 
LITTLE ALLIES
, a nonprofit working to facilitate inclusive experiences for all children to feel seen, heard, and belong.
​
Next Pivot Point
 
works to promote allyship and inclusion across all dimensions of diversity in the workplace to make sure everyone feels seen, heard, and belonging at work.

subject: 22 Million Reasons to Accommodate Work-From-Home Requests (Wise Decision Maker Guide 144)
body:
Wise Decision Maker Guide 
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
Greetings Larry,
The recent $22.1 million verdict in the case of Billesdon v. Wells Fargo Securities, Inc. has cast a spotlight on the increasing legal risks companies face when they ignore work-from-home (WFH) requests under the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). 
This landmark case underscores the critical need for employers to understand
 their obligations under the ADA
, particularly in the evolving landscape of remote work.
To learn more, check out this 
blog
.
Read Blog
 
Prefer video to text? See this 
video
 based on the blog:
If you prefer audio, listen to this 
podcast
 based on the blog:
Make Your Voice Heard
Vote in this 
LinkedIn poll
 to contribute to the conversation. I will use the responses to inform my articles in 
Harvard Business Review
, 
Fortune
, and 
Entrepreneur
.
Your Testimonials
You and others who gain value from Disaster Avoidance Experts 
services
 and thought leadership occasionally share testimonials about your experience, such as the one below. You can read more testimonials 
here
.
“Thanks, Dr. Gleb, for a very insightful eLearning Webinar presentation, ‘Why Do Insurance Professionals Ignore Serious Risks (And What to Do About It).’ 
Attendees were fully engaged
 throughout the event and we appreciate your insights on a very important topic for our community.”
Tricia Stillman
, 
Education Program Director, Insurance Accounting & Systems Association
Schedule a Free Consultation
 
What's Up With Me
The mother of a close friend of mine recently suffered a serious medical issue and spent over a week in a hospital. She is generous and kind, and had invited me to her house for Thanksgiving several times, and I in turn hosted her at my house for several parties. Thus, I decided to visit her to provide her with some company and food after she returned home from the hospital (I didn’t visit her in the hospital because I was in Los Angeles at the time). 
My visit wasn’t only out of loyalty to my friend or due to my own feeling of connection to his mother. There was also something else: my desire to have a community when I’m in my 80s, with people visiting me when I am sick or homebound. I try to act in a way that creates the world that I would like to see, and this action was one way of doing so. I brought her some frozen meals, and we spent about an hour talking. I enjoyed the experience more than I expected. So 
consider taking actions to create a better world, and you might enjoy it more than you expected
, too.
Would love to get your feedback on what you found most useful about this edition of the “Wise Decision Maker Guide” - simply reply to this email.
Decisively Yours,
Dr. Gleb
Dr. Gleb Tsipursky
CEO of Disaster Avoidance Experts
PS: Are we connected on LinkedIn? If not, 
please add me
.
Did you miss out on reading any of my bestselling books?
Never Go With Your Gut: How Pioneering Leaders Make the Best Decisions and Avoid Business Disasters
 (Career Press, 2019)
The Blindspots Between Us: How to Overcome Unconscious Cognitive Bias and Build Better Relationships
 
(New Harbinger, 2020)
Returning to the Office and Leading Hybrid and Remote Teams: A Manual on Benchmarking to Best Practices for Competitive Advantage
 
(Intentional Insights, 2021)

forward this email
 
to a colleague or friend who might find it helpful.

free

,

Let's be safe!

as

MEMBER SPOTLIGHT
How a skincare brand boosts team culture with WeWork
Read now
 
Meet Skin + Me
2 Eastbourne Terrace, London I Member since 2024
London-based beauty company Skin + Me knows skincare isn't one-size-fits-all. That's why they're creating science-backed, accessible, and individualized products for all skin types. With a headcount of 100+ and growing, they needed a space for their team to connect, focus, and do their best work– that's where WeWork came in.
Read now
 
Creating the future of skincare
Just like how WeWork spaces seamlessly adapt to different businesses' needs, Skin + Me creates effective, dermatologist-approved products by continuously adapting to their individual users' needs.
“Our office plays a huge role in how we collaborate, and WeWork gives us the perfect setup for in-person teamwork.”
Rachel Jones, Co-Founder
 
Building a dynamic (and fun) workplace
Skin + Me's new private, full-floor space – an upgrade from their previous shared office – encourages collaboration and removes the stress of office management. Now, it's somewhere the team wants to be, not has to be.
Find your office

subject: Ireland’s Proposed EU Pay Transparency Transposition
body:
Our experts share what’s entailed and what it means for your pay transparency compliance.
 
 
Hi Larry,
 
It’s not too late to register for our webinar breaking down Ireland’s proposed transposition of the EU Pay Transparency Directive. 
You only have one compensation cycle left before compliance begins
 — our legal team is here to help you understand how to comply in Ireland and the EU.
 
What you’ll learn:
How Ireland’s pay transparency bill differs from the EU Directive
New employer obligations, including mandatory salary disclosure
Best practices for navigating compliance with the upcoming changes
Potential penalties and enforcement mechanisms
Register today and keep your organization on top of the latest in pay transparency legislation!
Register Now

If you missed our recent webinar exploring the new EU legislation around the accessibility and corporate sustainability directives, don’t worry! We’ve summarised the most important parts over on our blog. 
Discover what the new sustainability and accessibility directives mean for you. Uncover 3 ways technology can help. 
Read the blog 
 
Free disability & neurodiversity e-module from Lloyds Banking Group 
The e-module will provide you with the skills and confidence to have open conversations about disability and neurodiversity. 
Discover more & gain access now
.
 
 
User researchers share their approach to digital accessibility  
From recruitment to integrating accessibility into the user research process, these user researchers share all. 
Discover what they had to say & be inspired
.
 
Former U.S. Assistant Secretary of Education Joins Everway as VP of Policy 
 
Glenna Wright-Gallo will play a crucial role in shaping Everway’s policy agenda, advocating for innovative solutions that address the unique needs of diverse learners and workers. 
Read more
. 
Affinity Water & Everway: Championing neurodiversity in business together 
 
Our friends at Affinity Water have been using our software, Read&Write for Work, to break down barriers in the workplace. They've also just taken another step in their milestone as a neuroinclusive employer. They’ve recently joined us in becoming members of Neurodiversity in Business (NIB) - a non-profit forum dedicated to fostering neuroinclusivity in the workplace. 
Discover more, and explore other initiatives helping them to champion a culture of belonging for all
 
.
 
We want to hear from you 
We want to give you content that you find useful. So, we'd love to hear from you. What topics would you love to see featured in this newsletter? Or do you have a good neuroinclusion story to tell? Your input will help us to bring you valuable content in return. 
 
Reach out to 
abby@texthelp.com
 and let us know!  
Kind regards, 
The Everway team 
formerly Texthelp

subject: 📢 Navigating Hierarchy in Global Organizations 🌍
body:
Continue reading to understand how hierarchical differences impact your global team. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hello Larry!
 
💡
 Is Hierarchy Silencing Voices in Your Global Team? 
🌍✨
 
 
🛑
 Picture this:
You’re in a high-stakes meeting with a team spanning multiple countries. As ideas are exchanged, a junior employee from Japan remains silent, while a senior manager from the U.S. dominates the discussion. Later, you learn that the junior employee had a brilliant insight but didn’t feel comfortable speaking up due to cultural norms around hierarchy.
 
🤔
 The Experience:
For many leaders managing global teams, hierarchy can be a silent barrier to true inclusion. In some cultures, freely speaking in front of senior leaders is seen as disrespectful, while in others, open debate is expected. The result? Employees hold back, innovation stalls and diverse perspectives never reach the table. 
 
⚠️ 
The Problem:
When hierarchical structures clash across cultures, it creates:
❌
 A lack of psychological safety, where employees hesitate to share ideas.
❌
 Power imbalances that reinforce exclusion rather than inclusion.
❌
 Decision-making that leans toward dominant voices, leaving diverse insights unheard. 
Organizations seeking diverse team input often underestimate the influence of cultural hierarchies on participation, unintentionally sidelining valuable perspectives. 
 
💡
 The Future You’re Waiting For:
Imagine a workplace where:
✅
 Employees, regardless of title or background, feel empowered to contribute.
✅
 Teams leverage cultural differences as strengths, rather than obstacles.
✅
 Leadership actively fosters an inclusive environment that balances hierarchy with collaboration. 
This future isn’t just possible—it’s essential for thriving in today’s global workforce. 
 
🎤
  What’s Next:
In the next email, I’ll share specific strategies to bridge hierarchy gaps and create an inclusive, psychologically safe global workplace.  
Keep an eye on your inbox—you won’t want to miss it! 
🔜
 
Stay tuned for Part 2!
 
 
Bye for now, 
Luiza
___________________________________
 
Luiza Dreasher, President and CEO (she/her/hers)
Mastering Cultural Differences 
I work with leaders who want to create a work environment where all employees feel valued and want to stay.
At 
Mastering Cultural Differences LLC,
 we are committed to helping organizations build inclusive, culturally competent workplaces where every individual feels valued and respected. Through highly customized programs, we equip teams with knowledge and skills to help them connect and collaborate more effectively across differences. If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or need assistance managing your personal information, feel free to contact us at: 
www.masteringculturaldifferences.com

luiza@masteringculturaldifferences.com
.

subject: 5 Things: Chicagoland's Weekly Business Update
body:
Click 
here
 
to view this email in your browser.
 
 
 
 
 
Weekly Business Update 
February 24, 2025
THE EXCHANGE
Speed Networking by LinkedIn Returns to The Exchange 
PRESENTED BY SOUTHWEST AIRLINES
 
The Chicagoland Chamber of Commerce announced the return of Speed Networking by LinkedIn to its largest networking event of the year, The Exchange 2025 presented by Southwest Airlines, on Thursday, April 10. Speed Networking by LinkedIn offers a structured platform for participants to expand their professional network and cultivate meaningful connections in a dynamic environment. This week (through Friday, Feb. 28) is the last chance for guests to receive 25% off registration, including a ticket to Speed Networking, using promo code EARLYBIRDTIX25.
LEARN MORE
 
THOUGHT LEADERSHIP
As Biz Leaders, We Value Public Transit. But before We Pay More, We Need This 
PRESENTED BY CRAIN’S CHICAGO BUSINESS
 
Business leaders in the Chicago region believe a thriving, efficient and reliable public transit system is an economic necessity. With an impending fiscal crisis facing CTA, Metra, and Pace, these leaders are calling on legislators to take necessary action before raising taxes for transit, outlining six crucial steps that will help reform the region’s transit system for a new era of mobility and economic growth.
LEARN MORE
 
MEMBER NEWS
2025: The Year of Business Agility
PRESENTED BY WELLS FARGO
 
After a tumultuous first half of the decade, business leaders nationwide are anticipating what is to come in the decade’s second half. In 2025, one thing is clear: agility will be the key to success. Business leaders must be prepared to react, adjust, stay poised, and maintain focus in a rapidly shifting landscape. Want to ensure your business thrives in 2025? Read the full article from Wells Fargo Illinois Market Executive Doug Donovan.
LEARN MORE
 
MEMBER NEWS
Economic Growth in Illinois Manufacturing: Breakfast Panel Discussion 
PRESENTED BY GRANT THORNTON
 
The Chicagoland Chamber of Commerce is joining Grant Thornton (US) for a breakfast panel event with manufacturing leaders on Tuesday, March 18. Don't miss this chance to network with peers and hear directly from our President & CEO, Jack Lavin, and other leaders and experts at World Business Chicago, Illinois Manufacturers' Association, and mHUB.
REGISTER NOW
 
MEMBER NEWS
Legendary Experiences for Your Business at the United Center
PRESENTED BY THE CHICAGO BULLS
 
The Bulls have some great upcoming matchups in March and April. Take advantage of this special offer as a Chicagoland Chamber of Commerce member and save 20% on Bulls tickets! Plus, elevate your employee perks with a group outing at a Bulls game this season. Bring 15 or more people to the United Center and receive discounted tickets, unique fan experiences, exclusive event access, and more! To learn more about a group outing to entertain your employees or clients, email Sam Kritikos at skritikos@bulls.com.
GET TICKETS
 
Want to showcase your company news, information, products, or services?
 
Chamber members are able to take advantage of a myriad of benefits to help your business grow, including inclusion in this email newsletter. With a broad distribution, you can gain access to a new audience that you may not otherwise be able to reach.
REVIEW BENEFITS
 
 
FOLLOW THE CHAMBER

Chicago, IL 60611

subject: ICE Raids Are Rising — Is Your Organization Prepared?
body:
Don’t let your workplace get caught off-guard. Access tools & support from SHRM.
 
 
Imagine this:
 U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents arrive at your workplace without warning. Would you know what to do? Would your organization be protected? Ensuring I-9 compliance, conducting regular audits, and verifying employment authorization are critical in mitigating risks. 
Yet, more than half of HR professionals (52%) say their organizations are only slightly prepared — or not prepared at all — for the possibility of an ICE raid.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
As a SHRM Member, Get Exclusive Access to:
 
 
 
Checklist: 
Immigration (ICE) Workplace Preparedness Plan
Checklist:
 What to Do During an Immigration (ICE) Workplace Visit
 
Expert Guidance:
 
SHRM HR Knowledge Advisors
 offer expert guidance and resources to help you navigate HR challenges.
What You Need to Know About Form I-9:
 Stay informed as immigration laws evolve, including compliance, employment, and authorization.
Without the right resources, a single raid could disrupt your entire organization. With SHRM membership, you’ll have the tools and support you need to lead with confidence, no matter what comes your way. 
Join SHRM today
 and protect what matters most — your people and your business. 
The risks are real. The preparation is simple.

"Your session was lovely, my friends appreciated it as well. Your calm voice created a space that held whatever we had to bring. And the exercises felt calming and grounding. Thank you."
Respite & Resilience Gathering
30 min session, this is the last one for now y'all!
 
Wednesday Feb 26, 8:30 am central / 9:30 am eastern
 
I will lead you through simple but powerful somatic tapping to ground and release current trauma including: 
* Two techniques for grounding and releasing the trauma of hypervigilance
* A daily practice to connect to your power and protect your energy
 
Your parasympathetic system will get a reset, you’ll have named and released much of what has accumulated in your body and we’ll share positive communal energy that you can take forward. 
 
Free to register
I’ll share a link for an optional sliding scale payment ($10 minimum) after we complete. 
Register for Feb 26 Gathering
 
Share the info with someone
 
­ 
­ 
­ 
I hope you can join, 
 
Joayne Nicole
­
PS: My rebranded website is live! If you want to check it out, have a look here: 
www.sparksofchangetogether.com 
Sparks of Change

subject: Success in India
body:
Human Rights & Business Skills Pilot
 
 
Success in India
 
MIT World Peace University professors and students kicked off the week with a roundtable. They demonstrated how they adapted the curriculum to the Indian context and piloted the curriculum. 
Human Rights & Business Skills Pilot
Dear Larry Baker, 
This week, I had the tremendous opportunity to observe four of the 10 schools in India that participated in our “Human Rights & Business Skills” secondary school curriculum 
pilot
. We supplemented the curriculum, which is based on the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and the Indian Constitution, with business skills that reinforce and apply the human rights.
 
The MIT-WPU team of student teachers demonstrated four of the 10 human rights lessons that they piloted in the fall: Freedom of Religion, Protection from Child Labor, Right to Marriage and Family, and Freedom from Bullying. 
The next day we visited four schools where each of these lessons were demonstrated. 
 
At a prep school attached to MIT WPU, the pilot class on Religious Freedom was animated through “gamification” – using games and competition to motivate learning.
In one game, teams competed to see who could find the most similarities between India’s multiple religions. My minor but really fun part was to come on stage and hand out the awards.
 
The class teacher at an all-girls Muslim school (pictured above, bottom right), gave a ringing endorsement after the demonstration lesson, Freedom from Bullying. She and the chief school administrator invited us to implement the curriculum on an ongoing basis.
We are working towards sustainability and expansion of the initiative across India and worldwide through Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) funding. Indian companies must spend a minimum of 2% of their average net profit over the preceding three years on CSR activities.
Read and see the details here
 
If you want to see this in action, join us for our 
6th annual Faith@Work multi-faith conference
 in Washington DC (May 20-22). On the third day, the MIT-WPU professors leading the pilot will give a further report and discuss next steps. 
Looking forward to (hopefully) seeing you in Washington DC in May!
Brian Grim
RFBF President
Dare to Overcome, Global Chair 
 
Registration and Sponsorships OPEN!
 
RFBF helps people in business practice the virtues that faith reinforces through our annual 
"Dare to Overcome" Fortune 500 Faith@Work conference
 in Washington DC (May 20-22, 2025). This year's theme "United in Hope" will feature a keynote by Andrew Abela, dean of the Busch Business School at Catholic University, with exciting insights from his new book 
Superhabits: the Universal System for a Successful Life.
 
REGISTER NOW
 
UK Edition
 
Are you in Europe? Join us on 29th April for our second annual 
Faith@Work Summit
. 
 
REGISTER NOW

subject: Are You Joining Us For Risk, Growth, and Resilience Summit? Let Us Know!
body:
Are you planning to join us?
 
 
Hi 
Larry
,
Join us for Risk, Growth, and Resilience Summit for an insightful gathering of industry experts, risk managers, and business and community leaders as they share strategies for navigating this evolving risk landscape. 
Together, we’ll explore ways to identify opportunities, make informed decisions for a competitive edge, and even test our risk knowledge in a game of Risk Jeopardy. 
Are you planning to join us?
Yes!
 
No, I can't make it.
 
I'm still deciding.

subject: Pay Equity Weekly | 2025 U.S. Pay Transparency Laws
body:
Learn the latest salary range disclosure law movement at the state level.
 
Pay Equity Weekly
February 20, 2024
 
WEBINAR
Understanding Ireland’s Pay Transparency Bill: Key Implications for Employers
REGISTER NOW
 
What's Important
2025 U.S. Pay Transparency Laws Status Check
2025 is shaping up to be the year of pay transparency in the U.S. Five states are implementing laws and 10 have introduced legislation. Find out the latest in our blog. 
 
Read Now
 
 
Key Resource
 
ACCESS NOW
 
EU Pay Transparency Directive Compliance Roadmap 
Do you have proper job evaluation and pay equity analytics in place to comply with the EU Pay Transparency Directive? You
 only have one compensation cycle before you must comply with the law. 
Our guide will help you get there. 
Survey Participation
2025 State of Pay Equity Policies and Practices 
Our 2025 pay equity survey is now open for participation. This survey is looking to glean insights about how your organization approaches pay equity. It should take 15 minutes to complete and participants will receive a complimentary copy.

subject: FW: [External]Feedback from session
body:
Great feedback from GAP. And yet, I still got canned!! Make it make sense!!  
 
From:
 Jenny Jones <Jenny_Jones@gap.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, February 19, 2025 5:55 PM
To:
 Larry Baker <l.baker@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: [External]Feedback from session
 
Hi Larry, 
 
Absolutely. Below are topline results which include the overall ratings, key takeaways, and some direct quotes from attendees. Like I said, just amazing feedback! Please let me know if you have any specific questions. I will also be sharing this with Chuck. 
 
There were 120 survey responses. Our scale was 1 to 5 stars (with 5 being the best score).
 
 
Engaging and Impactful Learning Experience
·
        
Attendees found the session deeply 
educational, thought-provoking, and inspiring
.
·
        
The 
historical context and storytelling
 were particularly effective in making the content resonate.
·
        
Many 
expressed a desire for more sessions like this
, covering different aspects of history and identity.
Commitment to DEI and Organizational Values
·
        
Many participants highlighted 
Gap Inc.'s dedication to DEI
 as a differentiator and a source of pride.
·
        
Several employees emphasized the 
importance of leadership participation
 in these conversations.
·
        
Some comments touched on the 
personal impact of DEI initiatives
, especially given the current social climate.
Accessibility and Opportunities for Further Engagement
·
        
Multiple requests for 
recordings, discussion follow-ups, and additional resources
.
·
        
A desire for 
expanded access to frontline employees (DC/CC non-exempt staff)
.
·
        
Suggestions for 
similar programming across other Heritage Months
 and deeper engagement opportunities, like focus sessions and networking discussions.
 
"Hands down - one of the best webinars at Gap! The content was informative, rich and deep! It provided context and presented challenges that Black people face today. Please provide more programming like this and invite all employees."
“Great presenter, candid, relevant, and the historical context was wonderful.”
"I'm so grateful for this session today. I feel reaffirmed by the content and by the very fact that Gap Inc. is leaning into doing what's right and honoring and valuing our employees. Thank you."
“Thank you so much, Larry. I hope to be a better ally/accomplice to my black colleagues.”
“This was an absolutely incredible experience. I have already recommended to watch the playback to my entire team that wasn't able to attend live”
“Beautiful hour, it is so important that we make space for these moments that matter. There is too much going on and to slow down and connect in moments like this is so important. Thank you for bringing us together.
“Loved the passion and delivery from Larry Baker. I don't know that I would have been as engaged without his delivery and passion for the topic he spoke of regarding Black History Month. Thank you.”
“I wish we had more than 45 minutes! It feels like we had just skimmed the surface of so many key topics. Hope to continue learning throughout the year with other resources to dive into.”
“Great partnership with LCW, looking forward to future series.”
“Learned so much, it gave me a place to start to dig deeper and understand. As well as share and engage with others!”
 
“Larry was very on point with getting his messaging across.  I knew some of this info, but was educated on a lot of it.   Thank you!”
 
“EXCELLENT DISCUSSION. LARRY KEPT SUCH A HEAVY TOPIC ENGAGING AND ALSO SO INFORMATIVE.”
 
Thank you,
Jenny 
 
From: 
Larry Baker <
l.baker@lcwmail.com
>
Date: 
Wednesday, February 19, 2025 at 9:32 AM
To: 
Jenny Jones <
Jenny_Jones@gap.com
>
Subject: 
[External]Feedback from session
 
Jenny,
 
Do you have any updates on the feedback from the session that I led for GAP? If so, is it possible to get a copy of the results.
 
Thank you,
 
Larry

subject: 📩 5 Strategies to Write Emails that Resonate Across Cultures 🌎
body:
Enhance your cross-cultural communication with these essential email strategies. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hello Larry!
 
👋
 Remember that email miscommunication we talked about?
 
In my last email, we explored how cultural differences can cause misunderstandings, delays, and even disengagement in the workplace.  
When emails don’t land as intended, they can erode trust, slow down productivity, and create unnecessary conflict. 
But the good news? 
You can fix this—starting today!
 
🙌
 
 
Here are 
five powerful strategies
 to help you write emails that connect, not confuse: 
1️⃣ 
Adapt Your Tone & Structure to Cultural Preferences
Some cultures (e.g., the U.S., Germany, the Netherlands) prefer 
direct and concise
 emails, while others (e.g., Japan, India, Saudi Arabia) value 
context and relationship-building
 before getting to the point. It is very important to research your audience! For example, for high-context cultures, start with a friendly introduction. For low-context cultures, lead with the key message. 
 
2️⃣ 
Choose Words That Cross Borders Effectively
In other words, avoid slang, idioms, and humor (e.g., “Let’s hit the ground running” might confuse non-native speakers). Aim for using 
clear and neutral language
 that translates well globally. For example, instead of "ASAP," try "by [specific date & time zone]." 
 
3️⃣ 
Format for Clarity & Easy Reading
Keep sentences short and use 
bullet points
 for key details. You should also consider time zones when setting deadlines. For example: "Please submit by 5 PM EST / 10 PM GMT." Another strategy would be to spell out dates. Write 
15 March 2024
, not 03/15/24, which can be misinterpreted!
 
4️⃣ 
Be Mindful of Hierarchy & Formality
Some cultures (e.g., China, France, Mexico, Brazil) expect 
titles and formality
 in emails, while others (e.g., the U.S., Australia, Sweden) are more casual. When in doubt, 
err on the side of formality
 (e.g., “Dear Mr. Chen” instead of “Hey Chen!”). 
 
5️⃣ 
Always Include a Clear Call to Action (CTA)
Different cultures respond differently to urgency. Instead of a demanding "I need this by tomorrow," try, 
Could you provide this by [specific date]? Let me know if you need more time
. 
Also,
 d
epending on the recipient’s cultural orientation, it might be appropriate to summarize the next steps at the end of your email so there’s no confusion. 
 
💡
 Ready to Elevate Your Workplace Communication? Let’s Talk!
 
Mastering cross-cultural communication isn’t just about writing better emails—it’s about 
building trust, fostering inclusion, and creating a workplace where everyone feels valued.
 
📅
 
Schedule a complimentary strategy call with me today
 and let’s explore how your organization can enhance your global communication strategies. 
 
👉
 
📅
 
Book your complimentary strategy call here.
 
Here’s to hoping your emails bring teams 
together
, not apart! 
🌏
 
Bye for now!
Luiza
___________________________________
 
Luiza Dreasher, President and CEO (she/her/hers)
Mastering Cultural Differences 
I work with leaders who want to create a work environment where all employees feel valued and want to stay.
At 
Mastering Cultural Differences LLC,
 we are committed to helping organizations build inclusive, culturally competent workplaces where every individual feels valued and respected. Through highly customized programs, we equip teams with knowledge and skills to help them connect and collaborate more effectively across differences. subject: Re: [External]Feedback from session
body:
Hi Larry, 
 
Absolutely. Below are topline results which include the overall ratings, key takeaways, and some direct quotes from attendees. Like I said, just amazing feedback! Please let me know if you have any specific questions. I will also be sharing this with Chuck. 
 
There were 120 survey responses. Our scale was 1 to 5 stars (with 5 being the best score).
 
 
Engaging and Impactful Learning Experience
·
         
Attendees found the session deeply 
educational, thought-provoking, and inspiring
.
·
         
The 
historical context and storytelling
 were particularly effective in making the content resonate.
·
         
Many 
expressed a desire for more sessions like this
, covering different aspects of history and identity.
Commitment to DEI and Organizational Values
·
         
Many participants highlighted 
Gap Inc.'s dedication to DEI
 as a differentiator and a source of pride.
·
         
Several employees emphasized the 
importance of leadership participation
 in these conversations.
·
         
Some comments touched on the 
personal impact of DEI initiatives
, especially given the current social climate.
Accessibility and Opportunities for Further Engagement
·
         
Multiple requests for 
recordings, discussion follow-ups, and additional resources
.
·
         
A desire for 
expanded access to frontline employees (DC/CC non-exempt staff)
.
·
         
Suggestions for 
similar programming across other Heritage Months
 and deeper engagement opportunities, like focus sessions and networking discussions.
 
"Hands down - one of the best webinars at Gap! The content was informative, rich and deep! It provided context and presented challenges that Black people face today. Please provide more programming like this and invite all employees."
“Great presenter, candid, relevant, and the historical context was wonderful.”
"I'm so grateful for this session today. I feel reaffirmed by the content and by the very fact that Gap Inc. is leaning into doing what's right and honoring and valuing our employees. Thank you."
“Thank you so much, Larry. I hope to be a better ally/accomplice to my black colleagues.”
“This was an absolutely incredible experience. I have already recommended to watch the playback to my entire team that wasn't able to attend live”
“Beautiful hour, it is so important that we make space for these moments that matter. There is too much going on and to slow down and connect in moments like this is so important. Thank you for bringing us together.
“Loved the passion and delivery from Larry Baker. I don't know that I would have been as engaged without his delivery and passion for the topic he spoke of regarding Black History Month. Thank you.”
“I wish we had more than 45 minutes! It feels like we had just skimmed the surface of so many key topics. Hope to continue learning throughout the year with other resources to dive into.”
“Great partnership with LCW, looking forward to future series.”
“Learned so much, it gave me a place to start to dig deeper and understand. As well as share and engage with others!”
 
“Larry was very on point with getting his messaging across.  I knew some of this info, but was educated on a lot of it.   Thank you!”
 
“EXCELLENT DISCUSSION. LARRY KEPT SUCH A HEAVY TOPIC ENGAGING AND ALSO SO INFORMATIVE.”
 
Thank you,
Jenny 
 
From: 
Larry Baker <l.baker@lcwmail.com>
Date: 
Wednesday, February 19, 2025 at 9:32 AM
To: 
Jenny Jones <Jenny_Jones@gap.com>
Subject: 
[External]Feedback from session
 
Jenny,
 
Do you have any updates on the feedback from the session that I led for GAP? If so, is it possible to get a copy of the results.
 
Thank you,
 
Larry
