subject: ReTHINK What it Means to be Inclusive with Adam Grant
body:
ReTHINK What it Means to be Inclusive with Organizational Psychologist and Bestselling Author Adam Grant at the Power of Inclusion Summit!
 
 
ReTHINK What it Means to be Inclusive with
Organizational Psychologist and
Bestselling Author Adam Grant!
 
 
Adam Grant is passionate about potential - specifically rethinking the assumptions, systems, and policies that limit potential - and creating organizational environments where people can thrive by changing how we think.
 
"Far too many of us favor the comfort of conviction over the discomfort of doubt." - AG
 
By fearing unfamiliar concepts, or not feeling confident in our understanding, we are missing the potential of ideas that truly make a difference.
 
Get a front row (virtual) seat as Adam Grant discusses the power of inclusion, diversity, and equity to evolve organizations to their highest potential.
 
We are excited to have Adam as one of our Keynote Speakers at the 2025 Justice for All Summit: The Power of Inclusion.
Reserve Your Seat
 
More about Adam:
Adam Grant is an organizational psychologist and bestselling author who explores the science of motivation, generosity, rethinking, and potential. Adam Grant has been Wharton’s top-rated professor for 7 straight years. As an organizational psychologist, he is a leading expert on how we can find motivation and meaning, rethink assumptions, and live more generous and creative lives. He has been recognized as the world’s #2 most influential management thinker and one of Fortune’s 40 under 40.
He is the #1 New York Times bestselling author of 6 books that have sold millions of copies and been translated into 45 languages: Hidden Potential, Think Again, Give and Take, Originals, Option B, and Power Moves. His books have been named among the year’s best by Amazon, Apple, the Financial Times, and the Wall Street Journal. His viral piece on languishing was the most-read New York Times article of 2021 and the most-saved article across all platforms.
 
Adam earned his Ph.D. in organizational psychology from the University of Michigan, completing it in less than 3 years, and his B.A. from Harvard University, magna cum laude with highest honors and Phi Beta Kappa honors. He has received awards for distinguished scholarly achievement from the Academy of Management, the American Psychological Association, and the National Science Foundation, and been recognized as one of the world’s most-cited, most prolific, and most influential researchers in business and economics.
Register Now
 
More about The 2025 Justice for All Summit: The Power of Inclusion
 
What is the Justice for All Summit?
The third annual Justice for All Summit, being held April 21-24, 2025, is the premier virtual conference to connect, get inspired, and learn innovative strategies for cultural transformation through diversity, equity, inclusion, and justice practices.
Who attends?
This restorative space brings together between 500 - 750 HR practitioners, executives, team leaders, learning and development staff, corporate trainers, organizational development professionals, and diversity practitioners in community for learning, networking, and personal/professional development.
 
Who is The Winters Group?
Proudly Black women-owned and -led, The Winters Group has helped organizations strategically increase their capacity to be more culturally competent, create sustainable equitable policies, and foster inclusive workplaces since 1984.
Reserve Your Seat
 
 
 
 
 
The Winters Group, 8116 South Tryon Street, Ste. B3-260, Charlotte, North Carolina 28273, United States

Below is an example of a tailored cover letter and resume that emphasize your excellent facilitation skills, your ability to synthesize complex data for executive audiences, and your track record in leading organization
‐
wide Inclusion & Diversity (I&D) initiatives—including driving a new workforce and learning model across a large enterprise during significant M&A activities.
Cover Letter
[Your Name]
[Your Address]
[City, State, ZIP]
[Your Email] | [Your Phone Number]
[Date]
[Hiring Manager’s Name]
[Company Name]
[Company Address]
[City, State, ZIP]
Dear [Hiring Manager’s Name],
I am excited to submit my application for the Learning Consultant – Inclusion & Diversity role for the US & Americas region at [Company Name]. With over seven years of experience in leading enterprise-wide I&D and learning transformation initiatives—including in environments undergoing significant M&A—I am confident in my ability to design and execute strategies that foster an inclusive workplace and drive future-state workforce readiness.
In my recent role as a Senior Learning & Development Consultant, I spearheaded a skills-based transformation program across a 35,000-employee enterprise. I developed a comprehensive I&D strategy in close partnership with senior leadership and HR, integrating best practices in data analytics, program management, and facilitation. My ability to synthesize complex workforce data into clear, actionable insights has enabled executive teams to make informed decisions on talent mobility, reskilling initiatives, and strategic investments in diversity. I have also successfully facilitated workshops and strategy sessions that have elevated stakeholder understanding and accelerated organizational change.
I am particularly drawn to this role because of its strategic focus on aligning global I&D objectives with regional execution. My expertise in collaborating with C-suite executives, managing cross-functional teams, and ensuring compliance with evolving best practices positions me to contribute meaningfully to [Company Name]’s mission of creating a diverse, inclusive, and high-performing workforce.
Thank you for considering my application. I welcome the opportunity to further discuss how my background, skills, and passion for transformative learning and I&D can help drive your organizational initiatives forward.
Sincerely,
[Your Name]
Resume
[Your Name]
[Your Address]
[City, State, ZIP]
[Your Email] | [Your Phone Number] | [LinkedIn Profile]
PROFESSIONAL SUMMARY
Dynamic Learning & Organizational Development Leader with over 7 years of progressive experience in driving enterprise-wide Inclusion & Diversity initiatives and learning transformations. Proven expertise in designing skills-based strategies that support a diverse, agile workforce of 35K+ employees, even amidst significant M&A activities. Adept at synthesizing complex data to provide clear insights for senior executives, facilitating impactful discussions, and building cross-functional partnerships to achieve strategic objectives.
CORE COMPETENCIES
I&D Strategy Development & Implementation
Enterprise Workforce Transformation (35K+ Employees)
Cross-Functional Stakeholder Engagement
Data Analysis & Executive Reporting
Program & Project Management
Facilitation & Workshop Leadership
Learning & Development Innovation
M&A Workforce Integration
Compliance & Best Practices in I&D
Strategic Communication & Influence
PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE
Senior Learning & Development Consultant
[Company Name] | [Years of Employment] | [Location]
Strategy & Transformation:
 Developed and executed a comprehensive skills-based I&D strategy across a 35K+ employee enterprise, aligning regional initiatives with global I&D priorities during significant M&A cycles.
Data-Driven Insights:
 Synthesized complex workforce data into executive-level dashboards and reports, enabling data-driven decision-making and proactive talent planning.
Facilitation & Stakeholder Engagement:
 Led high-level workshops and strategy sessions with senior leadership and cross-functional teams (Finance, IT, Clinical, Sales, etc.) to integrate I&D principles into business practices.
Program Management:
 Designed and managed diversity recruitment, retention, and advancement programs, ensuring continuous improvement and alignment with corporate pillars of Culture, Talent, and Community.
External & Internal Partnerships:
 Collaborated with Gallagher Connect Partner teams and represented the region in Global Governance Meetings, providing updates on divisional I&D progress.
HR Manager, Learning & Talent Strategy
Target Corporation | [Years of Employment] | [Location]
Skills-Based Development:
 Established a dynamic skills-based development system that replaced traditional training methods, fostering workforce agility and innovation across multiple business units.
Cross-Functional Collaboration:
 Partnered with HR, Data Analytics, IT, and Finance teams to create targeted reskilling initiatives, which enabled smooth transitions during post-M&A integrations.
Executive Advisory:
 Regularly engaged with C-suite executives, presenting synthesized data on workforce trends and I&D outcomes to inform strategic decision-making.
Facilitation Excellence:
 Led interactive training sessions and mentoring programs that increased leadership pipeline diversity by 40% and reduced training costs by 25%.
EDUCATION & CERTIFICATIONS

 – [University Name]

TECHNOLOGY & SYSTEMS EXPERTISE

THOUGHT LEADERSHIP & PROFESSIONAL AFFILIATIONS

This cover letter and resume are designed to underscore your ability to lead large-scale, enterprise-wide transformations while working closely with senior executives to drive strategic I&D initiatives. If you need further adjustments or additional details, feel free to let me know!

subject: Is meritocracy a myth?
body:
Plus: learning from "superstar" competitors. 
February 19, 2025  ·  
View in browser
 
The Insightful Leader
BY 
KELLOGG INSIGHT
Leadership advice from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University
Good morning, 
In the U.S., there’s an ethos that we get our jobs—and the status that accompanies them—as a result of our own hard work and intelligence. There’s a sense that meritocracy is the norm and that we earn our economic and social positions, rather than inherit them.
But in taking a closer look at real-world scenarios, Kellogg’s 
Lauren Rivera
 finds that the concept of a classless, equal-opportunity society is more myth than reality. More on that this week.
Plus, what happens when businesses try to compete against “superstar” companies.
Milestone as merit
As much as the U.S. promotes itself as a land of opportunity, the nation’s economic inequality is now greater in the country than in many other Western industrialized nations, Rivera explains in a 
recent podcast
. And rates of social mobility have gone down.
“If you look at the very top and the very bottom rungs of the economic radar, they’re particularly sticky,” she says. “Children born to families at the top or the bottom fifths of income distributions tend to stay on those same rungs as adults. And children from families at the top of the economic hierarchy monopolize access to prestigious universities and high-paying jobs.”
This dynamic plays out across young people’s lives—for children two-and-a-half years old through admission into “elite” private schools. In new research, Rivera and a colleague examined the admissions processes at elite pre-K-12 schools in six cities to understand how they evaluate children. The processes were ostensibly structured on the basis of fairness and meritocracy.
The researchers conducted interviews with the admissions officers and found that the various schools followed a similar approach: They screened applicants based on developmental milestones—the social, cognitive, or physical traits children tend to display at certain ages. And one of the traits they explicitly looked for was whether the child was non-disabled and developing in a typical way.
“The amount of overt discrimination on the basis of neurotypicality as well as disability status was shocking in some of the things that people told us,” Rivera says. “Some of our interviewees actually used imagery from the eugenics movement to describe why they were selecting the physical and the cognitive elite that would go on to be a part of these elite communities.”
In other words, the process was set up to identify—and exclude—children who were perceived as having or being at risk of any type of disability.
Catch the full episode in 
The Inequality Podcast
.
 
Learning from superstars
Regina Wittenberg Moerman
 misses Bed Bath & Beyond.
The once–Fortune 500 retailer, famous for its ceiling-high inventory and deep discount coupons, succumbed to bankruptcy in early 2023, partly due to its inability to compete with newer retailers like Amazon.
Alas, Bed Bath & Beyond’s fate is hardly an anomaly. Bankruptcy can often be tied to competition from “superstar” businesses, which dominate a market sector due to their size, scale, innovation, and other factors.
To understand the impact of a superstar business on other firms in the same sector, Wittenberg Moerman and her colleagues examined the bankruptcy patterns of thousands of publicly listed U.S. firms.
They found that, overall, businesses that faced the most competition from superstars were 42 percent more likely to go bankrupt than unexposed firms. But several factors, including firm innovation and access to credit, mitigated this negative effect.
“Businesses that don’t figure out how to adjust to superstars are likely to go into bankruptcy,” says Wittenberg Moerman, a Kellogg professor of accounting and information management. “But if you have or can find protective mechanisms, you may not be affected or may even do well.”
Read more in 
Kellogg Insight
.
“Saying you’re going to boycott something does feel like you’re casting a vote that you hope makes a difference down the road. … What boycotts don’t seem to do is have much of an impact on consumer behavior.”
— 
Brayden King
, in 
USA Today
, on boycotting major retailers.
See you next week,
Abraham Kim, senior research editor
Kellogg Insight
Follow us on 
LinkedIn
.
And listen to our 
podcasts
.
Kellogg School of Management
 | 
2211 Campus Drive
, 
Evanston, IL 60208
 
Unsubscribe larry@lcwmail.com
 
Update Profile
 | 
Constant Contact Data Notice
 
Sent by 
insight@kellogg.northwestern.edu

📅 
Happenings
MAR. FREE WEBINAR - BOLSTER YOUR ERG STRATEGY
 -
 
Join us for a free open webinar, 
Mar. 17th at 12pm ET
. During this webinar we will chat through how to revamp your ERG strategy and share best practices. We’ll cover best practices and the current status of company ERGs, a case study for an ERG strategy refresh, and ideas to engage ALLIES in your organization’s ERGs. 
Register for free here
.
INTERNATIONAL ALLYSHIP DAY
 - Join us in NYC or virtually on August 8th for our 
2nd annual International Allyship Day event
, hosted by our partner AllianceBernstein. This year’s focus is on equipping inclusion and ERG leaders with actionable strategies to strengthen or launch allyship programs within their organizations. Participants will gain essential skills for effective allyship, pushback-proof strategies, and insights into the strategic business impact of allyship. They’ll also have the chance to connect with senior leaders in the inclusion space.
 
Register individually or as a team here
.
​
 
​
📝 DEI = the Employee Experience
It’s no surprise that DEI has been negatively portrayed in the headlines for weeks. While it appears that the narrative is shifting towards other priorities in the government, the impact has been felt. My team is getting daily inquiries about the longevity of DEI work or how were shifting our training as a result. The answer I commonly give and will give here is that we will continue to do the work, how we talk about doing the work may shift. Meaning the DEI acronym, because it is so misunderstood and has been highly weaponized and polarized in the news cycle and in politics, may need to shift for us to be able to have the impact we need from the work.
One necessary pivot to successfully navigate this imposed turmoil is 
to weave inclusion into every aspect of your employee experience
. This will have a positive impact on your employees, your customers and those you hope to serve which should also benefit outcomes for your organization like profitability and innovation. And that is 100% legal. To do that, look at every aspect of the employee experience from an inclusive lens…
Recruiting
 - This is the first impression of your organization to a potential employee. Where are you recruiting from? If they are the same universities or job websites you've always used, consider intentionally switching that up. Help facilitate people from diverse backgrounds providing referrals. 90% of how job openings are filled are through our own networks. Make sure those networks are as broad as possible to reflect those you hope to serve.
Hiring
 - Quotas and mandates have never been legal, while aspirational hiring goals are 100% legal. Making sure you broaden your pool of candidates before you interview is a key best practice to enhancing diversity. Have objective criteria to fairly assess all potential employees and always higher the best candidate for the job.
Onboarding
 - This is the first impression of a current employee. Increasingly, people decide within the first 90 days if they’re going to stay at an organization or not. If the onboarding time is intentional and inclusive, people are more likely to stay which results in saved attrition cost through lost productivity and training cost.
Performance management
 - Another critical part of the employee experience happens with goal setting, performance reviews and promotion decisions. These decisions are often highly subjective and could benefit from having more objective criteria. What does it take for someone to achieve a 'meets expectations' or 'exceeds expectations' review? Is it 100% clear? How are promotion decisions made? Do we consider a broad pool of candidates before deciding?
Separations
 - Although a sad reality of the employee experience, this is the last impression an employee has of your organization. If it’s negative, that is likely to spread and other potential employees will know that your culture is not inclusive. Make sure even if you’re losing an employee that they have a positive experience as they move on to their next opportunity. They may be a great referral source for talent in the future. Be sure to measure attrition rates across elements of diversity. Chances are you’re losing diverse talent at a 2 to 3x higher rate.
​
💬 
Allyship Conversation Starters & Resources
HBR Ideacast Podcast -
 
If DEI Programs Aren’t Effective, What Is?
​
​
The Legal Landscape Around DEI Is Shifting. Your Messaging Should, Too.
​
​
 
Care about inclusion for the little ones in your life? Check out the programs and resources from 
LITTLE ALLIES
, a nonprofit working to facilitate inclusive experiences for all children to feel seen, heard, and belong.
​
Next Pivot Point
 
works to promote allyship and inclusion across all dimensions of diversity in the workplace to make sure everyone feels seen, heard, and belonging at work.
​
Next Pivot Point

subject: Last chance! SHRM WEBINAR: Preparing Your Workplace for Immigration Enforcement
body:
Get expert guidance to navigate evolving immigration policies and ICE enforcement actions.
 
 
Join SHRM and vetted employment law experts Wednesday to equip yourself with real-time knowledge and tools necessary to proactively manage and support your workforce, including documented and migrant workers, amidst evolving immigration policies and ICE enforcement actions. Currently, the ICE raids seem to be targeting individuals with existing removal orders for quick deportation. Employers are not yet the focus of these raids but are likely to become a focal point in the future.
 
 
Key Discussion Points:
 
 
 
 
Current Immigration Enforcement Landscape:
Summary of recent executive orders affecting immigration, including stricter vetting and changes to birthright citizenship.
Analysis of ICE strategies, focusing on individuals with removal orders and potential shifts to employer-targeted enforcement.
 
 
 
 
Proactive Workforce Assessment:
Methods for identifying Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA), Temporary Protected Status (TPS) holders, or others with temporary immigration status.
Approaches to encourage voluntary status disclosure with confidentiality and trust.
 
 
 
 
I-9 Compliance and Internal Audits:
Best practices for internal I-9 audits to verify employment eligibility.
Guidance on correcting I-9 errors and ensuring federal compliance.
 
 
 
 
Developing a Response Plan for ICE Actions:
Steps to develop an action plan for unannounced ICE visits, plus information on employer rights and responsibilities.
Training for staff on handling ICE interactions with minimal disruption.
 
 
 
 
Support Systems for Migrant Employees:
Resources to help employees navigate immigration status.
Promoting a workplace culture centered around inclusion & diversity that ensures security for migrant workers.
 
 
By attending this webcast, you can proactively prepare and implement robust compliance and support strategies to mitigate risks associated with immigration enforcement actions and maintain a stable, inclusive, and legally compliant workplace for your organization. You will earn 
1 professional development credit (PDC)
 for attending this webinar.
 
 
 
REGISTER NOW
 
 
 
 
 
About the Speakers
 
 
 
 
Emily M. Dickens, J.D.
Chief of Staff, Head of Government Affairs, and Corporate Secretary, SHRM
Emily M. Dickens is a member of the executive team at SHRM, the world’s largest human resources trade association and fourth largest trade association in the world. Emily leads government affairs, global policy, legal affairs, and the SHRM Foundation.
 
 
 
 
Bo Cooper
Partner, Fragomen
Bo Cooper is a partner in Fragomen’s Washington, D.C. office. He leads the firm’s Government Strategies and Compliance Group and is a member of Fragomen’s Executive Committee.
 
 
 
 
K. Edward Raleigh
Partner, Fragomen
K. Edward Raleigh is a partner in Fragomen’s Government Strategies and Compliance Group based in Washington, D.C. He focuses on strategic risk management, investigations, and disputes.
 
 
REGISTER NOW
 
 
If It’s a Work Thing, It’s a SHRM Thing
As these critical changes evolve, you need more than just answers. Join SHRM now to access exclusive member resources such as:
Trusted guidance from 
SHRM’s HR Knowledge Advisors
 for your toughest HR challenges.

Peer discussions via SHRMConnect, available 24/7 for real-time collaboration.
No matter what “work thing” you’re facing, you deserve a partner committed to elevating—and advocating for—all things work, workers, and the workplace.

subject: Biden’s RTO Policy Hurt Retention—Trump’s Could Decimate It (Wise Decision Maker Guide 143)
body:
Wise Decision Maker Guide 
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
Greetings Larry,
President Donald Trump’s recent announcement of a full-time, five-day-a-week return-to-office (RTO) mandate for federal employees has sparked heated debates across the nation. Framed as a strategy to reduce the size of the federal workforce and boost efficiency, this decision overlooks a critical consequence: the potential loss of the government’s most experienced and skilled employees. If history is any indication, 
this sweeping policy could usher in a new wave of resignations that would undermine the very efficiency it seeks to enhance.
We don’t have to speculate blindly about what might happen. Just two years ago, President Joe Biden’s more moderate RTO mandate, which tried to increase the amount of time federal staff worked in the office, triggered a substantial increase in turnover rates among senior and skilled employees. A groundbreaking study conducted by Mark Ma and his colleagues at the University of Pittsburgh, using data from Revelio Labs, provides clear evidence of the damage caused by Biden’s RTO announcement. This research not only quantifies the losses but also offers critical insights into the repercussions of Trump’s far more stringent policy.
To learn more, check out this 
blog
.

,

 Using the breakout rooms in Zoom also helped to open up dialog between everyone on the webinar. I strongly recommend him for anyone looking for an interesting and engaging presentation.”
Mike Ashcraft

I’m on pins and needles, waiting to hear from Georgetown University Press about whether they will offer me a book contract for my book on the psychology of Generative AI integration. They have a very, very thorough vetting process! Hopefully it reflects how well they will do with their editing, in the case they do offer the book contract. Cross your fingers for me!
Would love to get your feedback on what you found most useful about this edition of the “Wise Decision Maker Guide” - simply reply to this email.
Decisively Yours,
Dr. Gleb

subject: RE: Staff Announcement - Larry Baker
body:
Hi Larry! 
I’m sad you’re leaving your full-time job. But I believe your talent will land you better opportunities. 
Being a contractor isn't bad at all, at least for me. My time is more flexible, and I can do more things I enjoy and work for other people. You might like it too. 
 
Most importantly, I hope you are happy, and I wish you good luck in your search for new opportunities.
 
Best,
~Keri

subject: Ireland’s EU Pay Transparency Bill: What to Know
body:
Learn about Ireland proposed transposition of the EU Pay Transparency Directive.
 
 
Hi Larry,
 
Are you up to date on Ireland’s proposed transposition of the EU Pay Transparency Directive? Join us for an insightful webinar outlining the newly proposed Equality (Miscellaneous Provisions) Bill 2024 and its impact on employers.
 
What we’ll cover:
How Ireland’s pay transparency bill differs from the EU Directive
New employer obligations, including mandatory salary disclosure
Best practices for navigating compliance with the upcoming changes
Potential penalties and enforcement mechanisms
If your organization operates in Ireland or the EU, register today to stay ahead. 
Register Now

subject: Session 1 Was a Hit—Don’t Miss Out on Sessions 2 & 3!
body:
Build stronger professional relationships and gain practical tools that you can use immediately in your workplace
 
Larry
, we’re thrilled to share that our first session of “We Can’t Talk About That at Work!” was a resounding success. Attendees gave us a 
5 out of 5 star rating 
and had this to say:
“
So honored
 to be in this space and having this dialogue.”
“Thank you for all the wonderful 
tips and tools!
”
“
Wonderful
 presentation!”
“
Amazing
 session!”
If you missed out on session 1, 
there’s still time to join us
 for the next two transformative sessions
 designed to empower you to navigate polarizing topics at work with confidence, empathy, and clarity.
What’s Next?
Session 2:
 Exploring the difference between acceptance and agreement and how to engage in dialogue rather than debate
Session 3:
 Building the skills to bridge rather than divide and to pave the way for meaningful connections that honor diversity of thought
 
Seats are limited, so don’t delay—
register now
 to secure your spot and be part of this dynamic learning experience.
 
Join us to build stronger professional relationships and gain practical tools that you can use immediately in your workplace.
 
P.S. Whether you choose to join one session or all three, each offers unique insights to help you navigate those tricky conversations with ease. 
Reserve your seat today!
Join Us in Session 2 and 3
 
 
Session 2: Talking About Differences with Humility
February 26, 2025 | $150
Discover how to listen deeply and understand perspectives that differ radically from your own. This session explores the art of dialogue versus debate, focusing on acceptance over agreement and building bridges through shared experiences.
 
Session 3: Bridging the Divide for Mutual Understanding
March 12, 2025 | $150
Build on the skills from the first two sessions to foster mutual respect and empathy. Learn practical techniques to create meaningful connections and transform divisions into opportunities for collaboration and understanding.
Don't Miss Out on This Series!
 
 
Learn from the experts and author of the book, Mary-Frances Winters and Mareisha N. Winters Reese. These interactive sessions will offer actionable insights and collaborative exercises to transform the way you engage in high-stakes discussions.
 
 
 
 
The Winters Group, 8116 South Tryon Street, Ste. B3-260, Charlotte, North Carolina 28273, United States

subject: 📢 Are Your Emails Helping or Hurting Your Business? 🤔
body:
Enhance your cross-cultural communication with these essential email strategies. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hello Larry!
🛑
 Picture this:
You sent an email to your global team expecting a quick reply. Instead, there’s radio silence. When responses do trickle in, they seem hesitant or even tense. You wonder—did I say something wrong? 
 
🤔
 The Experience:
The truth is that a simple email meant to be efficient can be perceived very differently depending on cultural norms. In some cultures, short and direct emails signal professionalism and clarity. In others, they may come across as cold or even rude.  
For example, a one-line email saying 
"Please send the report by Friday"
 might be perfectly acceptable when sent to a U.S. colleague but could feel abrupt and dismissive to colleagues in Japan or India, where a more relationship-focused approach is expected. 
These subtle differences can create misunderstandings, hesitation in responding, and even disengagement among your culturally diverse workforce. 
🌎💬
 
 
⚠️ 
The Problem:
Cultural differences in email communication are often overlooked, yet they can lead to serious workplace challenges, including: 
🚨
 
Misunderstandings and tension
—A straightforward request in one culture might feel abrupt or disrespectful in another.
📉
 
Decreased collaboration and engagement
—Employees are hesitant to respond due to fear of misinterpretation.
⏳
 
Delays and inefficiencies
—Multiple back-and-forth emails just to clarify a simple message.
💼
 
Lost business opportunities
—International partners may disengage if they perceive your communication as culturally insensitive. 
 
💡
 The Future You’re Waiting For:
Imagine a workplace where every email strengthens relationships rather than creating unintentional barriers. Where employees feel heard, valued, and confident in their communications—no matter their cultural background. 
A future where:
✅
 Messages are clear, culturally considerate, and well-received.
✅
 Global teams collaborate seamlessly, without misunderstandings.
✅
 Leaders foster an inclusive, high-trust environment through intentional communication. 
 
🎤
  What’s Next:
In my next email, I’ll share specific strategies you can implement 
right away
 to ensure your emails resonate across cultures—leading to better collaboration, higher engagement, and a more inclusive workplace. Stay tuned! 
📩
 
Let’s build workplaces where 
every email is a bridge—not a barrier.
 
 
Bye for now, 
Luiza
___________________________________
 
Luiza Dreasher, President and CEO (she/her/hers)
Mastering Cultural Differences 
I work with leaders who want to create a work environment where all employees feel valued and want to stay.
At 
Mastering Cultural Differences LLC,
 we are committed to helping organizations build inclusive, culturally competent workplaces where every individual feels valued and respected. Through highly customized programs, we equip teams with knowledge and skills to help them connect and collaborate more effectively across differences. This email and any attachments are intended solely for the recipient(s) and may contain confidential or legally privileged information. Any unauthorized review, use, disclosure, or distribution is prohibited. If you received this email in error, please notify the sender immediately and delete it from your system. We respect your privacy. Please note you also have the right to opt out of emails at any time via the link at the bottom of our emails. If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or need assistance managing your personal information, feel free to contact us at: 
www.masteringculturaldifferences.com
 or by sending an email to 
luiza@masteringculturaldifferences.com
.

Respite & Resilience Gatherings
30 min sessions
 
Wednesday Feb 19, 4:30 pm central / 5:30 pm eastern
Wednesday Feb 26, 8:30 am central / 9:30 am eastern
 
I will lead you through simple but powerful somatic tapping to ground and release current trauma including: 
* Two techniques for grounding and releasing the trauma of hypervigilance
* A daily practice to connect to your power and protect your energy

Joayne Nicole

subject: 🌍 Don’t Just Break the Glass Ceiling—Tear Down the Walls! (Bonus Discussion Guide Inside)🤝
body:
Continue reading to understand the impact of 'glass ceilings and walls' in your organization. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hello Larry!
Are invisible barriers limiting talent in your workplace? 
We often hear about the 
glass ceiling
—but what about the 
glass walls
 that quietly steer employees into certain roles, limiting their growth and leadership opportunities?  
Our latest DEI+ Newsletter, 
Breaking Through: Understanding Workplace Barriers Beyond the Ceiling, 
dives into these hidden obstacles and how they shape careers, often without us realizing it.
 
 
🔥
 
Why You Need to Read This
: 
Uncover the unseen career barriers that impact equity in your workplace. 
Learn practical steps to create a truly inclusive culture where talent flows freely. 
Get expert insights on fostering mobility—not just upward, but across departments. 
 
✨
 
BONUS: Discussion Guide Included!
This issue includes an exclusive 
Discussion Guide
 designed to help you lead meaningful conversations within your team. Use it to spark dialogue, challenge assumptions, and take real steps toward an equitable workplace. 
 
📩
 
Subscribe now and gain immediate access to this powerful issue!
 
 
  
👉
 
👉
 Click here to subscribe and read now!
 
 
Let’s break barriers—together. 
 
Bye for now, 
Luiza
___________________________________
 
Luiza Dreasher, President and CEO (she/her/hers)
Mastering Cultural Differences 
I work with leaders who want to create a work environment where all employees feel valued and want to stay.
At 
Mastering Cultural Differences LLC,
 we are committed to helping organizations build inclusive, culturally competent workplaces where every individual feels valued and respected. Through highly customized programs, we equip teams with knowledge and skills to help them connect and collaborate more effectively across differences. This email and any attachments are intended solely for the recipient(s) and may contain confidential or legally privileged information. Any unauthorized review, use, disclosure, or distribution is prohibited. If you received this email in error, please notify the sender immediately and delete it from your system. We respect your privacy. Please note you also have the right to opt out of emails at any time via the link at the bottom of our emails. If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or need assistance managing your personal information, feel free to contact us at: 
www.masteringculturaldifferences.com
 or by sending an email to 
luiza@masteringculturaldifferences.com
.

Greetings, 
 
If you missed the prior Gatherings, there are still two more.
Respite & Resilience Gatherings
30 min sessions
 
Wednesday Feb 19, 4:30 pm central / 5:30 pm eastern
Wednesday Feb 26, 8:30 am central / 9:30 am eastern
 
I will lead you through simple but powerful somatic tapping to ground and release current trauma including: 
* Two techniques for grounding and releasing the trauma of hypervigilance
* A daily practice to connect to your power and protect your energy
 
Your parasympathetic system will get a reset, you’ll have named and released much of what has accumulated in your body and we’ll share positive communal energy that you can take forward. 
 
Free to register
I’ll share a link for an optional sliding scale payment ($10 minimum) after we complete. 
Register for Feb 19 Gathering
 
Register for Feb 26 Gathering
 
Share all dates with someone who would like to attend

­ 
­ 
I hope you can join, 
 
Joayne Nicole

www.sparksofchangetogether.com

Transform your work with AI in Google Workspace
The best of Google AI is included in your Workspace plan. Use these AI tools to help save time and boost productivity.
Discover Google Workspace
 
Hi Larry,
 
AI can help you and your team boost efficiency and save time. Google Workspace integrates AI into the products you know and love and includes new products like NotebookLM Plus.
Help me write in Gmail and Docs
Gemini can help you refine the tone and style of your emails and documents. Use it to refine what you have, or start from scratch by having Gemini create a first draft.
Try Help me write
 
AI assistance in Gmail, Docs, Sheets, and more
Do your best work faster with AI embedded in the tools you use every day. Get help summarizing, analyzing, and generating content with insights from your emails, documents, and more.
Try side panel
 
Take notes for me in Meet
Focus on the conversation and let Gemini take meeting notes – including meeting summaries and action items – and send them straight to your Gmail inbox.
Try take notes for me
 
NotebookLM Plus
NotebookLM Plus is an AI-powered research tool that can help you get instant insights. Upload files from your organization and customize knowledge sharing – plus get Audio Overviews to listen to engaging summaries on the go.
Try NotebookLM Plus
 
 
View all recommendations
See you online, 
The Google Workspace Team 
 
 
© 2025 
Google LLC 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043

Chuck let me know of your chat, and I just want to make sure all is clear for us.

From:
 Rebecca Parrilla 
Sent:
 Friday, February 14, 2025 2:02 PM
To:
 Larry Baker <
l.baker@lcwmail.com
>; Andrea Wicks Bowles <
a.wicksbowles@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Office <
office@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Staff Announcement - Larry Baker
 
Larry,
I can’t believe today is your last day. You’re an important piece of the heart of LCW, and it’s hard to imagine this place without you. It shouldn’t have come to this. I’m truly sorry—for you, and for so many others over the past couple of years.
You’re incredible at what you do—genuine, skilled, and deeply authentic. I have no doubt your next adventure will make the most of those gifts, and wherever you land, they’ll be lucky to have you.
I’ll miss having you as my rapping judge and I’ll miss our legendary Cubs vs. White Sox “trash talking” (at least we’ll always agree on Da Bears). And when it comes to facilitation, there’s truly no one I’d rather be up there with.
Know that you always have my support—I’ve got your back, now and always.
Much love,
RP “The Shield”
 
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her) 
Why pronouns matter
Head of Client Solutions
LCW
 
 
From:
 Larry Baker <
l.baker@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Friday, February 14, 2025 12:00 PM

 Andrea Wicks Bowles <
a.wicksbowles@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Office <
office@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Staff Announcement - Larry Baker
 
Who’s cutting onions in here!!! 
☹
 
 
If I tell you that I have enjoyed every moment of my time here, it will still fall short of my feelings!! I have had the pleasure of working with folks that I respect and care for during my time here. 
 
I won’t say goodbye, I’ll just say see you soon!!
 
Best,
 
LBJ
 
From:

Hey Larry,
What can I say…  I have been so lucky to be a co-facilitator or 
just
 “
the consultant in the session
” -- and watched you present difficult and complex information with such expertise and humility.  Participants felt you were talking to them in an honest non-judgmental manner.  You created just the right setting for adult learning.
 
Professionally and personally, I will miss you greatly.  Please stay in touch 
awicksbowles@gmail.com
 
 
Cheers~
 
Andrea Wicks Bowles

From:
 Chuck Adams <
c.adams@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Friday, February 14, 2025 11:06 AM
To:
 Office <
office@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Staff Announcement - Larry Baker
 
Dear Team,
 
At the end of the day today, we bid farewell to Larry Baker as a full time employee. Larry has been a cornerstone of our facilitations and programs. His expertise, professionalism, and ability to create engaging and impactful sessions have been invaluable to our organization.
 
Larry has played a pivotal role in delivering meaningful experiences for our clients, helping them navigate complex topics and fostering deeper understanding through his thoughtful facilitation. His ability to connect with people, guide discussions, and inspire growth has left a lasting impression on everyone he’s worked with. We are incredibly grateful for the energy and dedication he has brought to his role. 
 
Please join me in thanking Larry for his outstanding work and we look forward to working with him as a contractor.
 
With gratitude,
 
Chuck/Nicole
 
 
Chuck Adams
 
(He/Him)
Chief Executive Officer

subject: February 2025 4-Up Friday
body:
February 2025 4-Up Friday
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
As we move into February, it’s time to focus on one of the most vital aspects of successful mentoring: 
time management
. How can we prioritize and structure our time to nurture meaningful mentoring relationships while staying true to our personal and professional commitments?
This month, we’re thrilled to have gained insights in our February 
Thought Leader Conversation 
with 
Katie McDonald
, founder of 
b.nourished
 and a renowned self-care and productivity expert. During our discussion, Katie offered practical strategies for 
managing time in mentoring
 relationships, helping mentors and mentees balance their responsibilities while embracing small, intentional actions that drive impactful, lasting change. Missed the conversation? No worries—you can 
watch the recording here
!
Mentor On!
The 
Center for Mentoring Excellence Team
 
FOUR UP FRIDAY
 
"The key is in not spending time, but in investing it."
 
This quote by Stephen R. Covey highlights the 
importance of intentionally allocating time
 to meaningful activities, like mentoring, to maximize its value and impact.
 
Join CEO Lisa Fain on 
March 26th
 for our next Thought Leader Conversation as she discusses 
Coaching in Mentoring 
with 
Professor David Clutterbuck
, a global authority and pioneer in coaching and mentoring. Co-founder of the European Mentoring & Coaching Council and author of over 80 books, David will share insights on how coaching principles can elevate mentoring relationships and drive impactful results. 
Don’t miss this opportunity—
Register today
!
 
Sarah Blondin’s 
Heart Minded: Living with Wisdom, Grace, and Compassion
 helps us reconnect with our feeling hearts and detach from the busyness of the mind. 
February Thought Leader Katie McDonald
 recommends it as a guide to rediscovering our human beingness over human doingness in a noisy, task-driven world.
Darren Hardy’s 
The Compound Effect
 reveals how small, consistent actions lead to extraordinary results. Katie highlights
 
how Hardy challenges us to embrace the seemingly minor tasks we often dismiss—reminding us they are the true catalysts for lasting change.
 
Mark Your Calendar!
Monday, April 7th
 | ⏰ 
3:45 PM PT
📍 
Monterey Marriott, 350 Calle Principal, Monterey, CA
Join Lisa at the 
2025 CalSAE Elevate Conference
 for her keynote 
Peer Mentoring for Engagement and Retention: Strengthening Association Communities. 
She will explore how peer mentoring fosters connection, growth, and long-term engagement. Don’t miss this insightful session!
Register by Feb 14
 to save $100 with early bird pricing!

subject: February 2025 4-Up Friday
body:
February 2025 4-Up Friday
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
As we move into February, it’s time to focus on one of the most vital aspects of successful mentoring: 
time management
. How can we prioritize and structure our time to nurture meaningful mentoring relationships while staying true to our personal and professional commitments?
This month, we’re thrilled to have gained insights in our February 
Thought Leader Conversation 
with 
Katie McDonald
, founder of 
b.nourished
 and a renowned self-care and productivity expert. During our discussion, Katie offered practical strategies for 
managing time in mentoring
 relationships, helping mentors and mentees balance their responsibilities while embracing small, intentional actions that drive impactful, lasting change. Missed the conversation? No worries—you can 
watch the recording here
!
Mentor On!
The 
Center for Mentoring Excellence Team
 
FOUR UP FRIDAY
 
"The key is in not spending time, but in investing it."
 
This quote by Stephen R. Covey highlights the 
importance of intentionally allocating time
 to meaningful activities, like mentoring, to maximize its value and impact.
 
Join CEO Lisa Fain on 
March 26th
 for our next Thought Leader Conversation as she discusses 
Coaching in Mentoring 
with 
Professor David Clutterbuck
, a global authority and pioneer in coaching and mentoring. Co-founder of the European Mentoring & Coaching Council and author of over 80 books, David will share insights on how coaching principles can elevate mentoring relationships and drive impactful results. 
Don’t miss this opportunity—
Register today
!
 
Sarah Blondin’s 
Heart Minded: Living with Wisdom, Grace, and Compassion
 helps us reconnect with our feeling hearts and detach from the busyness of the mind. 
February Thought Leader Katie McDonald
 recommends it as a guide to rediscovering our human beingness over human doingness in a noisy, task-driven world.
Darren Hardy’s 
The Compound Effect
 reveals how small, consistent actions lead to extraordinary results. Katie highlights
 
how Hardy challenges us to embrace the seemingly minor tasks we often dismiss—reminding us they are the true catalysts for lasting change.
 
Mark Your Calendar!
Monday, April 7th
 | ⏰ 
3:45 PM PT
📍 
Monterey Marriott, 350 Calle Principal, Monterey, CA
Join Lisa at the 
2025 CalSAE Elevate Conference
 for her keynote 
Peer Mentoring for Engagement and Retention: Strengthening Association Communities. 
She will explore how peer mentoring fosters connection, growth, and long-term engagement. Don’t miss this insightful session!
Register by Feb 14
 to save $100 with early bird pricing! 
Copyright © 2025 Center for Mentoring Excellence, All rights reserved.
You are receiving this email because you opted in via our website.
Our mailing address is:
Center for Mentoring Excellence
3040 78th Ave SE Unit 1173
Mercer Island
, 
WA
 
98040-3694
Add us to your address book
Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can 
update your preferences
 or 
unsubscribe from this list
.

Larry,
I can’t believe today is your last day. You’re an important piece of the heart of LCW, and it’s hard to imagine this place without you. It shouldn’t have come to this. I’m truly sorry—for you, and for so many others over the past couple of years.
You’re incredible at what you do—genuine, skilled, and deeply authentic. I have no doubt your next adventure will make the most of those gifts, and wherever you land, they’ll be lucky to have you.
I’ll miss having you as my rapping judge and I’ll miss our legendary Cubs vs. White Sox “trash talking” (at least we’ll always agree on Da Bears). And when it comes to facilitation, there’s truly no one I’d rather be up there with.
Know that you always have my support—I’ve got your back, now and always.
Much love,
RP “The Shield”

subject: EXCLUSIVE SHRM WEBINAR: Preparing Your Workplace for Immigration Enforcement
body:
Get expert guidance to navigate evolving immigration policies and ICE enforcement actions.
 
 
Join SHRM and vetted employment law experts Wednesday to equip yourself with real-time knowledge and tools necessary to proactively manage and support your workforce, including documented and migrant workers, amidst evolving immigration policies and ICE enforcement actions. Currently, the ICE raids seem to be targeting individuals with existing removal orders for quick deportation. Employers are not yet the focus of these raids but are likely to become a focal point in the future.
 
 
Key Discussion Points:
 
 
 
 
Current Immigration Enforcement Landscape:
Summary of recent executive orders affecting immigration, including stricter vetting and changes to birthright citizenship.
Analysis of ICE strategies, focusing on individuals with removal orders and potential shifts to employer-targeted enforcement.
 
 
 
 
Proactive Workforce Assessment:
Methods for identifying Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA), Temporary Protected Status (TPS) holders, or others with temporary immigration status.
Approaches to encourage voluntary status disclosure with confidentiality and trust.
 
 
 
 
I-9 Compliance and Internal Audits:
Best practices for internal I-9 audits to verify employment eligibility.
Guidance on correcting I-9 errors and ensuring federal compliance.
 
 
 
 
Developing a Response Plan for ICE Actions:
Steps to develop an action plan for unannounced ICE visits, plus information on employer rights and responsibilities.
Training for staff on handling ICE interactions with minimal disruption.
 
 
 
 
Support Systems for Migrant Employees:
Resources to help employees navigate immigration status.
Promoting a workplace culture centered around inclusion & diversity that ensures security for migrant workers.
 
 
By attending this webcast, you can proactively prepare and implement robust compliance and support strategies to mitigate risks associated with immigration enforcement actions and maintain a stable, inclusive, and legally compliant workplace for your organization. You will earn 
1 professional development credit (PDC)
 for attending this webinar.
 
 
 
REGISTER NOW
 
 
 
 
 
About the Speakers
 
 
 
 
Emily M. Dickens, J.D.
Chief of Staff, Head of Government Affairs, and Corporate Secretary, SHRM
Emily M. Dickens is a member of the executive team at SHRM, the world’s largest human resources trade association and fourth largest trade association in the world. Emily leads government affairs, global policy, legal affairs, and the SHRM Foundation.
 
 
 
 
Bo Cooper
Partner, Fragomen
Bo Cooper is a partner in Fragomen’s Washington, D.C. office. He leads the firm’s Government Strategies and Compliance Group and is a member of Fragomen’s Executive Committee.
 
 
 
 
K. Edward Raleigh
Partner, Fragomen
K. Edward Raleigh is a partner in Fragomen’s Government Strategies and Compliance Group based in Washington, D.C. He focuses on strategic risk management, investigations, and disputes.
 
 
REGISTER NOW
 
 
If It’s a Work Thing, It’s a SHRM Thing
As these critical changes evolve, you need more than just answers. Join SHRM now to access exclusive member resources such as:
Trusted guidance from 
SHRM’s HR Knowledge Advisors
 for your toughest HR challenges.
Industry-leading insights and content that keep you prepared for what’s next. 
Dedicated how-to guides and toolkits to streamline your day-to-day tasks.
Peer discussions via SHRMConnect, available 24/7 for real-time collaboration.
No matter what “work thing” you’re facing, you deserve a partner committed to elevating—and advocating for—all things work, workers, and the workplace.
 
 
 
JOIN SHRM
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Already a member?
 Our records indicate that the email address l.baker@lcwmail.com isn’t matched to a current membership. Please contact our Customer Experience Team or update your account in the 
MySHRM section
 of the website after you log in.
 
 
 
Connect with us on social!
 
  
  
  
  
 
1800 Duke Street, Alexandria, Virginia 22314 USA

You will keep your LCW laptop 
We will keep your LCW email active
We will keep your Zoom active

Thanks for your patience!

subject: Uncover the latest legal implications of DEI with Legal Scholar Kenji Yoshino
body:
Celebrate the Power of Inclusion with Legal Scholar and Bestselling Author Kenji Yoshino at the Power of Inclusion Summit!
 
 
Uncover the Power of Inclusion with Legal Scholar and Bestselling Author Kenji Yoshino!
 
 
Kenji Yoshino built a movement around the idea that 
diversity reflects our greatest strengths and needs to be celebrated and protected. 
Denying, minimizing, and covering inhibits potential and erodes civil rights for everyone.
 
Join us as Kenji Yoshino shares about the state of civil rights and the future as we work together to protect diversity and inclusion.
 
We are excited to have Kenji as one of our Keynote Speakers at the 
2025 Justice for All Summit: The Power of Inclusion.
Reserve Your Seat
 
More about Kenji:
Kenji Yoshino is the Chief Justice Earl Warren Professor of Constitutional Law at NYU School of Law and the Director of the Meltzer Center for Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging. A graduate of Harvard (AB summa cum laude), Oxford (MSc as a Rhodes Scholar) and Yale (JD), he specializes in constitutional law, antidiscrimination law, and law and literature. He received tenure at Yale Law School, where he served as Deputy Dean before moving to NYU.
 
Yoshino has published in major academic journals, including the Harvard Law Review, the Stanford Law Review, and the Yale Law Journal. He has also written for more popular forums, including the Los Angeles Times, the New York Times, and the Washington Post. Yoshino is the author of three books. His fourth book (co-authored with David Glasgow), Say the Right Thing: How to Talk About Identity, Diversity, and Justice, was published by Simon and Schuster in February 2023.
 
Yoshino has served as the President of the Harvard Board of Overseers. He currently serves on the Board of the Brennan Center for Justice, on advisory boards for diversity and inclusion for Morgan Stanley and Charter Communications, and on the board of his children’s school. He has won numerous awards for his teaching and scholarship, including the American Bar Association’s Silver Gavel Award, the Peck medal in jurisprudence, and the New York University’s Distinguished Teaching Award.
 
He lives in Manhattan with his husband, two children, and a Great Dane.
Register Now
 
More about The 2025 Justice for All Summit: The Power of Inclusion
 
What is the Justice for All Summit?
The third annual Justice for All Summit, being held April 21-24, 2025, is the premier virtual conference to connect, get inspired, and learn innovative strategies for cultural transformation through diversity, equity, inclusion, and justice practices.
Who attends?
This restorative space brings together between 500 - 750 HR practitioners, executives, team leaders, learning and development staff, corporate trainers, organizational development professionals, and diversity practitioners in community for learning, networking, and personal/professional development.
 
Who is The Winters Group?
Proudly Black women-owned and -led, The Winters Group has helped organizations strategically increase their capacity to be more culturally competent, create sustainable equitable policies, and foster inclusive workplaces since 1984.
Reserve Your Seat
 
 
 
 
 
The Winters Group, 8116 South Tryon Street, Ste. B3-260, Charlotte, North Carolina 28273, United States

Respite & Resilience Gathering
11:30 am central / 12:30 pm eastern
 
STARTS IN TWO HOURS

30 min session
 
I will lead you through simple but powerful somatic tapping to ground and release current trauma including: 
* Two techniques for grounding and releasing the trauma of hypervigilance
* A daily practice to connect to your power and protect your energy
 
Your parasympathetic system will get a reset, you’ll have named and released much of what has accumulated in your body and we’ll share positive communal energy that you can take forward.

Register for other dates

Joayne Nicole

subject: 🎥Time is Running Out! Join us for a Game-Changing Film Industry Discussion!
body:
Chicago at a Crossroads: Lights, Camera, Economic Impact – The Role of Illinois’ Film Industry 
 
Click 
here
 
to view this email in your browser.
 
CHICAGO AT A CROSSROADS
 
Lights, Camera, Economic Impact 
– 
The Role of Illinois' Film Industry
 
WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 19, 2025
10:00 AM 
—
 12:00 PM CST
CINECITY
2429 W 14TH ST
REGISTER NOW
 
Hurry! 
Be Part of the Film Industry Conversation
—secure your spot today! 
 
Join us for the Chicagoland Chamber of Commerce’s 
Chicago at a Crossroads: Lights, Camera, Economic Impact – The Role of Illinois’ Film Industry
 on February 19th, from 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM, at CineCity. This engaging program will spotlight Illinois’ film industry as a cornerstone of the state’s economic growth, showcasing how the Illinois Film Production Tax Credit and other industry advancements have positioned the state as a premier destination for film and television. With industry leaders, government officials, and creative professionals, the discussion will explore how film production drives job creation, investment, and long-term economic success.
 
We’re excited to welcome 
Brett Hays
, 
an award-winning producer and co-founder of
 
Shatterglass Studios
, whose work with 
Disney, Netflix, and A24
 has made him a key player in Illinois' entertainment economy. His experience balancing the creative and business sides of production, along with his work on projects like 
Deli Boys
 (Disney) and 
Beauty in Black
 (Netflix), will provide invaluable insights into the industry's future. Also part of our panel is 
Ashley Rice, President of Cinespace Studios
, who has overseen some of Illinois’ largest productions and previously managed Legendary TV’s studio operations while also having served as VP of Production at 
ABC Studios
, working closely with Shonda Rhimes and Mark Gordon. 
Anthony Barracca, Business Manager and Secretary Treasurer of IATSE Local 476
, brings decades of experience in labor leadership and set decoration, with credits on
 High Fidelity, Superman: Man of Steel, and 11 seasons of Chicago Fire
. Rounding out the panel is 
Christine Dudley, Executive Director of the Illinois Production Alliance
 and former Director of the Illinois Film Office, who was instrumental in expanding the Illinois Film Production Tax Credit and driving record-breaking growth for the state’s film industry.
 
Why You Need to Be in the Room:
 
Gain exclusive insights from top industry leaders.
Learn how Illinois’ film incentives are shaping economic growth.
Explore business and investment opportunities in entertainment.
Connect with key decision-makers driving Illinois’ film industry forward.
 
Spots are limited—register today! 
 
There is free parking at the event venue.
 
Presented by Old National Bank, 
Chicago at a Crossroads
 is a dynamic executive forum that features insights about major policy decisions and topics that are of the utmost importance for a strong and equitable Chicago economy. Join the Chamber as we explore some of most pressing issues facing our city and offer actionable policy recommendations to grow the economy and improve the quality of life for every member of the Chicagoland community.
FEATURED SPEAKERS
 
 
Ashley Rice
President | Cinespace Studios
 
Anthony Barraca
Business Manager/Secretary Treasurer |
IATSE Local 476 Chicago Studio Mechanics
 
Brett Hays
Co-Owner and Producer | Shatterglass Studios
 
Christine Dudley 
Executive Director | Illinois Production Alliance

    HOST SPONSOR
 
 
 
FOLLOW THE CHAMBER

The Wrigley Building | 410 N Michigan Ave | Suite 900
Chicago, IL 60611

subject: In Case You Missed It #54: The Rise & Reign of Remote Work and more
body:
ICYMI 
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
Greetings Larry,
To help you filter the signal from the noise, I curated the most valuable articles I came across recently in case you missed them.
“
The Rise & Reign of Remote Work: A Decadelong Breakdown of America’s WFH Evolution
” 
(Governing.com)
Summary
Remote work has transformed America’s employment landscape over the last decade, driven largely by technological advances and the COVID-19 pandemic. Between 2014 and 2023, the number of remote workers tripled, growing from 6.5 million to over 22.4 million. Remote work peaked in 2021, with 17.9% of employees working remotely, but has since declined to 13.8% in 2023 as many industries returned to in-person work. 
Cities like Austin, Raleigh, and Denver have become hubs for remote workers due to their tech-friendly economies and high quality of life. Austin leads the pack, with 25% of its workforce utilizing remote or hybrid models. Meanwhile, cities such as Omaha, Akron, and Harrisburg saw the most significant increases in remote work adoption, with growth rates exceeding 300% over the past decade. Interestingly, some medium-sized metro areas, such as Lancaster, PA and Cape Coral, FL, have seen continued growth in remote work post-pandemic, underscoring the enduring appeal of flexible work options.
Dr. Gleb’s Take
Remote work is no longer a trend—it’s a permanent feature of the modern workforce. The massive growth over the past decade underscores the demand for flexibility and work-life balance. Companies that resist remote work or hybrid models are operating on outdated assumptions and risk alienating top talent. The data also highlights an important geographic shift: remote workers are choosing locations based on lifestyle, not proximity to traditional job centers. This is an opportunity for smaller metro areas and regions historically outside the spotlight to attract skilled professionals by fostering remote-friendly ecosystems. Leaders must recognize that the future of work prioritizes autonomy, technology-driven collaboration, and location independence. Clinging to pre-pandemic office norms will put organizations at a strategic disadvantage in a rapidly evolving labor market.
“
If firms want people to ‘return to office,’ they should offer a better experience
” 
(Workplace Insight)
Summary
A report from the British Council for Offices (BCO) emphasizes that to entice employees back to physical workspaces, companies must rethink office environments to compete with the comfort and flexibility of home. The report, titled 
Towards Experience Utopia
, positions employees as the ultimate judges of value, urging organizations to treat them as customers by creating engaging, meaningful, and flexible office experiences.
The report outlines strategies such as data-driven decision-making, promoting employee well-being, and fostering a culture of innovation. It highlights the importance of aligning office design with employee expectations and incorporating insights into space utilization and feedback. Practical recommendations include flexible leasing models, sustainable building practices, and focusing on inclusivity and operational excellence. Case studies from companies like NatWest, Deloitte, and the Government Property Agency illustrate how thoughtful investments in office experiences can create environments that inspire employees to return.
Dr. Gleb’s Take
The return-to-office debate, research shows, should not be about forcing employees back; it’s about making them 
want
 to come back. This report gets it right: the modern office needs to offer something home offices cannot. Companies stuck in the mindset that mandates and metrics will drive in-office attendance are setting themselves up for failure.
Treat employees like valued customers. Redesign workspaces with their needs and preferences in mind, blending flexibility, comfort, and purpose. Use data to inform decisions, but don’t ignore the human element—employees crave connection, creativity, and meaning in their workspaces. The workplace of the future is hybrid, dynamic, and employee-centered. Businesses unwilling to embrace this shift will lose not just their top talent but their competitive edge.
"
Prison And Crime: Much More Than You Wanted to Know
" 
(Astral Codex Ten)
Summary
This comprehensive article explores the effectiveness of long prison sentences in reducing crime. It examines three primary mechanisms: deterrence (preventing crimes by threat of punishment), incapacitation (preventing crimes by locking offenders away), and aftereffects (impact on recidivism post-incarceration). Research suggests:
Deterrence effects of long sentences are minimal, with only a small impact on crime rates.
Incapacitation is effective, with each year of incarceration preventing an average of one violent crime and six property crimes.
Aftereffects are mixed—medium-length sentences may ruin lives, fostering recidivism, while for very long sentences, the criminals age out of the most likely time for people to commit crimes, when they are young.
Cost-benefit analysis reveals that longer prison sentences are often less cost-effective than alternative methods such as investing in policing or probation. Policymakers are urged to consider these alternatives for reducing crime.
Dr. Gleb’s Take
The evidence is clear: long prison sentences are a costly and inefficient tool for crime reduction. The obsession with being “tough on crime” leads to emotional, politically driven policies that ignore the data. Incapacitation works, but we’re paying a premium for a strategy that disproportionately harms communities and doesn’t address root causes. And to the extent we put people in prison, we should either do short prison sentences, under 6 months, or long ones, over 5 years, with medium-term prison sentences of 6 months to 5 years being the worst of all possible worlds.
The real solution lies in smarter investments—hiring more police to increase the certainty of punishment, improving probation systems, and expanding courts to ensure efficient legal processing. Locking people away is a blunt instrument when precision tools like targeted policing and community interventions are available. If we continue pouring resources into prisons without a strategy shift, we’re wasting taxpayer money and perpetuating cycles of crime.
What did you think of my take on these articles? Look forward to hearing from you, simply reply to this email with your thoughts.
Decisively yours,
Dr. Gleb
Dr. Gleb Tsipursky
CEO of Disaster Avoidance Experts
Let's Connect!
Disaster Avoidance Experts is a social enterprise dedicated to promoting science-based truth-seeking and wise decision-making. All profits are donated to 
Intentional Insights
, an educational 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, and its 
Pro-Truth Pledge
 project.
You're getting this email because you indicated that you wanted Dr. Gleb's resources.

Unlock the future of AI leadership
AI isn't just transforming industries; it's reshaping leadership itself. The role of Chief AI Officer (CAIO) is gaining momentum, and our latest

Discover how industry giants like Microsoft, eBay, and Boeing are pioneering AI leadership roles, while other Fortune 500 companies blend AI responsibilities with data and information functions. With the role still evolving, the CAIO position highlights the rapid pace of AI innovation and its strategic importance.

subject: 🌍 The Fix: How to Make Virtual Meetings Truly Inclusive ✨
body:
Continue reading for successful strategies on running global, virtual meetings. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hello Larry!
 
🔹
 
Simple strategies to bridge time zones & cultures for better collaboration
 
 
Looping back... 
⏪
In my last email, we talked about how virtual meetings often leave out key voices due to time zone conflicts and cultural differences. This silent struggle leads to disengagement, miscommunication, and poor decision-making. 
But here’s the good news: 
You can fix this with a few simple yet powerful strategies!
 
 
🕒
 Strategy #1: Rotate Meeting Times Fairly 
💡
 
Respect work-life balance across all regions
 
Instead of expecting the same people to attend inconvenient meetings every time, 
rotate meeting times
 to share the burden equally. If someone has to join at 10 PM one week, make sure it’s someone else’s turn the next. 
✅
 
Bonus Tip:
 Use asynchronous communication (emails, recordings, and message boards) to gather input from those who can’t attend live. 
 
🗣️
 Strategy #2: Adapt to Different Communication Styles 
💡
 
Silence ≠ Agreement!
 
In some cultures, direct disagreement is seen as disrespectful, while in others, debate is encouraged. To create a safe space for all voices: 
✔️
 Allow anonymous feedback for sensitive discussions.
✔️
 Ask direct but open-ended questions like 
"How does this align with your experience?"
 instead of 
"Does everyone agree?"
✔️
 Follow up 1:1 with quieter team members to ensure they feel heard. 
 
📅
 Strategy #3: Clarify Expectations for Time & Deadlines 
💡
 
"ASAP" means different things across cultures!
 
Some cultures prioritize speed, while others value thorough deliberation. To avoid frustration: 
✔️
 Be explicit about deadlines (
e.g., “Reports due by Friday at 5 PM EST, United States”
).
✔️
 Set clear decision-making processes so that no one feels pressured or left out.
✔️
 Use collaborative tools like shared documents where people can contribute in their own time zones. 
 
🤝
 Strategy #4: Build Trust Across Cultures 
💡
 
Trust isn’t universal—it’s built differently everywhere!
 
For some, trust is based on 
credibility
 (titles, experience), for others, it’s about 
reliability
 (doing what you say) or having the opportunity to get to know each other. A successful virtual team: 
✔️
 Establishes 
team norms
 that respect both perspectives.
✔️
 Encourages small talk and informal chats to strengthen relationships.
✔️
 Uses video calls selectively—some team members may prefer writing over speaking. 
 
🚀
 Ready to Make Your Virtual Meetings More Inclusive? 
By making small but intentional changes, you can 
boost engagement, collaboration, and retention
 across your global workforce. 
 
📆
 Let’s chat!
 I’d love to help your team create virtual meetings that work for 
everyone
. Schedule a complimentary call with me today to discuss how to bring these strategies to life in your organization. 
 
👉
 
Schedule your free consultation here!
 
Because when everyone feels valued and heard, 
your entire organization wins.
 
🌟
 
Bye for now, 
Luiza
___________________________________

At

 we are committed to helping organizations build inclusive, culturally competent workplaces where every individual feels valued and respected. Through highly customized programs, we equip teams with knowledge and skills to help them connect and collaborate more effectively across differences. "Your session was lovely, my friends appreciated it as well. Your calm voice created a space that held whatever we had to bring. And the exercises felt calming and grounding. Thank you."
Respite & Resilience Gathering
30 min session, this is the last one for now y'all!
 
Wednesday Feb 26, 8:30 am central / 9:30 am eastern
 
I will lead you through simple but powerful somatic tapping to ground and release current trauma including: 
* Two techniques for grounding and releasing the trauma of hypervigilance
* A daily practice to connect to your power and protect your energy
 
Your parasympathetic system will get a reset, you’ll have named and released much of what has accumulated in your body and we’ll share positive communal energy that you can take forward. 
 
Free to register
I’ll share a link for an optional sliding scale payment ($10 minimum) after we complete. 
Register for Feb 26 Gathering
 
Share the info with someone
 
­ 
­ 
­ 
I hope you can join, 
 
Joayne Nicole
­
PS: My rebranded website is live! If you want to check it out, have a look here: 
www.sparksofchangetogether.com 
Sparks of Change
4509 Oakland Ave, 55407, Minneapolis

larry@lcwmail.com

subject: Enhance your people skills with quick 10-minute lessons!
body:
Unlock career growth with 10-minute lessons from The Winters Group
 
Upgrade your human-centered skills in 10 minute "bytes" with personalized learning from The Winters Group
 
Studies show that 85% of job success comes from people skills like critical thinking, communication, problem solving, conflict resolution, and leadership. AND a packed calendar and never ending to-do list makes it difficult to get to the professional development that will help grow your career.
 
There is a solution!
 
Byte-Sized Learning
 from The Winters Group is a growing collection of engaging and comprehensive 
skills-centric
, 
self-paced, online learning experiences
 that help you grow, professionally and personally, by developing essential skills and competencies that are proven to support career growth - and it's now available for individual access.
 
Get one-year of individual access to the course now!
 
Your personal learning journey starts with our flagship course, 
Byte-Sized DEI™: The Path to Inclusion. 
Created by award-winning designers, it
 will ground you in the fundamental knowledge and understanding of diversity, equity, and inclusion - empowering you to 
work more effectively across cultures
, 
enhance communication and teamwork
, and 
avoid misunderstandings and potential conflict
. 
 
There are 
10 modules 
comprised of over
 40 total lessons. 
E
ach lesson takes no more than
 10 minutes to complete.
 
 
Along the way, you'll have the opportunity to check your knowledge and reflect on your own experience, and develop new skills that you can begin to use 
right away
.
Enhance your skills today
 
Want to bring The Path to Inclusion to your organization?
 
Ready to take the first step toward building a more inclusive culture organization-wide? 
Explore what Byte-Sized Learning can offer your team here
, and join us as we revolutionize workplace education, one byte at a time. 
Start your learning journey
 
 
 
 
 
The Winters Group, 8116 South Tryon Street, Ste. B3-260, Charlotte, North Carolina 28273, United States

Google Workspace offers intuitive tools to streamline communication, simplify project management, and increase overall efficiency for teams of any size.
 
Discover Google Workspace
 
 
 
Hi Larry,

subject: - Three more dates for free Respite & Resiliency sessions.
body:
Free to register, first one is this Friday 2/14; because Love. ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ 
 
 
 Hello dear ones, 
 
How are you faring?
 
I heard from numerous folks that they were interested but unable to make the date on such short notice for the first Respite & Resilience Gathering.  
 
Good news is that it went really well and felt so mutually beneficial that I'm going to offer three more. See below for dates, times and registration links.
 
The session format will be the same, feel free to join for one or all.  
 
Respite & Resilience Gatherings
30 min sessions
 
Friday Feb 14, 11:30 am central / 12:30 pm eastern
Wednesday Feb 19, 4:30 pm central / 5:30 pm eastern
Wednesday Feb 26, 8:30 am central / 9:30 am eastern
 
I will lead you through simple but powerful somatic tapping to ground and release current trauma including: 
* Two techniques for grounding and releasing the trauma of hypervigilance
* A daily practice to connect to your power and protect your energy
 
Your parasympathetic system will get a reset, you’ll have named and released much of what has accumulated in your body and we’ll share positive communal energy that you can take forward. 
 
Free to register
I’ll share a link for an optional sliding scale payment ($10 minimum) after we complete. 
Register for Feb 14 Gathering
 
Register for Feb 19 Gathering
 
Register for Feb 26 Gathering
 
Share all dates with someone who would like to attend
 
­ 
­ 
­ 
I look forward to connecting, 
 
Joayne Nicole
­
PS: My rebranded website is live! If you want to check it out, have a look here: 
www.sparksofchangetogether.com 
Sparks of Change
4509 Oakland Ave, 55407, Minneapolis
This email was sent to 
larry@lcwmail.com
You've received it because you've subscribed to our newsletter.
View in browser
 | 
Unsubscribe
