IDI Assessment Website Migration Starts Today
 
Reminder:  IDI Qualified Administrators (QAs) will receive an email to claim your IDI QA account. Please use the email address associated with your IDI account to log into the new IDI Platform on 
Monday, February 17, 2025
. 
 
The current IDI Assessment Website will be unavailable starting today,
 
Wednesday, February 12, 2025 at approximately 3:00pm EST
, as we migrate to the new IDI Platform.
This means that all functions related to using the IDI (completing the IDI, ordering, generating IDI Reports, etc.) will 
not
 be available from Wednesday, February 12th until the new IDI Platform launches 
Monday, February 17, 2025
.
Please be sure to notify respondents if they are attempting to complete the IDI during this time. Once the migration has finished, you will be able to send account activation emails to your respondents with active Assessments so they can complete the IDI in the new Platform.
 
Some resources to help you prepare for the new IDI Platform are available in your account’s QA Resources page under 
New IDI Platform Resources.
You can find the previous emails sent here:
Announcement & Overview of Features
Original Launch Date & Migration Details
February 17th Launch Date 
All QA resources will move to the IDI Help Center once the new Platform launches. To access all QA-specific resources and articles, you will need to sign into the IDI Help Center (powered by Zendesk), which you can do by clicking the button below. Once signed in, you can track the articles you view and see the status of any support inquiries.
If you have emailed us before, you may already have an account. Signing up will let you know if you need to create an account or simply change your password. 
Sign Up for the IDI Help Center
Your login credentials for the IDI Help Center are 
separate
 from the new IDI Platform. 
Register for Upcoming Platform Events
All upcoming Q&A sessions are listed in Eventbrite.
Click below for details on all upcoming IDI Platform events.
Register
 
Questions?
Please reach out to us: 
support@idiinventory.com
View email in browser
Copyright (C) 2025 IDI, LLC. All rights reserved.
You are receiving this email because you are listed within the IDI, LLC database as an IDI Qualified Administrator or are attending an upcoming IDI Qualifying Seminar. These are only meant for important updates, so please do not unsubscribe. 
Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can 
update your preferences
 or 
unsubscribe

subject: Inside look: How growing companies keep things creative

MEMBER SPOTLIGHT
How a design agency finds their creative spark with WeWork
 
Meet Franklyn
Dock 72, Brooklyn | Member since 2021
Brooklyn-based design studio Franklyn believes the creative process should be just as delightful as the results. From global rebrands to daily brainstorms, getting the team together in person at their WeWork office helps them stay inspired.
Read more
 
Pairing playfulness with pragmatism
Just like how WeWork spaces combine thoughtful design and practical office essentials, Franklyn's approach to branding is one that balances fun with functionality. 
“We take our work seriously, but we don't take ourselves seriously.”
Patrick Richardson, Co-Founder
 
Making space for different styles of work
Staying creative means collaboration can happen in a communal lounge, at a desk, or in a meeting room. WeWork gives Franklyn's hybrid team plenty of space and flexibility to both work and play.
“Every member of our team has their own style. WeWork lets them choose when, where, and how they work.”
Eric Brown, Account Director

subject: The Moth and the Flame: Politics and Religion
body:
National ERG Faith@Work "Dare to Overcome" Conference 2025
 
 
The Moth and The Flame
 
Vice President JD Vance gives keynote at IRF Summit | Credit: IRF Summit; Cardinal Dolan addresses Solidarity March | Credit: Sam Aronov / Shutterstock.com
 
Making Sense of Politics and Religion
Dear Larry Baker, 
I spent most of last week in meetings in Washington DC. I was struck by how closely politics and religion intermingle. U.S. Vice President JD Vance spoke at the International Religious Freedom (IRF) Summit. President Donald Trump addressed the National Prayer Breakfast.
But the relationship between politics and religion is often uneasy. This uneasiness was on display a week after New York Catholic archbishop Cardinal Timothy Dolan gave a warmly received invocation at Donald Trump’s inauguration. Fellow Catholic, U.S. Vice President JD Vance, leveled criticism against the US Conference of Catholic Bishops, which 'hurt' the cardinal. 
You can read my reflection on this uneasy relationship in my latest Patheos blog, 
The Moth and the Flame: When Politics and Religion Collide
. The title is a nod the late sociologist of religion N.J. Demerath III.
Read: The Moth and The Flame
 
You can also see my conversation about faith-friendly workplaces with Cardinal Dolan from 2020 below. Ironically, it was right after he interviewed former U.S. Attorney General Bill Barr. 
 
As highlighted in last week's newsletter, the state of religious freedom worldwide is at its lowest point in 16 years and that current strategies for combatting the deterioration of this universal human right are insufficient.
The solution is to adopt a new strategy that harnesses a powerful and untapped force with a vested interest in building religious freedom worldwide. 
That’s business
.
If you want to see this in action, join us for our 6th annual Faith@Work multi-faith conference in Washington DC: 
 
May 20-22, 2025, Dare to Overcome
Dare to Overcome
 (DTO) is the premier annual gathering for Fortune 500 company employee resource groups (ERGs), corporate chaplains, and other faith-and-belief workplace initiatives to share best practices and celebrate achievements.
On Days 1 & 2, join us for essential conversations and dynamic presentations on issues companies, leaders and employees are facing in an ever-changing socio-economic environment at home and abroad.
If your company hasn't yet requested a link to the 
REDI Index Faith-Friendly Workplace survey
, do so today! 
Deadline March 15th
, with Awards presented at a gala dinner on Tuesday, May 20th, the conference's first night.
 
Day 3 (optional) is the IRF Builders Summit focused on ways people build religious freedom for all internationally through faith-friendly workplaces, education, positive engagement, and cross-cultural religious literacy, among others.
>>
 
SPONSORSHIP PACKET for Days 1&2
 
REGISTER NOW
 
Day 1
 will begin with special networking sessions for faith-specific and interfaith employee resource groups (ERGs), an opening Plenary and the Keynote by the Dean of the Busch School of Business, Andrew Abela (all attendees get his new book 
Superhabits: the Universal System for a Successful Life
).
Looking forward to seeing you in Washington DC in May!
Brian Grim
RFBF President
Dare to Overcome, Global Chair 
Valuable Gift at Conference to first 200 attendees
 
 
Registration and Sponsorships OPEN!
 
RFBF helps people in business practice the virtues that faith reinforces through our annual 
"Dare to Overcome" Fortune 500 Faith@Work conference
 in Washington DC (May 20-22, 2025). This year's theme "United in Hope" will feature a keynote by Andrew Abela, dean of the Busch Business School at Catholic University, with exciting insights from his new book 
Superhabits: the Universal System for a Successful Life.
 
 
UK Edition
 
Are you in Europe? Join us on 29th April for our second annual 
Faith@Work Summit
. 
 
Weekly Feature

subject: Torn between two offers?
body:
Plus: a handout or a helping hand? 
February 12, 2025  ·  
View in browser
 
The Insightful Leader
BY 
KELLOGG INSIGHT
Leadership advice from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University
Good morning,
We’re told to be bold and ask for what we want in interviews—but is there a line?
Kellogg’s 
Leigh Thompson
, an expert negotiator, addresses the question in the context of a student who had a dilemma: Should they leverage one job offer against another they had already accepted?
We’ll get into that today. Plus, how emotions affect our willingness to accept help.
The scenario
In her Substack, “Dear Professor: Negotiation Help,” Thompson, a Kellogg professor of management and organizations, explains that her student had signed an offer with Company A, but soon after sought and received an offer from Company B, in a geographical location they strongly preferred. Their dilemma was whether and how to use the second offer (from Company B) as leverage to request a reassignment to a different office within Company A. Their initial plan was to send an email to Company A essentially stating that they had another job offer, and unless Company A could assign them to a different geographical location, they would retract their acceptance.
Thompson’s recommendations? Pump the brakes.
Acknowledge your commitment
Once you’ve signed an offer, it’s important to approach subsequent negotiations delicately, Thompson says. Using a new offer as “leverage” can often be perceived as a threat—a tactic unlikely to foster goodwill. In fact, it could harm your reputation. The professional business world is highly connected, and people talk!
Request a synchronous conversation
Thompson says that you should only deliver good news and updates via email and that negotiation conversations of this nature require something that’s more verbal or face-to-face. You should request a phone or video call with a decision-maker at Company A, she recommends, which allows for rapport-building in real time and conversational adjustments—and creates space for collaborative problem-solving. During this conversation, avoid mentioning the new offer, and instead present the discussion as an opportunity to explore a mutual solution, such as a reassignment to your preferred location.
Frame your request from the employer’s perspective
When presenting your case, focus on how the change would benefit the organization. For instance, explain how your presence in the desired location could strengthen client relationships, align with strategic goals, or address specific needs. Avoid framing the request solely around your personal preferences; instead, emphasize how this move aligns with the company’s objectives. Use research or evidence to support your proposal and demonstrate that you’ve thought carefully about their perspective.
Read more in Thompson’s Substack, 
Dear Professor
.
 
A handout or a helping hand?
How people perceive the help they receive can make a significant difference when it comes to humanitarian and charitable aid.
Kellogg researchers 
Samantha Kassirer
, 
Ata Jami
, and 
Maryam Kouchaki
 conducted a battery of experiments in Kenya and the U.S. to find out how different types of charitable aid influenced people’s emotions—and whether those emotions would affect their willingness to accept aid in the first place.
“Past studies have compared the effect of offering cash versus no aid at all,” Kouchaki says, “whereas we wanted to compare people’s response to cash versus food aid.”
Their results suggest that cash and in-kind aid encourage different psychological responses and behaviors from the people who receive it.
In-kind donations can lead to positive feelings of being cared for and better take-up of aid. But under certain conditions, cash can create feelings of shame—and make people less likely to accept the charity’s help. However, when cash aid comes from the government instead of a charitable organization, these emotional and behavioral effects disappear.
The takeaway, according to Kassirer, isn’t that cash is bad and food is good. Instead, the kind of aid charities provide also sends a social message that can either support or undermine their efforts.
Read more in 
Kellogg Insight
.
“Normal is more than a setting on the washing machine. Being reminded of the prevalence of a problem is a potent psychological force that changes how people judge everything from the severity of wounds to the dangers of drunk driving to chest pain and even personal medical risks.”
— 
Lauren Eskreis-Winkler
 and coauthors, in a 
new research paper
 about the big problem paradox. The research was also featured in 
The New York Times
.
See you next week,
Laura Pavin, multimedia editor
Kellogg Insight
Follow us on 
LinkedIn
.
And listen to our 
podcasts
.
Kellogg School of Management
 | 
2211 Campus Drive
, 
Evanston, IL 60208

From meeting summaries to brainstorming ideas, ask AI Companion!
Whether you use Zoom to call your family or close deals, Zoom AI Companion is ready to assist you. When you’re in a meeting and you didn’t quite catch what was said, you can ask: “What did [person] say about [topic]?”. Or when you’re finished with that family discussion, use the AI Companion side panel to search the web directly for more information, such as: “How tall is the Eiffel Tower?” or “Help me plan a 1-week trip to Paris with my family”.
AI Companion is easy and ready to use! Get started today.*
Get started
 
 
 
Impress, don’t stress: 5 reasons why Zoom Workplace will benefit your small business
Running a small business means dealing with unique challenges, like managing multiple tasks with a small team and a tight budget while making the best use of limited resources. Zoom Workplace is packed with features designed to tackle your busy work, from easy tracking of billable phone calls to automated meeting summaries, allowing you to leave your least favorite tasks behind in 2024.
Check out our 5 reasons why small businesses choose Zoom Workplace to help them do it all!
Explore the benefits
 
 
Zoom Team Chat: Enhanced for streamlined collaboration and communication
New look, same workspace. Zoom Team Chat has been redesigned with new enhancements, offering a more customized and efficient communication hub. The new sidebar design and AI enhancements for Team Chat allow you to easily customize the sidebar and make the most of your chats. Prioritize what matters with options to tailor your chat interface by reordering and pinning tabs.
Zoom Workplace users now have access to the redesigned Zoom Team Chat sidebar. Learn how to make the most of your Team Chat experience!

body:
Wise Decision Maker Guide 
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
Greetings Larry,
In a move set to redefine the generative artificial intelligence (Gen AI) landscape, the Trump administration has signaled a sweeping deregulatory agenda.
 This marks a critical turning point for businesses across industries, compelling them to intensify their adoption of Gen AI
—or risk falling irreparably behind competitors already harnessing its transformative power.
For years, AI has been constrained by layers of regulations, often limiting its commercial applications. However, the new administration aims to tear down these barriers, empowering businesses to deploy generative AI technologies faster and with fewer compliance burdens. 
To learn more, check out 
this
 
blog
.
Read Blog
 
Prefer video to text? See this 
video
 based on the blog:
If you prefer audio, listen to this 
podcast
 based on the blog:
Make Your Voice Heard
Vote in this 
LinkedIn poll
 to contribute to the conversation. I will use the responses to inform my articles in 
Harvard Business Review
, 
Fortune
, and 
Entrepreneur
.
Your Testimonials
You and others who gain value from Disaster Avoidance Experts 
services
 and thought leadership occasionally share testimonials about your experience, such as the one below. You can read more testimonials 
here
.
“Dr. Gleb's presentation was outstanding! Our association hired him to present a one-hour implicit bias training for our members, and he was able to customize the material so it was relevant to all of our attendees. He was very easy to work with and very responsive to all of our emails.
 He was also very engaging during the webinar, and he used polls and personal stories to make sure our attendees were paying attention and engaging in the material.
 I would highly recommend him for any future speaking opportunities!”
Mattea Tavernor
, Conventions & Continuing Education Manager, Illinois State Dental Societ
Schedule a Free Consultation
 
What's Up With Me
Fear and anxiety about the future, with a dollop of hope and optimism. That was the outcome of my conversation with my business partner and wife Agnes Vishnevkin when we discussed the consequences of the surprisingly rapid development of Gen AI, following the recent news about China's DeepSeek and President Trump's "damn the torpedoes – full speed ahead" approach to Gen AI. 
Now, I'm no AI skeptic, I think it's an incredibly powerful tool with world-transforming potential, even more so than nuclear fission. But like nuclear fission, I think we should have some guardrails on it, preferably in advance so we can avoid disasters, rather than waiting until a meltdown. So while I'm hopeful about the positive impact of Gen AI - heck, I'm writing a book about it - I worry about the consequences of a lack of concern about safety. In fact, this valuable technology might be stymied, just like nuclear development was stymied following Three Mile Island, if we don't take steps right now to avoid a Three Mile Island scenario down the line.
Would love to get your feedback on what you found most useful about this edition of the “Wise Decision Maker Guide” - simply reply to this email.
Decisively Yours,
Dr. Gleb
Dr. Gleb Tsipursky
CEO of Disaster Avoidance Experts
PS: Are we connected on LinkedIn? If not, 
please add me
.
Did you miss out on reading any of my bestselling books?
Never Go With Your Gut: How Pioneering Leaders Make the Best Decisions and Avoid Business Disasters
 (Career Press, 2019)
The Blindspots Between Us: How to Overcome Unconscious Cognitive Bias and Build Better Relationships
 
(New Harbinger, 2020)
Returning to the Office and Leading Hybrid and Remote Teams: A Manual on Benchmarking to Best Practices for Competitive Advantage
 
(Intentional Insights, 2021)
Please
 
forward this email
 
to a colleague or friend who might find it helpful.
Protect yourself from decision disasters by signing up for the 
free 
Wise Decision Maker Course
, 
which includes 8 weekly video-based modules.
Let's be safe!
 
👍
Please mark my email address resources@DisasterAvoidanceExperts.com
as 
safe 
following
 
these guidelines
 
to prevent my emails from accidentally going to spam.

Read it here!

or

subject: A couple of articles for your reading pleasure...
body:
Corporate “DEI” is an imperfect vehicle for deeply meaningful ideals
I have not thought or said much about DEI (Diversity, Equity and Inclusion) over the years. Not because I don’t care about the espoused ideals — I suppose I do, rather a lot — but because corporate DEI efforts have always struck me as ineffective and bland; bolted on at best, if not actively compensating for evil behavior. More: 
https://charity.wtf/2025/02/10/corporate-dei-is-an-imperfect-vehicle-for-deeply-meaningful-ideals/
 
The NSA’s “Big Delete”
Today, the National Security Agency (NSA) is planning a "Big Delete" of websites and internal network content that contain any of 27 banned words, including "privilege," "bias," and "inclusion." The "Big Delete," according to an NSA source and internal correspondence reviewed by Popular Information, is creating unintended consequences. More: 
https://popular.info/p/the-nsas-big-delete
 
I’d love to hear your thoughts on these.
 
Chuck
 
Chuck Adams
 
(He/Him)
Chief Executive Officer
LCW

 Terms apply.*
You have through February 21, 2025 to take the survey.
Start survey
Thanks in advance,
– The WeWork team

 This WeWork On Demand 25% Discount offer (“Offer”) is only made available to new and previous WeWork members, who have not been active WeWork members, including WeWork On Demand users who have not booked a WeWork On Demand booking, for at least two (2) months prior to the Offer Redemption Period (“Participants”). Offer redeemable from February 11, 2025 through March 11, 2025 (“Redemption Period”). Offer valid for a discounted price of twenty-five percent (25%) off one (1) WeWork On Demand workspace (“Desk”) or meeting room (“Room”) booking at select WeWork locations; subject to availability, booking, and the 
WeWork On Demand Terms and Conditions.
 Participants must enter the promotional code as provided by WeWork during the checkout process. Promotional code must be entered within the checkout process. In the event you remove the promotional code during the checkout process, no discount shall be applied. Each participant may only take advantage of the Offer once. Offer cannot be applied to previous purchases, is non-transferrable, has no cash value and cannot be redeemed for cash or combined with any other offer. We may modify or terminate the Offer at any time without notice. This Offer is only valid in the United States, United Kingdom, Australia, Belgium, Canada, Ireland, Netherlands, Singapore, and Sweden.

subject: Our first keynote speaker is ready to inspire you
body:
Register for the social impact event of the year and learn from the best
 
 
 
JUST ADDED
Brunch with LeVar Burton, the master of storytelling
 
You might know LeVar Burton from PBS’ 
Reading Rainbow
, or 
Star Trek: The Next Generation
, but did you know he’s also a humanitarian who’s dedicated much of his life to driving global impact?
Can't miss it
Plus attendees will get an exclusive look at 2025 CSR trends from Benevity’s leaders:
 
Benevity’s Chief Impact Officer, 
Sona Khosla
, will present the 2025 State of Corporate Purpose report, which reveals the most important trends and insights that will shape social impact in the year ahead. Learn what you can do to stay ahead of the curve.
 
 
Join Benevity CEO, 
Chris Maloof
, to kick off the week with a look at your impact over the last 12 months and how we’re empowering businesses, employees and customers to rethink how they create positive impact in the world. 
Check the agenda for regular updates
What’s new?
 
Register today!
Don’t miss out on exclusive networking opportunities with hundreds of changemakers, the latest trends from bold brands and inspiration you can take back to your workplace. Purchase by Feb 28. and save $300.
Register now and save
 
Convince your leader to send you to Benevity Live!
Download the letter
 
 
There’s nothing like the in-person experience, but if you can’t make it, our free online pass will still grant lots of great insights. On-demand access for 30 days connects you to selected live-streamed sessions plus a next-day replay of The Goodie Awards. 
Join us online
 
​​ 
Get inspired on social
Contact
      
Forward
      
Privacy Policy
      
Unsubscribe
 
Copyright © 2025. Benevity, Inc. All rights reserved.
#700, 611 Meredith Road NE, Calgary AB T2E 2W5, Canada

subject: Federal Changes Are Here: Why Pay Equity Is More Important Than Ever
body:
What the Trump administration’s executive orders on DEI mean for your pay equity efforts.
 
 
Hi Larry,
 
Federal DEI policies may be shifting, but federal and state pay equity and pay transparency regulations are still in full force. With increased legal scrutiny and new risks — including growing “reverse discrimination” claims —  ensure you are taking a neutral, data-driven approach to pay equity that is legally-compliant.
 
Join us on 
February 13 at 11 a.m. PT
, where Trusaic’s legal experts, Maxfield Marquardt and Nasar Khan, will discuss:.
The latest regulatory shifts and their impact on pay equity
Why a merit-driven pay strategy is essential in today’s legal climate
What actions to take now to reduce risk
This isn’t just another policy update webinar — it’s a must-attend session to navigate the evolving regulatory landscape with confidence. Reserve your spot now. 
Register Now!
 
 
Trusaic, 520 S Grand Ave, Suite 200, Los Angeles, CA 90071, United States, 213-382-1115 
Unsubscribe
 
Manage preferences

subject: 🚨 The Silent Struggle of Virtual Meetings Across Cultures 🌍
body:
Continue reading for better strategies on running global virtual teams.  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hello Larry!
 
🔹
 
How misaligned expectations are costing your team productivity & engagement
 
 
🛑
 Picture this:
It’s 7:00 AM for Maya in New York, midnight for Carlos in Sydney, and midday for Priya in Mumbai. They’re all logging into the same virtual meeting—cameras on, coffee (or tea) in hand. The agenda is set, but something feels 
off
. 
 
🤔
 The Experience:
🔹
 Maya notices that Carlos is unusually quiet, but assumes he has nothing to add.
🔹
 Priya, used to hierarchical decision-making, hesitates to challenge her senior colleague’s idea.
🔹
 Meanwhile, Carlos, exhausted from yet another late-night meeting, wonders why no one values his work-life balance. 
By the time the meeting ends, there’s a false sense of agreement. But in reality, misunderstandings, cultural differences, and time zone fatigue are eroding trust, engagement, and productivity. 
 
⚠️ 
The Problem:
❌
 Critical voices are being left out due to cultural communication norms.
❌
 Employees are disengaging from meetings that don’t accommodate their time zones.
❌
 Decisions are being made with incomplete input, leading to inefficiency and costly mistakes. 
This isn't just a scheduling inconvenience—it’s a 
barrier to inclusion
 that’s quietly affecting retention, innovation, and collaboration. 
 
💡
 The Future You’re Waiting For:
Imagine a workplace where…
✅
 Every employee, regardless of location or cultural background, feels valued and heard.
✅
 Meetings are structured to respect different communication styles and time zones.
✅
 Your global team collaborates effortlessly, leading to stronger, more inclusive decisions. 
 
🎤
  What’s Next:
Stay tuned for my next email, where I’ll share 
actionable strategies
 to transform your virtual meetings into inclusive, high-impact spaces. 
Because when we break these hidden barriers, we unlock 
true global collaboration.
 
🌎✨
 
 
Bye for now, 
Luiza
___________________________________
 
Luiza Dreasher, President and CEO (she/her/hers)
Mastering Cultural Differences 
I work with leaders who want to create a work environment where all employees feel valued and want to stay.
At 
Mastering Cultural Differences LLC,
 we are committed to helping organizations build inclusive, culturally competent workplaces where every individual feels valued and respected. Through highly customized programs, we equip teams with knowledge and skills to help them connect and collaborate more effectively across differences. Any unauthorized review, use, disclosure, or distribution is prohibited. If you received this email in error, please notify the sender immediately and delete it from your system. We respect your privacy. Please note you also have the right to opt out of emails at any time via the link at the bottom of our emails. If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or need assistance managing your personal information, feel free to contact us at: 
www.masteringculturaldifferences.com
 or by sending an email to 
luiza@masteringculturaldifferences.com
.

subject: FW: Resources for Assessing Risk under President Trump's DEI Executive Order from three law firms
body:
From:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Monday, February 10, 2025 6:52 PM
To:
 Office <office@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Resources for Assessing Risk under President Trump's DEI Executive Order from three law firms
 
Hey folks,
 
I wanted to forward along two recordings, from two separate law firms, that spoke to the above. I also just got off the phone with Ryan Estes, associate at DLA Piper law firm to better understand what companies are doing and not. This is his 
article
 on the topic and I attached what DLA has been sending out to some of their clients during this time.
 
My notes are below from our conversation;
-Most companies who have federal money are bending over backwards to not be the first 9 companies.
-Lie vs lead.
-Suggestions being given to corporations to provide same programs to everyone vs certain groups.
-Keep ERG's and BRGs in existence but don't give different amounts of money to different groups.
-Do not use DEI verbiage at all, instead use words like leadership principles, managerial principles, and community engagement
-Hi hypothesis is we are going back to the 90s with what we see in corporations, like a book club.
-Language needs to be squeaky clean.
-All DEI employees will have to now report and be retitled under leadership principles and talent and development.
-Ways to justify focus on hiring certain groups that can be legal; Hire based on Increasing consumer pool. 
-10Ks need to repositioned. Disney just came out with theirs.
-When first 9 companies get named, then more companies will change overnight.
-Memos from Pam Bondi will govern what happens.
-Thousands of employees in Washington got laid off, this is much more serious then a lot of folks think.
-Canceling of contracts will happen and legal cannot do anything about it.
-By May we will see a lot of change.
-Couple months of companies figuring it out.
-Fortune 500 companies want to be conservative now.
-Offer programs across the board (don't offer to just one group)
 
Recording and Deck 1: Thank you for joining the FortneyScott webinar addressing the new Trump Executive Orders.  For your reference, we are providing links to 
the PowerPoint
 and a 
recording of the webinar
.  We will be in touch with future webinars and updates.
Recording and Deck 2: Thank you for attending our recent webinar - we hope you found it useful and engaging. If you were unable to attend, we hope to see you at a future program!
For your reference, we have provided the links below to the recording of the presentation, the PowerPoint slides, and a CLE verification and evaluation form.
Presentation Recording
PowerPoint Presentation
Webinar Attendance Form
 
Ryan is open to being available to you and your clients, so please let me know if you have any questions.
 
Alisa
 
 
Alisa Kolodizner 
(She/Her)
CSMO and Managing Partner
LCW

subject: 5 Things: Chicagoland's Weekly Business Update
body:
Click 
here
 
to view this email in your browser.
 
 
 
 
 
Weekly Business Update 
February 10, 2025
THE EXCHANGE
Attend The Exchange 2025 – Early Bird Registration Now Available for 25% Off 
PRESENTED BY SOUTHWEST AIRLINES
 
Individual tickets for The Exchange 2025 at Soldier Field are now on sale! Act fast and save 25% with promo code EARLYBIRDTIX25—now through February 28. Don’t miss your chance to attend this premier networking event on April 10, where you’ll connect with local businesses, explore activation booths, and enjoy culinary showcase tastings. With just two months to go, now is the best time to secure your spot at a discounted rate!
REGISTER NOW
 
CHICAGO NEWS
How Employers Can Comply with Existing Immigration Regulations while Protecting Their Employees and Their Operations 
PRESENTED BY AMERICAN BUSINESS IMMIGRATION COALITION
 
The American Business Immigration Coalition (ABIC) has outlined three key ways immigration officials may enforce policy: SSA No Match Letters, which flag discrepancies in Social Security records but are not linked to enforcement; Form I-9 Audits, where ICE reviews employee verification records and issues fines for errors; and Worksite ICE Raids, where agents may detain undocumented workers. Knowing how to respond can help protect your business and employees. Stay prepared by reviewing ABIC’s resource guide.
LEARN MORE
 
CHAMBER NEWS
Understanding Tariffs and Their Impact – Let the Chamber Know What Your Business is Expecting
PRESENTED BY THE CHICAGOLAND CHAMBER OF COMMERCE
 
The Chicagoland Chamber of Commerce is interested in understanding how potential tariffs and changes in trade policy might affect your business. Please take a few moments to complete a survey that will help the Chamber check the pulse of its community. Your input will help us gauge how this matter may affect our community and future programming and advocacy.
TAKE SURVEY
 
MEMBER NEWS
Why Young Adults, Especially LGBTQ Individuals, Need a Trust and Powers of Attorney 
PRESENTED BY BRUNING & ASSOCIATES, P.C.
 
Many young adults assume estate planning is only for later in life, but having a trust and powers of attorney is essential—especially for LGBTQ individuals who may face unique legal and familial challenges. In this article, Amanda Decker, Associate Attorney at Bruning & Associates, P.C., breaks down why estate planning matters at any age, how it can protect your assets and loved ones, and what key documents you need to get started. Don’t wait until it’s too late—read now to learn how to take control of your future and ensure your wishes are honored.
LEARN MORE
 
MEMBER NEWS
Haymarket Center Commemorates 50th Anniversary with Logo Design Competition 
PRESENTED BY HAYMARKET CENTER
 
In celebration of its 50th anniversary, Haymarket Center is inviting community members to submit designs for their commemorative logo design competition. The winning design – which will be unveiled at the 50th Anniversary Gala: Celebrating Transformation – will symbolize the spirit of recovery, hope and transformation that Haymarket Center fosters through its life-saving treatment of substance use and mental health disorders and primary care conditions. The competition runs until February 25, 2025. The winner of the contest will receive a $500 prize and two tickets to Haymarket Center’s 50th Anniversary Gala on April 25, 2025.
LEARN MORE
 
Want to showcase your company news, information, products, or services?
 
Chamber members are able to take advantage of a myriad of benefits to help your business grow, including inclusion in this email newsletter. With a broad distribution, you can gain access to a new audience that you may not otherwise be able to reach.
REVIEW BENEFITS
 
 
FOLLOW THE CHAMBER
 
 
 
 
 
WWW.CHICAGOLANDCHAMBER.ORG
The Chicagoland Chamber of Commerce
The Wrigley Building | 410 N Michigan Ave | Suite 900
Chicago, IL 60611
 
Change Your Subscription Preferences
 at any time.

Privacy Policy
.

 I'll be OOO
 
Howdy folks!
 
I'll be out of the office (technically) from this Fri to next Wed (back in the office Thurs. Feb.13). That said, I will be able to answer emails & will be doing work. I just might not be able to respond as quickly as I normally do.
 
I know there are some of you I will be communicating with for urgent matters (Larry & Kaitlin - about the Feb.11 webinar, Catalina - about your replacement). I will be available for anything urgent - just tell me it's urgent, and I'll respond 
🙂
.
 
So while I'm away, I will be available if you need me 
🙂
.
 
Thanks lovely people!
 
 
Nicole Barile

subject: FREE Virtual Event: Affirmative Action and Federal Contractor Compliance
body:
Get a clear road map for managing affirmative action and federal contractor responsibilities. 
 
 
Recent changes in executive orders have created new compliance challenges and raised questions about the future of affirmative action requirements and obligations for federal contractors. As these shifts impact workplace policies and inclusion efforts, leaders must ensure they remain compliant while navigating the complexities of employment law and contractor regulations. 
Join a SHRM expert, two experienced employment and public policy attorneys, and one of the nation’s leading experts on the federal market for a 
FREE
, actionable webinar, “
Diving Deeper into Affirmative Action and Federal Contractor Compliance: Key Insights & Critical Actions,
” on Wednesday, Feb. 12, from 1 p.m. to 2 p.m. EST. You’ll get essential insights tailored to leaders navigating evolving regulations and workforce priorities. 
All registrants will be sent a recording of the webinar for on-demand viewing. 
Plus, attendees will earn 1 PDC toward SHRM-CP
®
 and SHRM-SCP
®
 recertification
.
 
 
REGISTER NOW
 
 
Key Takeaways:
 
 
Clarity on compliance changes
: Understand how the latest executive orders impact policies—without legal jargon.
 
Actionable strategies for success
: Align your policies with federal standards while fostering a culture of inclusion and diversity.
 
Support from trusted resources
: Explore SHRM’s proven tools, including the role of the 
SHRM BEAM
 (Belonging Enhanced by Access through Merit) Framework, to guide your organization through uncertainty.
 
 
 
Meet the Speakers
 
 
 
 
O’Kelly E. McWilliams III
 
 
Partner, Holland & Knight
 
 
O’Kelly E. McWilliams III is an attorney in Holland & Knight’s Washington, DC., office, where he advises clients on the human capital aspects of corporate transactional matters.
 
 
 
 
 
Nick Schacht
 
 
Chief Commercial Officer, SHRM
 
 
Nick Schacht is a seasoned executive with over three decades of experience in professional services, education, and corporate learning and development.
 
 
 
 
 
 
Martina Bradford
 
 
Founder & CEO, Palladian Hill Strategies
 
 
Martina Bradford is a distinguished leader with over 25 years of experience in business, law, and public policy. She has held influential roles, including counsel on two congressional committees.
 
 
 
 
 
Stan Soloway
 
 
President & CEO, Celero Strategies, LLC
 
 
Stan Soloway is regarded as one of the nation’s leading experts on the federal market, the factors and dynamics that drive it, and how to translate expertise into meaningful action.
 
 
 
 
Big Changes Are Here, and SHRM25 Has the Answers! 
Join us at 
SHRM25
—the world’s largest HR conference—happening June 29-July 2 in San Diego. Attend dedicated content tracks on how to navigate executive orders impacting inclusion and diversity, network with your peers and HR leaders, and gain the tools, insights, and connections you need to navigate these changes with confidence.
 
ACT FAST
—
take advantage of early-bird pricing and reserve your spot today. Seats are going fast, and the changes impacting your workforce won’t wait.
 
 
ATTEND SHRM25
 
 
Already a member?
 Our records indicate that the email address l.baker@lcwmail.com isn’t matched to a current membership. Please contact our Customer Experience Team or update your account in the 
MySHRM section
 of the website after you log in.
 
 
 
Connect with us on social!
 
  
  
  
  
 
1800 Duke Street, Alexandria, Virginia 22314 USA 
Contact Us
 | 
shrm.org

l.baker@lcwmail.com
.

subject: Last Chance! Session 1 Starts Wednesday — Sign Up Now.
body:
Bonus: Save $50 and receive a FREE digital copy of the second edition of We Can’t Talk about That at Work.
 
Time is running out! Session 1 of our newest program
 kicks off this Wednesday, February 12, and 
this is your last chance to sign up before it begins.
 
Bonus: Sign up for all three sessions to save $50 and receive a FREE digital copy of the second edition of 
We Can’t Talk about That at Work
.
Sign Up Before It's Too Late
 
We are navigating challenging situations in politics and in the workplace, and we need the ability to manage conflict, distinguish dialogue from debate, and have constructive conversations. You will gain the 
practical tools
, 
proven frameworks
, and 
real-word practices
 to do just that.
 
Your participation in 
We Can't Talk about That at Work! Mastering the Art of Navigating Polarizing Topics
 
is an investment
 that will have big pay offs as we navigate these unchartered waters.
 
Don’t wait — invest in yourself and your team today.
 
Program Sessions Overview 
(And save $50 when you register for all three!)
 
Session 1: Managing the “I” in Inclusive Conversations
February 12, 2025 | $150
Enhance your ability to identify and manage personal triggers in polarizing conversations. Learn metacognition techniques to pause, regulate emotions, and engage constructively—even when discussions get heated.
 
Session 2: Talking About Differences with Humility
February 26, 2025 | $150
Discover how to listen deeply and understand perspectives that differ radically from your own. This session explores the art of dialogue versus debate, focusing on acceptance over agreement and building bridges through shared experiences.
 
Session 3: Bridging the Divide for Mutual Understanding
March 12, 2025 | $150
Build on the skills from the first two sessions to foster mutual respect and empathy. Learn practical techniques to create meaningful connections and transform divisions into opportunities for collaboration and understanding.
Don't Miss Out on This Series!
 
 
Learn from the experts and author of the book, Mary-Frances Winters and Mareisha N. Winters Reese. These interactive sessions will offer actionable insights and collaborative exercises to transform the way you engage in high-stakes discussions.
 
 
 
 
The Winters Group, 8116 South Tryon Street, Ste. B3-260, Charlotte, North Carolina 28273, United States 
Unsubscribe

subject: FW: Feb.11th webinar
body:
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, February 5, 2025 3:52 PM
To:
 Larry Baker <l.baker@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Feb.11th webinar
 
Hey Larry,
 
Thanks again for helping out with the Fb.11th webinar: 
Webinar title:
 Title: Black History Month: A Conversation About What Your Black Colleagues Need From Allies, from 1-1:45pm CST. Kaitlin has set this up in Zoom, so if you need support there, please let her know.
 
I've attached the list of current registrants. 
 
Here's the language that went out inviting people to the webinar:
 
On 
February 11
, we’re hosting 
The Culture Shift: How to Be an Ally to Your Black Colleagues
—a virtual session dedicated to understanding and practicing meaningful allyship in the workplace.
 
During this conversation, we’ll go beyond surface-level ideas to explore research-backed approaches that empower you to:
Take Action:
 Learn practical steps for standing in solidarity with Black colleagues every day.
Build an Inclusive Environment:
 Understand how allyship enhances team culture and increases overall engagement.
Address Common Pitfalls:
 Recognize and navigate the subtle ways biases can surface, and how to respond effectively.
Gain Expert Insights:
 Engage with best practices from seasoned culture and inclusion professionals who have seen real results.
By becoming a more intentional ally, you help shape a supportive, equitable workplace—one where everyone can thrive. If this sounds like the environment you’re aiming for, we’d love to have you join us.
 
Reserve Your Spot
 We look forward to sharing this space with you and exploring tangible ways to make a positive impact. If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out.
----
 
Lastly, if you can promote the Feb.20th session at the end of yours, it would be much appreciated.
That session will be led by Chuck & Andrea & is called 
"Neurodiversity: An Overview of this Cultural Identity in the Workplace."
It's from 12-12:45pm CST.
We don't have a link for it just yet. But since they registered for this event, attendees of your event will automatically get an invite to the next one.
 
Thank you!
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

subject: Ads that scream creativity
body:
Plus: “artifacts” and legacy, mental health and relatability, and AI and doctors. 
February 9, 2025  ·  
View in browser
 
The latest research and ideas from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University
How “Artifacts” Can Help a Family Business Define Its Legacy
 
From a framed dollar bill to an inspiring story, artifacts can transmit a company’s values across generations.
 
Customers Will Pay More for Products That Feature Diversity in Ads
 
When an ad features people of different ages, races, genders, or nationalities, consumers believe the brand offers greater variety and is more creative.
 
How Relatability Promotes Mental Health for Your Team
 
Leaders need to model a healthy mindset to better contribute to the well-being of their teams.
 
From The Archives
Predicting Exchange Rates Is Hard. Could Dusting Off an Old Technique Help?
 
Investors take note: the “real exchange rate” may be a more accurate long-term forecaster than economists thought.
 
From The Archives
Will AI Eventually Replace Doctors?
 
Maybe not entirely. But the doctor–patient relationship is likely to change dramatically.

LinkedIn
.
And listen to our 
podcasts

subject: Exclusive SHRM Webinar: Affirmative Action and Federal Contractor Compliance
body:
Get a clear road map for managing affirmative action and federal contractor responsibilities. 
 
 
Recent changes in executive orders have created new compliance challenges and raised questions about the future of affirmative action requirements and obligations for federal contractors. As these shifts impact workplace policies and inclusion efforts, leaders must ensure they remain compliant while navigating the complexities of employment law and contractor regulations. 
Join a SHRM expert, two experienced employment and public policy attorneys, and one of the nation’s leading experts on the federal market for a 
FREE
, actionable webinar, “
Diving Deeper into Affirmative Action and Federal Contractor Compliance: Key Insights & Critical Actions,
” on Wednesday, Feb. 12, from 1 p.m. to 2 p.m. EST. You’ll get essential insights tailored to leaders navigating evolving regulations and workforce priorities. 
All registrants will be sent a recording of the webinar for on-demand viewing. 
Plus, attendees will earn 1 PDC toward SHRM-CP
®
 and SHRM-SCP
®
 recertification
.
 
 
REGISTER NOW
 
 
Key Takeaways:
 
 
Clarity on compliance changes
: Understand how the latest executive orders impact policies—without legal jargon.
 
Actionable strategies for success
: Align your policies with federal standards while fostering a culture of inclusion and diversity.
 
Support from trusted resources
: Explore SHRM’s proven tools, including the role of the 
SHRM BEAM
 (Belonging Enhanced by Access through Merit) Framework, to guide your organization through uncertainty.
 
 
 
Meet the Speakers
 
 
 
 
O’Kelly E. McWilliams III
 
 
Partner, Holland & Knight
 
 
O’Kelly E. McWilliams III is an attorney in Holland & Knight’s Washington, DC., office, where he advises clients on the human capital aspects of corporate transactional matters.
 
 
 
 
 
Nick Schacht
 
 
Chief Commercial Officer, SHRM
 
 
Nick Schacht is a seasoned executive with over three decades of experience in professional services, education, and corporate learning and development.
 
 
 
 
 
 
Martina Bradford
 
 
Founder & CEO, Palladian Hill Strategies
 
 
Martina Bradford is a distinguished leader with over 25 years of experience in business, law, and public policy. She has held influential roles, including counsel on two congressional committees.
 
 
 
 
 
Stan Soloway
 
 
President & CEO, Celero Strategies, LLC
 
 
Stan Soloway is regarded as one of the nation’s leading experts on the federal market, the factors and dynamics that drive it, and how to translate expertise into meaningful action.
 
 
 
 
Big Changes Are Here, and SHRM25 Has the Answers! 
Join us at 
SHRM25
—the world’s largest HR conference—happening June 29-July 2 in San Diego. Attend dedicated content tracks on how to navigate executive orders impacting inclusion and diversity, network with your peers and HR leaders, and gain the tools, insights, and connections you need to navigate these changes with confidence.
 
ACT FAST
—
take advantage of early-bird pricing and reserve your spot today. Seats are going fast, and the changes impacting your workforce won’t wait.

IDI Assessment Website Migration Starts Soon
The current IDI Assessment Website will be unavailable starting next
 
Wednesday, February 12, 2025
, as we migrate to the new IDI Platform.
This means that all functions related to using the IDI (completing the IDI, ordering, generating IDI Reports, etc.) will 
not
 be available from Wednesday, February 12th until the new IDI Platform launches 
Monday, February 17, 2025
.
Please be sure to notify respondents if they are attempting to complete the IDI during this time. Once the migration has finished, you will be able to send account activation emails to your respondents with active Assessments so they can complete the IDI in the new Platform.
 
Some resources to help you prepare for the new IDI Platform are available in your account’s QA Resources page under 
New IDI Platform Resources.
You can find the previous emails sent here:
Announcement & Overview of Features
Original Launch Date & Migration Details
February 17th Launch Date 
All QA resources will move to the IDI Help Center once the newe Platform launches. To access all QA-specific resources and articles, you will need to sign into the IDI Help Center (powered by Zendesk), which you can do by click at the button below. Once signed in, you can track the articles you view and see the status of any support inquiries.
If you have emailed us before, you may already have an account. Signing up will let you know if you need to create an account or simply change your password. 
Sign Up for the IDI Help Center
Your login credentials for the IDI Help Center are 
separate
 from the new IDI Platform. 
Register for Upcoming Platform Events
All upcoming Q&A sessions are listed in Eventbrite.
Click below for details on all upcoming IDI Platform events.
Register
 
Questions?
Please reach out to us: 
support@idiinventory.com
View email in browser
Copyright (C) 2025 IDI, LLC. All rights reserved.
You are receiving this email because you are listed within the IDI, LLC database as an IDI Qualified Administrator or are attending an upcoming IDI Qualifying Seminar. These are only meant for important updates, so please do not unsubscribe. 
Our mailing address is:
IDI, LLC 2915 Olney Sandy Spring Road Suite D Olney, MD 20832-3503 USA 
Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can 
update your preferences
 or 
unsubscribe
